Title: ‘Work on bridge parallel to Gandhi Setu to start this year’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Nand Kishore Yadav

PATNA: State road construction minister Nand Kishore Yadav said on Thursday that construction work on a new bridge parallel to Mahatma Gandhi Setu in Patna will start this year.

Chairing a meeting to review the ongoing national highways projects in Bihar, he said bids have been submitted by seven firms for construction of the new bridge. “The bidding process is likely to be completed by the end of this month. We are expecting the work to commence this year itself,” Nand Kishore told TOI.

The total length of the new bridge from Zero Miles in Patna to Ramashish Chowk in Hajipur is 14.5 kilometres. However, the length of superstructure of the bridge, excluding the approach road, is 5.63km.

The bridge over river Ganga is proposed to be constructed by utilizing funds to the tune of Rs2,900 crore over a period of 48 months. It is a part of PM Narendra Modi’s special package for Bihar, which he had announced prior to state assembly elections in 2015.

The minister reviewed the progress of Patna ring road, another component of the PM’s special package. “The DPR for a four-lane bridge over the Ganga along Patna under the ring road project is ready and officials of National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) have been asked to commence the bidding process for the same,” he said.

The proposed alignment of the 65km-long Patna ring road is Bihta-Naubatpur-Dumri- Daniyawa-Kachchi Dargah-Bidupur- Hajipur-Sonepur-Digha-Bihta. “The work on ring road project is being taken in different segments for which DPR has been prepared and bidding process will commence soon,” Nand Kishore said.

The minister also claimed that officials concerned have been asked to get the approval for commencing construction of a new bridge parallel to Vikramshila Setu on river Ganga in Bhagalpur. “The work on the bridge parallel to Vikramshila Setu is also targeted to commence this year,” he said.

Sources said the length of the new bridge will be 4.367km, while that of its approach road will be 0.969km from Bhagalpur-end and 8.964km from Naugachia side. It is proposed to be constructed utilizing funds to the tune of Rs1726 crore.

The RCD minister also said bids have been received for reconstruction of much-delayed Patna-Gaya-Dobhi NH-83 in three phases.

Title: Patna University may sign MoU with IIPS to study Bihar’s demography
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Patna University

PATNA: The Population Research Centre (PRC) of Patna University (PU) is likely to sign an MoU with the International Institute of Population Sciences (IIPS), Mumbai, for undertaking collaborative studies on demography. A proposal to this effect was advanced by PU vice-chancellor Rash Bihari Prasad Singh while addressing a three-day national seminar on ‘Population, health and sustainable development goals: performance and prioritizing policies’ jointly organized by IIPS and PU at Wheeler Senate House here on Thursday.

Singh said population issues assume greater significance to the modern societal development as the demography is likely to set the destiny of the 21st century India. Ever-increasing population along with the rising greed of human beings is creating imbalances in nature. Consequently, nature has started reacting adversely. We have already started facing the vagaries of nature in the shape of global warming, climate change, sea level rise, droughts and floods, he said.

Inaugurating the seminar, state education minister Krishna Nandan Prasad Verma said population explosion is proving to be the biggest bottleneck in way of national development and pleaded for effective steps to check its exponential growth. He said that even though Bihar was considered to be an educationally backward state, the Nitish government has, of late, initiated several steps to improve the literacy rate and bring back the dropouts to schools. Incentives were being provided to unmarried girls who pass Intermediate or graduation examination.

The minister said it has been observed that late marriage by educated boys and girls leads to family welfare and population control. The minister released the fact sheet of IIPS-sponsored project on ‘Cause and consequences of out migration from middle Ganga plain’.

IIPS director K S James said the seminar would discuss among other issues the migration of people from Bihar and Uttar Pradesh and find ways to stop this ever-increasing problem. The seminar would also have a special session on health and environment wherein the experts would discuss in detail the effects of deteriorating environment on human health.

PU pro-VC Dolly Sinha said India’s economy is heavily burdened with the mounting pressure of population explosion and no positive development is possible without have a check on population growth. It is a paradox that even though our country accounts for only 2.4% of the world’s surface area, it has to support world’s 17.5% population, she added.

Seminar coordinator D A Nagadeva presented the details of technical sessions to be held in three days. PRC joint director Dilip Kumar proposed a vote of thanks.

Title: Futab writes to I-T dept, clarifies on PF deductions in colleges and universities
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

PATNA: The reported dispute over the validity of Provident Fund accounts of universities and colleges, as raised recently by the Income Tax department, is likely to be resolved soon.

In a rejoinder to the letter of I-T department, the Federation of University Teachers Associations of Bihar (Futab) on Thursday submitted that the teachers and non-teaching staff of universities and colleges are governed by two Acts — Patna University Act, 1976 and Bihar State Universities Act, 1976 — and almost common service statutes, including the retirement benefit statute.

Referring to the demand for the government gazette notification, Futab working president Kanhaiya Bahadur Sinha and general secretary Sanjay Kumar Singh, MLC, said these provisions are in operation since 1960 with amendment in 1976 and certain changes thereafter. They further said as the grants are released to the universities from the consolidated fund of the state government, the PF contributions are from these funds only.

They urged the I-T authorities to procure a copy of the Manual of University Laws for referring to all these issues concerning PF, etc as that is also relied upon by the Patna high court and the Supreme Court.

Earlier, a letter from the I-T department to colleges had refused to entertain the PF deductions being made for teachers and non-teaching staff and disallowed any relief under Section 80C of the I-T Act, 1960. It had also disallowed any claim made by the university and college staff under Section 10 of the I-T Act on the interest earned on PF.

The letter created a flutter in the academic circles which has been enjoying this benefit for the last several decades.

Under the existing practice, the college opens a separate joint savings bank account of each employee with the head of the institution, where 10% of the employee’s salary and 10% of the employer’s contribution are deposited as PF contributions. The interest earned on the savings bank account is earned by the respective employee for the said PF deposit.

Futab leaders had written to the I-T authorities that there was nothing wrong with the PF deductions in colleges and universities, as all these accounts were with nationalized banks and have been declared equivalent to government PF accounts as per the provisions of university Acts and statutes.

Title: Radio waves continue to woo city residents
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

PATNA: As the UN-designated World Radio Day was celebrated globally on Thursday, Patna affirmed its faith on the good old radio, which has not faded away even in the age of internet, television and artificial intelligence-based Alexa.

The waves are now alive with a different kind of sound that the young generation can identify with. Youngsters in the city claimed that they mostly listen to new FM channels, while middle-aged and senior citizens expressed their love for Vividh Bharti and other traditional radio channels.

Old-timers in the city mourned the end of a service that had become almost a habit over the decades. “I was an avid listener of BBC Hindi radio for over 50 years. Its sudden shut has left me disappointed,” said 65-year-old Manorma Devi, a resident of Saguna Mor.

Seema Roy, a professor of media education at a private college, said, radio connects people in a way other media cannot. “New radio stations may be liked by youngsters, but for me the old channels will remain evergreen. They are so soothing that I go back to the old times,” she added.

A large section of youngsters, on the other hand, claimed they aren't much interested in listening to traditional radio anymore. “Radio is out of style now. From news to songs and comedy shows to movies, almost everything is visually available on television and mobile phones,” said Komal Sharma, a resident of Danapur.

Saguna More resident Amit Kumar said, “When I was growing up, I used to listen to Vividh Bharti and several other radio channels. However, after a certain point of time the programmes and songs became quite boring for me.”

Experts on the other hand, claimed that radio continues to be reach more audience than social media and other modes of mass media. “As per a survey conducted by a private agency in 2018, around 86% of people in metro cities listened to radio, while 83% preferred social media,” said an executive at a private radio FM channel in the city wishing anonymity.

Officials at Akashvani, Patna, said the number of their listeners has remained largely unaffected despite the advent of new technologies. “Radio services like Akashvani and Vividh Bharti understand the needs of the audience unlike the new stations, who are more into marketing and publicity. Just because, they don’t spend time in increasing their audience, it doesn’t mean that people don’t listen to them. The ‘Rasmanjari’ programme on radio has been an all-time favourite and people listen to it with utmost dedication,” an official at Akashvani said.

Title: Kutch varsity pilots global study on ‘Mars-like environ’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

cap

Rajkot: Krantiguru Shyamji Krishna Varma Kutch University is on a Mars Mission of its own. In association of many institutes of higher learning, including renowned universities across the world that have links with NASA, the Kutch University is undertaking various research on the red planet.

The varsity got this out-of-the-universe chance, thanks to the scientists who discovered similarities in soil, rocks and mountains of Kutch with that of Mars.

A team of Canada’s University of New Brunswick’s earth science department, under the leadership of Prof John Spray, visited the Kutch University recently. Spray, who had developed the Apex particle that had been fitted on NASA’s Mars rover, was working for NASA’s Jet propulsion laboratory.

Spray’s instrument was used to capture images of Martian soil and rocks and also analyze its chemical formation on the spot.

Talking to TOI, professor M G Thakkar, HoD, earth and environmental science in Kutch University said: “The students of our department will benefit in the future from the research done by NASA and it’s associate institutes in various countries about Mars. Based on the satellite images, we believe that the same kind of soil and rocks exist on Mars too which will prove useful for analysis.”

According to the varsity, the students get assignments to find out sites in Kutch that are topographically similar to that of Mars and thereafter do geological analysis of its geological components. According to the scientists, sites like the Great Rann of Kutch are similar to Mars. They are also studying the salinity of these sites in comparison with Mars.

A few other universities which are part of the research project, have also visited Kutch University in the last few years.

The varsity has also got a project of ISRO to do research on NASA’s geography.

Elaborating on it, Thakkar said, “A student of our department is researching on the ISRO project that includes geographical research of Mars-like sites in Kutch.”

The study includes similar river system, gorges, mountains, volcanic mountains among others. ISRO is providing us satellite images for this study, he added.

Title: Quack arrested for running ‘clinic’ in Tirupattur village
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Tirupattur: The Tirupattur district administration officials on Thursday arrested a 48-year-old quack running a ‘ clinic ’ at Periyakannalapatti near Kandhili panchayat union in the district on Thursday.

A police officer said that following multiple complaints to Tiruvannamalai collector M P Sivan Arul on a quack running a clinic in the village for the past four years, a team of revenue and public health officials visited the village and caught the quack red-handed while he was in the clinic. Inquiries by the officials identified the quack as Ravichandran, 48, of Periyakannalapatti. Ravichandran, who had completed Class XII, was earlier working as an office assistant at a pharmacy shop and had four years ago set up the clinic in his hometown.

Health department officials with the help of Kandhili police, who seized medical equipment including stethoscope, syringes and drugs from the clinic, handed over Ravichandran to the Kandhili police station. Further investigations are on. TNN

Title: GAVS, Premier Inc partner for AI-driven tech, security solutions
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Chennai: GAVS Technologies on Thursday said that it has partnered with US-based healthcare improvement company Premier Inc., to provide AI-driven information technology (IT) and security operations to healthcare organisations in the US. This joint venture will be named as Long 80 LLC.

“Moving from a vendor-only model with GAVS towards a collaborative model through Long 80 will expand our current technology portfolio, and enable to offer GAVS’ technology, digital transformation and data security services and solutions to US healthcare organizations,” said Leigh Anderson, president of Performance Services, Premier. GAVS has served as a managed service and technology staff supplementation vendor for Premier in the last three years and aims to market and support their development capability.Sumit Ganguli, CEO of GAVS Technologies said “We are committed to providing technology and solutions to support the business imperatives of the US healthcare providers.”

Title: Uber may become a billboard for ads
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Rachel Chitra | TNN

Bengaluru: Uber India aims to start its own advertising and branding wing, so that it can better monetise users and show them ads. Uber’s move parallels that of e-tailers Amazon and Flipkart, which have started monetising their web traffic through digital advertising.

To start its own advertising line, Uber India’s board met on January 29 in Noida and passed a resolution to the same effect. Uber India said in filings, sourced by Paper.vc , that it intends to have an omni-channel approach and advertise through electronic display boards in cabs, the internet, television and other means.

“Currently advertising opportunities are being offered only on cars,’’ said an Uber spokesperson. “Uber India is set to become yet another marketplace for media buying and selling as the ride-hailing company opens itself and its collaterals up to advertising. The Uber app and other digital properties owned by Uber could be monetised for marketing activities, since the brand has a significant digital footprint,” said Paper.vc analyst Nikhil Kanekal.

Title: Mangalore Airport: Gold worth Rs 9.4 lakh seized at Mangaluru airport
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Gold seized was concealed inside a rechargeable emergency light and solar sensor wall light

Title: Care chief S B Mainak steps down after Sebi nudge
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

(Representative image)

MUMBAI: Care Ratings chairman S B Mainak has stepped down after the markets regulator sought his removal.

The rating agency in a stock exchange filing said Mainak, independent director of the company, resigned with effect from February 11 due to personal reasons. On Wednesday, ET had reported that Sebi had asked Care Ratings in a letter to sack chairman Mainak after a forensic report said he asked staff to hold back ratings.

The rating agency’s share price fell nearly 7% to Rs 543 on Thursday. The Sebi investigation is understood to have been undertaken following complaints by a whistleblower. The complaint and the subsequent investigation is understood to have gone beyond IL&FS and covered other rating actions.

Mainak was inducted on to the board of the company and elected chairman when he was still managing director of LIC in August 2015. LIC is also the single largest shareholder in CARE Ratings. He was part of the government-appointed board for restructuring of Satyam.

In December 2019, Sebi had slapped a penalty of Rs 25 lakh each on Care Ratings, ICRA and India Ratings for “lethargic indifference and needless procrastination and laxity.” Subsequently, the rating agencies informed the stock exchange they had received show-cause notices from the regulator seeking reasons why the penalty should not be enhanced.

Title: Kolkata Metro: Kolkata waits for full East-West Metro run by 2022
Content:
A decorated East-West Metro rake gears up for its inaugural run on Thursday

KOLKATA: The East-West Metro will run the entire 16.6km stretch from Sector V to Howrah Maidan in two years, said Railway minister Piyush Goyal after flagging off the first train for the truncated 5km section on Thursday. Another 1km will be added in three-four months when services get extended to Phoolbagan. The commercial services on the new line will begin at 8am on Valentine’s Day. Keeping the occasion in mind, Metro officials, led by principal chief operations manager (PCOM) Satyaki Nath, will distribute rose buds to the first 50 commuters. The passenger count, however, is likely to be in the thousands.Salt Lake residents were excited to finally be on the Metro map and some managed to take the inaugural ride on Thursday. Over the next few days, rail officials expect a decent turnout. The commuter count, though, will reach its full potential only when the entire line becomes operational. That, Goyal said, would happen in two years.“I think we can start the Howrah end in two years. If we get local support, the entire 16km line can be dedicated to Kolkata’s service. Babul Supriyo has inspected the tunnel under the river and I am authorizing him to review the project on my behalf. He and Metro GM Manoj Joshi will review the project every month and we shall drive it ahead with full vigour,” he said.The minister also spoke on how crucial the state’s cooperation was to expedite the four other Metro lines that are under construction. “I have been handed a huge list of bottlenecks, land logjams and issues with the state coming in the way of these projects. I hope we get full cooperation from the state in completing the other Metro projects,” he said.Mayor Firhad Hakim said the state had always extended help in resolving land issues related to Metro with chief minister Mamata Banerjee stepping in to fast-track the projects she had initiated as Railway minister a decade ago.Aprita Bhuniya was one of the few who hopped on for the inaugural ride. “For now, it will be a fun ride. But I’m glad the services are starting,” she said.KMRC MD Manas Sarkar believes this Metro line, when fully operational, will change the lives of lakhs. “Some 36 years after the country’s first Metro line, Kolkata has got the second one. This is a historic moment,” he said.While the wait for this corridor has been long, it has meant leapfrogging old technologies to get one of the most advanced systems. East-West Metro is equipped with communication-based train control system, which will guide the rakes.“When the full stretch starts operating, around 8 lakh people will take the trains daily,” Manoj Joshi said.

Title: Bihar: 2-year-old shot, woman shot at in Kaimur
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Enraged over his elder sister’s intercaste marriage, a 20-year-old youth shot dead his two-year-old niece and critically injured his sister in Kaimur district on Wednesday evening.

The victim, Santoshi Devi (22), is battling for her life in a trauma centre in Varanasi. The assailant, Chakra Sen, a resident of Madurna village under the Chainpur police station area in Kaimur district, is absconding after the incident.

The incident took place around 5.30 pm at Okhra Chowk under the Chainpur police station area when Santoshi along with her minor daughter was returning home from Chainpur market. Chakra accosted his sister and fired at her. The bullet hit the minor girl who died on the spot. Chakra then pumped a bullet into Santoshi’s body and fled the spot on his motorbike. “The assailant left the site of occurrence in a huff thinking that she might have died,” Chainpur police station SHO Santosh Kumar told this newspaper on Thursday.

The injured was rushed to the local primary health centre from where she was referred to Varanasi, where her condition is stated to be critical. “She is undergoing treatment at a trauma centre. We are trying our level-best to save her life,” the SHO said adding that the accused is at large.

In her statement, Santoshi said that her younger brother was not happy with her marriage to Birju Kushwaha, who is from a different caste. “He had earlier threatened me with dire consequences. My husband is a resident of the same village, which I belong,” the SHO quoted the survivor as saying.

Santoshi, who owns a beauty parlour at Chainpur Bazaar, used to return home after closing her shop everyday. “On finding her alone at a deserted place, Chakra fired at her causing grievous injuries and killing her minor daughter. While the girl died on the spot, her mother is struggling for her life in the hospital,” the SHO added.

Earlier, Kaimur SP Dilnawaz Ahmad said raids have been intensified to arrest the accused.

Title: Shun RJD image of ‘Muslims and Yadavs’ party: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

PATNA: RJD seems to have started playing its caste card before the upcoming assembly elections in Bihar . Incarcerated RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son Tejashwi Prasad Yadav on Thursday asked his party functionaries to break their image of a party associated with ‘Muslims and Yadavs’ and focus on other castes as well.

He was addressing the newly elected state executive members at 10, Circular Road bungalow. In a first, RJD introduced 27% quota for extremely backward caste candidates (EBCs) and 18% for the Dalits in the selection of district presidents and state executive members. Political observers claimed that such moves can be seen as a tactics to woo Dalit and EBC voters from the ruling NDA.

“Our image has been made as if we are party of only Muslims and Yadavs. But Tejashwi ji has asked to break this stereotype and tell people that we are party of A to Z and not M-Y,” said an RJD functionary.

Tejashwi was also particular about his party members’ behaviour in public and cautioned them to be disciplined and respect each other.

Total 22 vice-presidents, 102 general secretaries, 75 secretaries, one treasurer and one secretary general have recently been inducted in the state executive committee of RJD. Party’s spokesperson Mritunjay Tiwari, after attending the meeting, said: “Our team headed by Tejashwi ji is ready. We have been given the responsibility and will start the work at booth level.”

While the meeting was going on for around four hours, many old RJD functionaries were creating ruckus outside the venue for not been inducting them into the new team.

One such functionary, Arun Kumar Purbey from Madhubani said: “We have not got any place, even though we are associated with RJD since the beginning.”

Ajay Chopra said he was dedicated to the party, still he was not called for the meeting. “Even today, I am not being allowed to enter inside,” he said.

Sources said to avoid any embarrassment, newly elected members were informed personally about their selection on Thursday night. However, party state general secretary Chirtanjan Gagan said: “RJD is a big party and when new people are given chance, old ones will definitely be upset. But still many of the old functionaries will be included in different cells of the party.”

Title: Sector V Metro inauguration: ‘Proud to be part of this journey’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Dipak Kumar in the first East-West Metro rake that made the 5km run

KOLKATA: The first East-West Metro train that rolled out of the Sector V station at 5.10pm on Thursday was driven by 32-year-old Dipak Kumar — a resident of Lakkhisarai in Bihar — who has been a mortorman for more than a decade. He helmed a rake along the full 5km stretch from Sector V to Salt Lake stadium, while railway minister Piyush Goyal followed in another rake.

“I am proud to be a part of this landmark journey,” Kumar said at the end of the ride.

In May 2018, Kumar, along with four others, were taken out of the North-South services and inducted into a training programme for the East-West Metro. The team went through extensive training — organized by the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation and the Hyderabad Metro Rail Corporation — to get acquainted with the new BEML trains. Along with S A Ansari — also from Kolkata — Kumar emerged as one of the best.

For Thursday’s inauguration, two rakes were kept ready. Kumar started the day at 6.19pm by driving the inaugural rake from the Central Park depot to the Sector V station, where it was flagged off by Goyal. His colleague Ansari drove the second rake that carried Goyal till the City Centre station. “My parents were anxiously waiting for this day. They know that I am among the first batch of drivers who will run the East-West Metro rakes. They are proud and excited,” Kumar told TOI.

East-West Metro trains run on a communication-based train control and signalling system. The latter has no posts or fixed blocks. The running trains pick up signals from the tracks, which open for a train only after the earlier train has moved. If the tracks ahead are clogged, the train will automatically come to a halt.

Trains on the North-South route run on a protection and warning system that makes them stop only if the signal is red.

Title: Kerala: Accident leads to hawala cash seizure
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

A quotation gang hijacked the auto carrying Rs 3.25cr money, but the vehicle overturned at Valiyaparamba,landi... Read More

MALAPPURAM: Kottakkal police on Thursday seized Rs 3.25 crore of unaccounted money from an autorickshaw and arrested two members of a quotation gang. The money was recovered after the auto overturned while a quotation gang was attempting to loot the hawala money transported in the vehicle at Valiyaparamba.

The arrested were identified as Shafeeq, 20, and Ismail, 26, natives of Ottumpuram near Tanur in Malappuram district. The search for the auto driver is on.

According to police, the incident occurred around 8am on Thursday. The hawala money was being transported from Perinthalmanna to Kottakkal in an autorickshaw. The quotation gang in a car waylaid the auto at Padapparambu near Kottakal and bundled off the auto driver into the car. Two of the gang members took over the control of the auto, the rest drove away with the car.

After a short distance, the speeding auto overturned at Valiyaparamba. Local residents noticed the cash kept in a hidden chamber under the rear seat of the overturned autorickshaw and informed police.

C Yusuf, circle inspector of Kottakkal police, said the gang might have had links with those transporting hawala money. The gang had a credible piece of information regarding the transportation of money and conspired to loot the money after abducting the auto driver. “The accused who have been arrested and those who transported money in the auto are members of hawala money-distribution rackets which are active in the district. We have started a detailed investigation on the source of such a huge amount of money and the role of the similar financial dealings of the gang,” the inspector said.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: BJP ignored Lord Ram in Orchha, says minister Brijendra Singh Rathore
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

The government is planning ‘Namaste Orchha’ to attract touruists in the holy city.

BHOPAL: As the state government develops Orchha — famous for its Ram Raja temple — into a big religious and heritage destination, a Congress minister on Wednesday said the BJP government “ignored” the city of Ram and His legend for 15 years.

With barely one month left for ‘Namaste Orchha’, an event planed by the government to attract people in the holy city situated on the banks of river Betwa, commercial tax minister Brijendra Singh Rathore inaugurated development projects and criticised the erstwhile BJP government.

Rathore, who is also the Prithvipur MLA, said BJP indulges in “double talk and duplicity”. He said BJP on one hand plays politics using the name of Lord Ram but when it comes to serving the God, it ignores Him.

BJP spokesman Rajneesh Agrawal said, “Our party had worked a lot on the tourist centres of Bundelkhand, including Orchha, making MP a tourist hub. I will ask the government to carry forward these works and not indulge in politics.”

“Look at the works done by our government in the past one year”, Rathore said, highlighting the state of the road and renovation of temples among others.

The minister performed ‘bhumi pujan’ for the construction of a road worth Rs8 crore in Orchha.

Besides its ambitious Ram Van Gaman Path project to push its soft Hindutva agenda, the Kamal Nath government plans to turn Orchha into a major tourist destination.

The government will start Betwa Aarti — on the lines of the famous Ganga Aarti in Varanasi — and develop the Ram Raja temple as well.

Situated in Niwari district, temple town Orchha is about 320 kilometres from Bhopal and is known as the ‘second Ayodhya’. A guard of honour is accorded every day to the deity by police personnel deputed at the temple for this one-of-a-kind ritual. The legend in Orchha is that Lord Ram comes here in the morning and goes back to Ayodhya at night.

Chief secretary S R Mohanty visited Orchha twice recently and reviewed plans for its development.

Title: SATHI: A DST initiative to promote research, start ups
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Varanasi: Sophisticated Analytical & Technical Help Institute ( SATHI ) Centre, a unique scheme launched by the department of science & technology (DST) to address the need for building a shared, professionally managed and strong science and technology infrastructure, has been established in Banaras Hindu University (BHU).

BHU vice-chancellor Prof Rakesh Bhatnagar, addressing a press conference recently, said that he SATHI Centre, established at a cost of Rs 125 crore sanctioned by DST, will act as the major node of a unique interdependent ecosystem in the state-of-art Central Discovery Centre, which has come up in a six-floor building, to nurture innovation, entrepreneurship and start-ups under one roof. The Central Discovery Centre (CDC) is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities for research in basic and applied sciences.

The centre will provide centralised facilities and guidance to promote innovation in BHU and also to motivate researchers of other institutions of the region. It will provide a platform for developing and using new technologies, and provide high quality analytical services to Indian industry for which they generally depend on institutions abroad. The revenue generated through quality services will be used for running the facilities in self-sustaining manner.

Under the first phase the DST has set up three such centres in the country, one each at IIT (BHU), IIT Kharagpur and IIT Delhi. The department has planned to set up five SATHI Centres every year for the next four years. According to the DST guidelines, external users (other than the host institutes) can use the SATHI facilities for 80% of their available time while the rest 20% of the available time will be used by the users of the host institute. The usage of the facility will be guided by the basic principle of maximum and effective utilization and accessibility to all. The facilities provided by the SATHI may be utilised by any user or organization at nominal charges.

The VC said that the Institute of Management Studies has been selected as a part of the prestigious ATAL Innovation Centre of NITI Aayog under the aegis of which an incubator -AIC-Mahamana Foundation for Innovation and Entrepreneurship has been established in association with the Bombay Stock Exchange Institute, Mumbai in the Central Discovery Centre.

The incubator has been set up to encourage youth and entrepreneurs to find solutions to the real problems, promote start-ups, create job opportunities and assist the government’s vision of Start Up India. The incubator will help in executing the mission especially in the area of technology, smart cities, clean water, green technology, waste management, citizen services, defence and other areas for social inclusiveness, innovation and job creation. University has been sanctioned Rs 10 crore for the centre and at present 10 people are being incubated in the centre.

Title: PC shipments in ‘19 at a 6-yr high on mega deals: IDC
Content: Chennai: Spurred by mega deals in government-driven education projects and corporates upgrading to Windows 10, personal computer shipments saw a 6-year high in 2019.A report from global research firm the International Data Corporation shows that 2019 saw a year-on-year growth of 18.5% in the category with a total of 11 million shipments made during the period. The previous year saw 9.3 million units shipped. The October-December quarter saw a 16.5% YoY growth with a total of 2.3 million shipments. While the commercial segment brought volumes to the table, the consumer segment that saw a fall in 5 consecutive quarters grew 4.6% in the quarter, shipping around 9.5 lakh units, the report added.“While large businesses were the volume driver, vendors invested in building new teams, exploring new channels, and educating the customers to tap the SMB segment,” says Bharath Shenoy, market analyst, PC, IDC India. Among categories, the gaming segment grew at 51.1% YoY. While most of the vendors increased their shipments in the gaming segment, Asus stood out as a leading vendor with one in every four notebooks shipped being a gaming one from the vendor in 2019. Notebook PCs too saw a growth.Being thinner and lighter with enhanced mobility features, they are increasingly getting preference from the consumers, education sub verticals, and enterprises. The segment saw a 67.7% category share.All top brands saw a growth in the number of shipments. For the whole year, Lenovo saw an 83% jump in growth to 3.5 million units in 2019.HP India shipped 2.9 million units with a strong growth in the enterprise segment, the report added. “We have seen growth from all segments including retail, commercial and SMBs. We have seen improved consumer sentiment and that is reflected in overall growth numbers of PCs, said Vickram Bedi, senior director, personal systems, HP Inc. India.

Title: Clear drains in a month: DM
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

PATNA: District magistrate Kumar Ravi on Thursday tasked Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC) to clear all drains within a month and ensure there is no reverse flow of water from the drainage pumping stations. He also said a fresh drive will be started on Friday to remove leftover structures on the drains.

During a review meeting with PMC and Bihar Urban Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (BUIDCO) officials to tackle waterlogging problem, Ravi asked them to work in coordination. He also tasked the superintendent engineer to start the cleaning work of Badshahi nullah by this month end.

The DM referred to unprecedented rainfall last year and told PMC to enhance the capacity of existing drains by clearing and repairing them properly. When PMC commissioner Amit Kumar Pandey said the civic body was constructing additional 73 drains to avoid waterlogging in the city, Ravi asked him to get those ready by May-end.

BUIDCO managing director Chandrashekhar Singh said they were procuring 12 additional diesel pumps to be used in the DPS. Presently there are 39 DPS with 134 functional pumps with total capacity of 22,135hp. Chandrashakhar further said a consultant will be roped in to prepare drainage plan of areas falling in the PMC, Phulwarisharif, Danapur and Khagaul areas.

Ravi asked the managing director of Patna Electricity Supply Undertaking to ensure dedicated transformer at all the DPSs by February-end. The high-level committee formed by the government previous year to review the then waterlogging issue had advised for uninterrupted power supply at DPSs and better voltage.

It was also discussed to prepare a detailed project report of renovation of the 3km-long drain from Danapur Sainik Colony to Ghurdaur Road. It has been found that half the drain has been encroached by road and the rest half has not been cleared. The new DPR will be made in such a way that it connects this drain with another reinforced cement concrete (RCC) drain in Danapur.

Ravi said magistrates will inspect the work done in May and action will be taken against those who do not carry out their duty properly.

Title: Cong, RJD deny talks with PK
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

PATNA: Speculations continue over the role of poll strategist Prashant Kishor in the upcoming assembly elections in Bihar, following the success of his poll management firm I-PAC in New Delhi elections.

Kishor’s political advocacy group I- PAC, which handled Narendra Modi’s campaign in 2014 Lok Sabha elections and Nitish Kumar’s candidature while working for Grand Alliance in Bihar in 2015 assembly elections, has a fully-functional office in Patna. He is scheduled to arrive here on February 18, a day after formation of Kejriwal government in New Delhi for the third term.

While Congress and RJD functionaries have claimed they are not in talks with Kishor, who was recently expelled from the JD (U), Vikassheel Insan Party (VIP) founder Mukesh Sahni said, “Most of the opposition parties in Bihar are in contact with Kishor.”

“Kishor and Mahagathbandhan, both have a common aim that is to defeat the NDA. Whether it is Tejashwiji, Kushwahaji, Manjhiji or I, we all are talking to him. A blue print is being prepared and it depends on Kishor whether he will join any of the GA parties, AAP or float his own party or manage our election campaign,” Sahni said.

When asked whether Kishor will be helping Congress in Bihar for the upcoming assembly election or will join the party, state Congress incharge Shaktisingh Gohil said on Wednesday: “Till date there has been no discussion in this regard. However, our party is open to all and we welcome each and every one.”

Similar views were expressed by Tejashwi Prasad Yadav on Wednesday. “Why should we talk about any particular person? There are hundreds such agencies. Moreover, we do not hire professionals,” he told reporters.

However, just a couple of week ago, Tej Pratap welcomed Kishor, who was expelled from JD (U) on January 29.

Title: Hotels, cafés make special arrangements
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

PATNA: Patnaites are ready to celebrate Valentine's Day with their partners on Friday. While some will eat a candlelight dinner together, others will purchase memorable gifts for their loved ones.

Hotspots like coffee shops, malls, restaurants, hotels and clubs in the city have also geared themselves up for V-Day. A number of them have been adorned with decorative items and balloons that are red in colour. “We have decorated the café with red and white balloons and replaced the normal cushions with heart-shaped ones,” Mrunal Singh, the manager of a coffee shop on Boring Road, told this newspaper on Thursday.

The owner of a restaurant on Jagdeo Path, Rishi Sharma, said, “We have made special arrangements for the couples, who come here on V-Day.”

Hotels will also conduct events for love birds on Friday. The manager of a hotel on Fraser Road said, “We will have couple dance performances and songs at a function that will begin at 6pm and continue till midnight. Those interested can buy online passes and enjoy the celebrations with unlimited food.”

Other popular hangouts for couples — Patna zoo and Rajdhani Vatika — are likely to witness huge footfalls on Valentine’s Day . Jagdeo Path resident Shreya Sinha said, “The zoo has always been my favourite spot for celebrating V-Day.”

Meanwhile, many youngsters were spotted buying gifts for their partners on the eve of V-Day. Yash Singh, who was present at a shop near Income Tax roundabout, said, “I have bought a watch, soft toys, and flowers for my girlfriend. I will also give her a handwritten letter.”

Title: Vedantu raises $24 million in series C extension round
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Chennai: Live tutoring platform Vedantu on Thursday said that it has raised $24 million as part of its series C extension round led by GGV Capital with participation from existing investors. This was in addition to the $42 million raised in August 2019, taking the total series C round to $66 million. Vedantu’s total fund raise till date stands at $85 million.

Vamsi Krishna, CEO and co-founder, Vedantu said that these funds would be used to enter new categories such as kindergarten and classes 1 to 5. “We will also invest a portion of the funds into brand leadership. As we continue to grow our student enrolments by 4.5x year on year, we are gearing to invest in brand and entering very strongly in new categories of age group 4-10 years beyond current customer segments,” he added.

Hans Tung, managing partner, GGV Capital said, “We look for teams that deliver technology-enhanced education that fits the local needs. We think Vedantu has hit an inflection point with a track record of delivering superior results,” Hans is also joining as an observer on Vedantu’s board. Vedantu’s series C funding of $42 million round was previously led by Tiger Global and WestBridge Capital in which Accel, Omidyar India, TAL Education, Prince Maximilian of Liechtenstein & CEO, LGT Group also participated.

Title: Two arrested with ganja in Jamnagar
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Rajkot: Two persons were arrested with 24 kg ganja (marijuana) worth Rs 1.44 lakh in Bedi locality of Jamnagar on Thursday.

Police said the accused, identified as Hanif Dal (32) and Roshan Danny (28) were caught on the basis of a tip-off.

“We had received a tip-off that Danny had brought the contraband from Nepal and had come to Bedi locality to sell it to Dal. Acting on this information, we kept a watch and nabbed the accused duo,” said J B Patel, inspector with Jamnagar special operation group.
