This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

Title: Student dies in bike accident
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

MANGALURU: Karthik Mallya , 20, an evening college student who had also taken up a part-time job, died in an accident on Thursday. Police said the accident took place when the deceased was riding a motorbike from KPT towards Nanthoor.

A tanker hit his motorbike from the rear, due to which he fell, after which the tanker ran over him. A case has been registered at the Mangaluru East Traffic police station.

Title: Challenge to keep government machinery on the track of financial prudence: Kiran Bedi
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Kiran Bedi

PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi said she was not surprised at the outburst of chief minister V Narayanasamy , his cabinet colleagues and MLAs against her during the special session of the legislative assembly.

Stating that it’s a daily challenge to keep the government machinery on the track of financial prudence Bedi said relaxing the laws, rules and regulations may be easy and will get many friends but will be harmful in the long run.

“All that can be said is that it is a daily challenge here to keep Puducherry government running on the track of financial prudence, due diligence and maintaining and enforcing rule of law. (preventing debt traps, rowdyism, land grabs, indecisions in loss-making PSUs and registrar-run coop societies in violation of the laws and rules, and more). Relaxing these is easy and shall get us many more friends (sic). But very harmful in the long run. It may have short-term gains but will bear legal consequences later for successors to bear with,” she said in a WhatsApp post.

She warned that public servants will be held responsible for violation of laws, rules and regulations and objections raised during financial audit even after their assignments or retire as they draw pension from the government.

“Civil service officers are appointed for ensuring professional rule-based advice and accountability, as they are in long-term service of the country. Appointed administrators (like me) are not here for easy ways out and narrow interests. But for largest good while abiding by due process and functioning with accessibility and transparency. However, civility in utterances and correctness in facts publicly stated by those occupying public space would help in making Puducherry citizens more aware and participative to correct serious deficiencies being encountered,” she said.

Title: Ban on loudspeakers in city
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Bhopal: District collector Tarun Pithode on Thursday imposed a ban on use of loudspeakers in the city till further orders. The decision was taken in the wake of annual examination of schools currently underway. The ban would, however, not be applicable on bands used in marriage ceremonies, during aarti in temples and ajan at mosques. However, use of DJ on roads would be completely banned.

The committee headed by sub-divisional officer of the area may relax the ban on use of loudspeakers in special circumstances. However, there will be no relaxation on use of loudspeakers from 10 pm to 6 am in accordance with the Supreme Court order and no officer would be entitled to give any kind of relaxation in this regard.

The order of the district collector clarified that several festivals would fall in the next few days, including Mahashivratri, Holi, Rangpanchami, Ramnavami, Mahavir Jayanti and Baishakhi and ban on use of loudspeakers on such occasions may be relaxed but permission of SDM of the area would be required for the purpose. However, the period during which the apex court has banned use of loudspeakers, no relaxation would be provided.

If anyone found violating the order, then loudspeaker or DJ or any other device being used for amplification of sound would be seized and the person responsible would face legal action.

Title: ‘Ram Temple in Ayodhya will be built as per Trust model’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Varanasi: One of the members of the newly formed Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust, Swami Vasudevanand Saraswati said that the Ram Temple in Ayodhya would be built as per the model approved by the Trust only, though, he wished that the temple is built as per the model of Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Ramjanmabhoomi Nyas .

“In my opinion the temple should be built as per the model presented by Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Ramjanmabhoomi Nyas which travelled across the country. And people have donated Rs 8.25 crore for it,” said the seer while talking to reporters here on Thursday. He said that the stone work worth Rs 30 crore has been completed, and the work is still in progress.

“However, I don’t know what type of model has been presented by the Ramalaya Nyas,” he said on being asked about his view on the model of Ramalaya Trust headed by the Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanad Saraswati.

On the opposition of the Trust by Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati, he said, “Sawmi is elderly and disciple of my peeth, hence I would not counter him. But the Trust has been formed by the government on the direction of Supreme Court.”

Just after the formation of the Trust, the Ramalaya Nyas secretary Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati announced that the Nyas would move court to challenge it alleging that the Central government did not follow the directive of the Supreme Court in true spirit in forming the trust. The Supreme Court had directed the Central government to formulate a scheme, not a trust for the construction of Ram temple, said the seer. He had also objected to the inclusion of Swami Vasudevanand as the Shankaracharya of Jyotishpeeth in the Trust.

Title: 227 killed in 2,368 road accidents on Agra-Lko eway in 20 months
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Agra: In 20 months between August 2017 and March 2019, a total of 227 people lost their lives in 2,368 road accidents on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway, an RTI reply revealed recently.

Krishan Chand Jain, the lawyer who filed the query, said, “Among the prime reasons behind the number of accidents on the expressway, were overspeeding, unauthorised parking on road side, stationary vehicles in middle of road for longer time or delay in arrival of crane and rescue to remove the vehicle from road and others.”

Sirsaganj circle officer Iraj Raja, under whose jurisdiction the Wednesday’s horrific road accident occurred, killing 14 people, said, “The private bus was moving at over 100kmph. The speed limit for heavy vehicles is 80 kmph. Since the bus was overspeeding, we suspect the driver couldn’t control his vehicle when he saw a stationary truck on the extreme right lane. Only the left lane is allotted for heavy commercial vehicles. Both the drivers of the truck and bus were at fault.”

Following the accident, additional director general (Agra zone) Ajay Anand has written a letter to the Uttar Pradesh Expressways Industrial Development Authority (UPEIDA) authorities urging them to ban the entry of commercial vehicles without reflective tapes or blinkers.

He said, “We have also asked the authorities to revise their patrolling measures to ensure that no vehicle is stationary on the expressway. Further, I have also asked them to emphasis on response time and better coordination among dial 112 team and UPEIDA patrolling team.”

Meanwhile, Agra-Lucknow Expressway security head Jagdish Singh said, “Our initial probe suggested that the truck driver was changing a flat tyre in the extreme right lane. It’s not clear whether the bus driver had spotted the reflective tapes of the truck or not. However, both the vehicles should not have been driving on the extreme right lane of the expressway.”

K P Singh, the private concessionaire for the Expressway, said, “We don’t allow commercial vehicles without proper blinkers or reflective tapes on them, as traveling at night without precautionary measures is dangerous. But we will comply with the recommendations of ADG.”

The 302 km six-lane expressway inaugurated on November 21, 2016 by then UP CM Akhilesh Yadav is the longest expressway in India.

Title: 14 killed, 31 injured as bus rams stationary truck on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Agra: Fourteen people were killed and 31 passengers were injured, many of them seriously, after a private bus hit a stationary truck on Agra-Lucknow Expressway late on Wednesday night.

Firozabad superintendent of police (rural) Rajesh Kumar said the accident took place around 10 pm in the Nagla Khanagar police station area when the double-decker bus carrying 61 passengers from Delhi to Motihari, in north Bihar, crashed into the stationary truck from behind.

The injured were rushed to Saifai medical college. Drivers of both the heavy vehicles, which were in the wrong late, were killed on the spot.

Jagdish Singh, chief security officer of Agra-Lucknow Expressway, Uttar Pradesh Expressways Industrial Development Authority (UPEIDA), said, “The driver of the truck halted the vehicle on the extreme right lane of the expressway to change a flat tyre. The bus, which is registered with Gorakhpur RTO and was coming from the national capital, hit the truck from behind.”

“The impact of the accident was so severe that the bus was crushed to half its length,” said inspector general of police (Agra range) Satish Ganesh.

“It took us over three hours to evacuate the injured and retrieve bodies from the mangled bus. The victims were hanging from the window in an unconscious state,” said a team member of UPEIDA’s patrol party.

According to the district administration, most of the dead hailed from Bihar and Delhi. The deceased were identified as Mukesh Kumar (26), Vinod Kumar (25), Kalimuddin (45), Bhagwan Chaubey (54), Harender (44), Chandan Mahto (24), Nageshwar Shah (42), Gulshan (21), Anil Shah (50), Rakesh Kumar (35), Raghuvansh Yadav (30), Ishtiaq (30), Zafarullah Haq and truck driver Bhura Khan (45), who hailed from Nighaniya Rampur village of Allahabad district.

Sirsaganj circle officer Iraj Raja said, “Our preliminary investigation suggests both the truck and bus drivers were at fault. The truck driver had halted his truck with a deflated tyre in the extreme lane, while the bus driver was probably overspeeding in the same lane. Both the drivers, who were killed on the spot, should have used the extreme left lane dedicated to only heavy and slow-moving vehicles.”

He said, “An FIR is yet to be lodged.”

Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed district officials to ensure proper treatment of the injured while Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his condolences to the families of the deceased and wished the injured a speedy recovery.

“The road accident on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway in Uttar Pradesh has caused deep grief. Many passengers have lost their lives ... My condolences to the families of the victims in this hour of grief. I wish those injured recovers soon,” the Prime Minister's Office said in a tweet quoting Modi.

Title: Ambedkar bridge to be closed for 15 days for repair
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Agra: Ambedkar bridge will be closed for 15 days for repair work. Much to the relief of the citizens, the Uttar Pradesh State Bridge Corporation Limited (UPSBCL) has finally taken cognizance of the poor condition of the bridge which is across the river Yamuna. In this regard, UPSBCL has sought permission from the police and district administration. The date to start the repair work is yet to be finalised.

According to sources, closing of the bridge is likely to cause traffic jam at Rambagh and waterworks crossing. In the past one year, the Ambedkar bridge suffered major damages. Locals alleged that it was a result of poor quality repair and maintenance work.

Potholes spanning several feet can be seen on the bridge that witnesses heavy traffic throughout the day. There is also a gap, around 8cm in width, which has developed between the joints of the bridge. The rods and steel framework of the bridge is exposed at several places where the concrete has fallen off.

Local resident Ramesh Kushwah said, “The bridge is in poor condition and needs urgent repairing. The 10-year-old bridge has been repaired several times earlier, but quality of the work has always been sub-standard.”

Heavy vehicles are prohibited on the bridge between 6am to 9pm. Locals, however, claim that overloaded trucks are allowed to pass through it and that too during the no-entry period by traffic police allegedly after taking bribe.

The bridge was built during BSP chief Mayawati’s regime. On October 9, 2008, the then chief minister had laid its foundation stone. Two years later, the Rs 30 crore bridge was opened to traffic, however, within a year, it developed its first major crack. UPSBCL had to close it for seven days to fix the damage. In 2016, a 6x6 feet section of the bridge collapsed for which the bridge was again closed down for 10 days.

As per sources, every day around 15,000 vehicles cross Ambedkar Bridge which also connects Yamuna Expressway with the city. Tourists use this bridge to visit Taj Mahal and other destinations in the city. Vehicles going towards Gwalior Road also pass through it.

UPSBCL deputy project manager Vikram Singh said, “Permission has been sought for repairing of Ambedkar bridge. It will take 15 days to complete the repair work. The date to start the repair work will be finalized by the traffic police as they have to make arrangements to manage traffic in the area after closing the bridge.”

Title: AMU students demand release of Sharjeel Imam
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Agra: Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) students, including women, on Thursday demanded release of anti-CAA activist Sharjeel Imam who was arrested by Delhi police in a sedition case last month.

Shouting slogans, the protesting students demanded that Sharjeel Imam be released. They took out a protest march against CAA/NRC/NPR from Maulana Azad library to Bab-E-Syed inside the campus.

Speaking to the media, one of the protesting women students said that they will not stop their movement against the alleged police brutality at Jamia, JNU and AMU. She said that no one can suppress the voice of students. “Sharjeel’s speech was not wrong. It was misinterpreted,” the protestors said.

Another woman protestor said, Sharjeel was wrongly implicated and the charges imposed against him should be withdrawn. She said that he should get justice and all those who have been wrongly put behind the bars during anti-CAA protests across the state should be released.

Sharjeel, a PhD scholar at the Jawaharlal Nehru University’s Centre for Historical Studies, was booked for sedition and under other charges in several states after purported videos of his alleged inflammatory speeches at the AMU and Jamia Milia Islamia University in Delhi, were circulated on social media.

In the video, which has gone viral on social media, Imam can be purportedly heard saying that if he can organise five lakh people, it is possible to ‘permanently cut off Assam with the rest of India...if not permanently, then at least for a few months’.

Aligarh police registered the FIR against him under sections 124 A (sedition), 153 A (provocation with intent to cause riots), 153 B (whoever by words either spoken or written or by signs makes or publishes any imputation, assertions prejudicial to national-integration or may cause disharmony) and 505 (2) of the IPC at the Civil Lines police station.

Title: CAA protests: 13 get Rs 22 lakh recovery notices for damages
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Lucknow: Issuing its first such recovery order, Lucknow district administration on Thursday directed 13 accused to pay Rs 22 lakh as compensation for damaging public property in violence during anti-CAA protests in Khadra locality under Hasanganj police station in the city on December 19, 2019.

The administration also pulled up police for not putting up required efforts in identifying all the culprits.

The order comes nearly two months after chief minister Yogi Adityanath had declared that government will recover damages from protesters. ADM (trans-Gomti) Vishwa Bushan Mishra said the administration can issue recovery order as per an Allahabad high court order of December 2, 2010, in Mohammad Shujauddin vs State of Uttar Pradesh.

On December 23, 2019, ADM (trans-Gomti) had issued show cause notices to 20 persons, identified from CCTV footage, photographs and videos of violence and arson besides report of the local intelligence unit (LIU), seeking reply on why money should not be recovered from them for damage caused to public property in December 19 protest.

Lucknow DM Abhishek Prakash had constituted a four-member panel comprising (ADM) (East), ADM (West), ADM (trans-Gomti) and ADM (administration) to assess the damage caused to property and fix responsibility. Among the 20 accused, seven submitted evidence to claim they were not present at the spot nor responsible in any other way. Police could not counter their evidence, it said.

“It is important to mention here that police did not take assistance from any competent legal consultant or government counsel for its submissions,” the order added. The seven accused will still face criminal proceedings in court.

Among the remaining 13 from whom damages will be recovered, six did not reply to the notice, hence were considered guilty, while seven could not provide sufficient evidence to prove their innocence, the order stated. The 13 accused are collectively and individually responsible for paying damages, it added. In a dig at police, the order says, “Over 10,000 persons were involved in the anti-CAA protests during which violence broke out, but police could identify only a few. As a result, responsibility of many others involved in violence could not be fixed.”

The 13 accused include Osama Siddiqui, Mohammed Hashim, Dharamvir Singh, Mohammed Kalim of Jankipuram and another Mohammed Kalim of Hasanganj, Mukhtar Ahmad, Mohammed Zakir, Mohammed Mubeen, Wasim, Mohammed Shafiuddin, Mahenoor Chaudhary, Hafiz-ur- Rehman, and Salman.

They have been given 30 days to pay the damages failing which their property will be seized.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: 40 injured as two buses collide head-on in Misrod
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

The buses collided on Bhojpur road on Thursday evening. The college bus was so badly damaged that the students... Read More

BHOPAL: Forty passengers were hurt when a college bus collided head-on with a passenger bus on Bhojpur Road on Thursday evening. Among the injured are 14 college students and two minor boys.

The condition of four college students is said to be critical and they are admitted in the ICU. Misrod police had not filed a case till the time of filing this report. The impact of the collision was such that the college bus broke into two, near the door. The students and teachers were trapped inside as the entrance was jammed by a tree.

SHO Misrod, Niranjan Sharma said, “Around 5pm, a speeding passenger bus on way to Bhojpur from Bhopal collided head-on with a college bus coming from the opposite side. The college bus was on way to drop students home.” The bus was badly damaged. One of the professor’s leg got stuck in a broken part of the bus. The metal around the leg had to be cut to rescue him, said police.

“Police rushed the injured students to a nearby private hospital where four students including Neelesh, Shubham, Neetu, and Sanjay Kumar Pal were admitted to ICU. Neelesh and Shubham are on ventilator and their condition is reported to be critical. Two minor boys from other passenger bus — Ayan Ali, 11, and Lalik Arib, 11, were also admitted to the private hospital. Six girl students sustained injuries on their face and head. 12 passengers were rushed to another private hospital where they are undergoing treatment,” added Sharma. Police will register a case after investigation, said Sharma. Prima facie the eyewitnesses told police that the college bus driver was driving rashly.

Title: After 3-year torture in Iraq, 16 T workers return home
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: After spending a harrowing three years in Iraq with their world turned upside down and having been duped by illegal agents who promised to get them jobs, 16 workers from Telangana are returning home on Saturday.

But, the workers’ return would not have been possible had the Kurdistan regional government not waived a penalty of Rs 2 crore, which the workers owe for their overstay and illegal stay in Iraq. The workers belong to Mancherial, Adilabad, Nizamabad, Karimnagar and Jagtial.

With the Consulate General of India (CGI) in Erbil intervening, the workers were able to breathe easy. “This was the only second instance when the waiver was given. The first waiver was granted in 2016. We kept pursuing the matter with the Kurdistan authorities,” consul general, CGI, Erbil, Chandramouli K Kern said.

NRI affairs minister KT Rama Rao also took up the issue with the CGI. General administration (NRI) department official Chitti Babu received the news from Chandramouli, who also told him that Kurdistan regional government does not waive penalty in normal course.

The workers, who took the flight in Iraq on Friday, will reach Hyderabad on Saturday. Before they set out, they posted a video thanking chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and KTR. The video was shared by Murthi Alagonda, a social worker and president of Telugu Gulf Welfare Association, Erbil.

The workers revealed they had a hard time in Iraq with no food, accommodation and no means of livelihood. They also said they had no ‘aqama’ (work permit), which made their stay illegal.

On November 28, 2019, GAD, Telangana, wrote to CGI, Erbil, and gave names of the 17 workers who pleaded for help. One of them returned to the state on February 3 after his employer paid penalty on his behalf and bailed him out.

Title: To avoid CAA protests, CCP to ‘screen’ floats ahead of Panaji parade
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Panaji: Days after the Corporation of the City of Panaji (CCP) announced that they would not permit tableaus depicting CAA/NRC, the corporation has decided to beef up security on the day of the parade to remove even spot entries showcasing the subject.

“We will have a meeting with the participants prior to the festival to explain the rules to them. Floats depicting CAA will not be permitted. We have a screening team in the Panaji carnival committee that will look into this,” Panaji mayor Uday Madkaikar said.

“If there is such a float at the carnival, we will immediately remove them from there. We have scheduled a meeting with the Goa police, traffic cell and the collector on Monday to work out the final strategy,” Madkaikar said.

He said that the parade will be flagged off at 4 pm but float entries will be accepted only till 1pm. “The screening committee will be present from morning onwards to check the theme of the floats,” he said. The carnival parade will be held in Panaji on February 22.

He urged participants to make efforts to depict Goa’s culture instead.

“This time we have requested participants to stage theme-based floats, and not just people dancing on small floats. What we want participants to showcase are the stories of Goa’s village life and scenic surroundings so that domestic and international tourists can see Goa’s culture through these floats,” he said.

This year, the fee for spot registrations has been increased to Rs 5,000 and registration forms will cost Rs 1,000. They used to only cost Rs 100 in the previous years.

Title: Coronavirus in Mangalore: College files complaint after fake message on coronavirus
Content:
Representative image

Screenshot shown to police

‘No coronavirsus case on campus’

MANGALURU: R Srinivasa Rao Kunte, principal, Sahyadri College of Engineering and Management, has requested the inspector, cyber crime economic offences and narcotics, to take action against a fake vulgar WhatsApp message being circulated, indicating that there is a coronavirus case on campus.He has shared a screenshot with the police that reads, NDTV: Mangalore- Sahyadri College campus officials have confirmed a case of coronavirus within the student community. This message is followed by a link. When a person clicks the link, a pornograhic image appears.The principal clarified, “No coronavirus case has been reported in our campus, and the link in the message opens a pornographic image.” He has requested the police to stop the circulation of this message immediately, and take suitable action against those involved in posting the message.The college got to know about the message on Thursday morning, after it appeared in a few groups.

Title: Forest dept imposes fine of Rs 1L on contractor for felling 20 trees
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: The forest department cracked the whip on a contractor for uprooting trees in Gachibowli following a TOI report. A fine of Rs 1 lakh was imposed for the loss of 20 trees in the area.

The fine was imposed on contractor Rajashekhar Reddy for the felling of trees at Rolling Hills in Gachibowli.

The felling was done to carry out underground cabling work.

A case was booked by the forest department on February 10 after residents raised an issue about chopping of trees in the middle of the night. The case was booked under section 29-2(b) of TS Forest Act 1967.

The weight of the wood chopped was pegged at 11.02 tonnes, costing approximately Rs 20,000. As per calculations, forest officials charged the contractor five times the amount.

“Any tree felling requires permission from forest authorities concerned. Any illegal action will be taken seriously. Penalties will be imposed in case trees are chopped without permission,” said Ch Shivaiah, FDO, Shamshabad division.

Forest department officials said the fine money has already been remitted.

Sumanth P, general secretary, Meenakshi Towers, who first saw the trees chopped down, reacted positively. “This is a good step taken by the forest department. Once people realise there is a cost to cutting even one tree illegally, the amount of felling will reduce.”

Title: Raj needs more solar capacity, better ecosystem to cement its edge
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Jaipur: In the past one year, Rajasthan has regained some of the lost ground to become the second largest producer of solar power in the country, but to reclaim the top position, the state needs to have an investor-friendly tariff and policy regime.

In its budget recommendations to the state government, Rajasthan Solar Association (RSA) drew attention to a number of areas, focusing not only on adding more generation capacity but also building an entire solar power ecosystem that would yield multiple benefits for the state.

The industry body urged the government to bring in provisions in the budget to list solar street lights, lanterns, heaters and other items in the Rajasthan Transparency in Public Procurement Act and mandate the government departments to source only from the state’s MSMEs.

To make Kusum scheme a success, it said the current tariff of Rs 3.14 per unit, which was fixed on Thursday, should be increased to attract investors. Kusum scheme allows farmers to set up solar plants to run pumps for irrigating their fields. Under the scheme, farmers can also lease their unutilized land to developers and earn fees.

Sunil Bansal, general secretary of RSA, said, “So far, the applications from developers are less than the land offered by farmers. This shows the developers feel that the return on investment is not adequate. We want the government to recognize the trends and raise the tariffs. These projects offer great hope to farmers for getting day power which will change their social life.”

Since Rajasthan has been at the centre of solar revolution in the country, the industry body wants the government to develop capacity building institutions like research and development centres and skills training facilities.

“As a leader, we have to be at the forefront of building all the necessary ecosystem and infrastructure . The RRDEF (Rajasthan Renewable Energy Development Fund) has the resources and that should be utilised for capacity building and promoting the sector,” added Bansal.

For commercial and industrial consumers, net metering cap of 1 megawatt has been a concern. The industry body said that since the dynamics of the industry has changed with bigger projects being set up, the cap of 1 MW should now be increased to 2 MW. Bansal said that Haryana has already raised the cap and Rajasthan should also follow suit.

State Solar capacity

Karnataka 7274 MW

Rajasthan 4844 MW

Tamil Nadu 3788 MW

Telengana 3620MW

Andhra Pradesh 3559 MW

Title: Youth beaten to death in clash during marriage
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Varanasi: A 28-year-old youth was beaten to death and one more person sustained injuries following a clash at a marriage ceremony during dance on Wednesday night.

The incident was reported from Usasa village in Pakadi area of Ballia district.

An FIR has been registered against some baratis of Nagra area. The police are investigating the matter.

According to reports, during the marriage ceremony of one Suresh Chauhan’s daughter, two groups clashed over DJ dance. A local youth Omprakash Ram was allegedly thrashed by the baratis. He sustained serious head injuries. He was taken to the local hospital from where he was referred to Varanasi, but he succumbed to injuries on the way. Another local resident Pradyuman Chauhan also sustained injuries in the clash. He has been admitted to a hospital in Mau district for treatment.

On deceased’s uncle Ghoora Ram’s complaint, the police lodged an FIR against some baratis of Nagra area. The police said that the matter was being investigated.

Title: Tech-savvy CM Yogi Adityanath makes UP cabinet go paperless
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Yogi Adityanath

LUCKNOW: After chief minister Yogi Adityanath took to tabs recently, using it for reading out his speeches, reading notes and files, and carrying out important communication, he has said that each cabinet minister will also get a tab by the coming week.

The next cabinet meeting, he declared, will be paperless as all work will take place on tabs.

“On directions of CM Yogi Adityanath, all cabinet ministers will be made techno-savvy for which they will be given tabs. The cabinet meeting to take place next week will be paperless and tabs will be used in it,” tweeted Mrityunjay Kumar, adviser to the CM, on Thursday.

Of late, Yogi Adityanath has often been seen with an tab in hand. Sources said the CM has become “tech-savvy” since the time of the Ganga Yatra. Recently, he addressed a gathering of mediapersons during the curtain raiser of the Defence Expo by reading his speech from a tab.

Title: Cops issue ID cards to journalists after terror attack alert
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Gorakhpur: Following an alert from intelligence agencies about possibility of a terror attack on chief minister Yogi Adityanath stating the attacker could come in the guise of a journalist, Gorakhpur police have started issuing identity cards to newspersons in the city.

As per the alert, there is a possibility of attack on the CM at Gorakhnath temple and the assailant could come while posing as a journalist.

Police have started issuing identity cards carrying photographs to journalists who cover the CM’s programmes. Only those carrying photo identity cards will be allowed to cover CM’s events.

“We have been informed that security agencies have issued an alert about chances of an attack on CM Yogi in Gorakhpur. As per the directives of officials, we are issuing identity cards to journalists. Many identity cards have been issued, while others are being processed,” said circle officer, LIU, Jagdish Singh.

ADG Gorakhpur zone, Dawa Sherpa said, “We upgrade our security arrangements on the basis of information shared by state and national security agencies. CM Yogi frequently visits Gorakhpur as it has been his constituency. The security arrangements are not for a particular visit but to strengthen the overall security.”

Title: Gulab Chand Kataria takes on government over crime rate, power tariff
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Opposition leader Gulab Chand Kataria attacked the government on increasing crime and power tariff hike announced recently.

He was participating in a debate on the governor’s address in the assembly on Thursday.

He said under the Congress rule all kinds of crimes had increased manifold. Crimes against SCs registered an 81% growth, while ST is 60. He alleged that the Thanagazi gangrape case was covered up till the elections were over.

Chief minister Ashok Gehlot later in his reply defended the increase in FIRs by saying that his government’s directive of allowing districts SPs to register FIRs had resulted in such a growth in criminal complaints.

The opposition leader said the discoms had become white elephants with the recent power hike the common people were not able to pay bills and there are chances of people adopting illegal means.

He said a family consuming just 150 units of power in a month has to shell out Rs 1,380 per year after tariff hike while 300 units had an additional burden of Rs 3,390. Similarly, a consumer using 500 units of power a month has been put an additional annual burden of Rs 6000 a year.

He asked the government to address the issues of contractual employees. Kataria said the issue had to be settled once and for all as the contract employees are continuing with the hope of regularisation. He also asked the chief minister to take action against rampant adulteration.

Title: Andhra Pradesh to plant Rs 25 crore saplings this year
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Neerabh Kumar Prasad

Title: Centre defers clearances for two Tamil Nadu industrial parks
Content:
Representative image

CHENNAI: In a setback to the Tamil Nadu government, the expert appraisal committee of the Union environment ministry has deferred environmental clearances to two industrial parks for not meeting statutory requirements.While Manallur in Gummidipoondi in Tiruvallur district failed to address issues raised during the public hearing and fulfill commitments, Therkuveerapandiyapuram and Meelavitan villages in Tuticorin district did not adhere to environment guidelines.The Manallur park is proposed on a location 47.5km north of Chennai, an initiative of the state to support an industrial cluster as an environmentally balanced industrial complex (EBIC). The project proponent, State Industries Promotion Corporation of Tamil Nadu (SIPCOT), has said the Manallur park, costing Rs 250 crore, would complement the growth of the nearby port and upcoming power plants. It has been designed to accommodate industries that fall under 5f (synthetic organic chemicals industry) and 5h (integrated paint industry) categories as per environmental norms.In its 230th meeting in New Delhi, the committee deliberated the project in detail and issued a slew of directions.The SIPCOT mentioned that there is no protected area within 10km radius of the proposed site. As per the environment ministry’s decision support system, however, the Pulicat lake wildlife sanctuary is located 5.5km from the project site.“The SIPCOT has not addressed the issues raised during the public hearing and kept the commitments made along with fund provisions in environment impact assessment/environment management plan report,” the committee said.As the water table is shallow in the area and soil formation is predominantly red clay and coastal sand, the site is not suitable for chemical industries. The groundwater and surface water have to be protected.The Tuticorin industrial park is envisaged for petroleum refining industry and petro-chemical complex at a cost of Rs 250 crore.The state government in December 1996 gave administrative sanction for the proposal to acquire land to set up an industrial complex in Meelavitan and Therkuveerapandiapuram in Tuticorin district. “The SIPCOT has not given three alternative sites for the proposed industrial activities that are highly polluting,” the committee said.Interestingly, the SIPCOT has pointed to more oil well exploration projects in the state that would benefit the project.In both cases, the committee said the site selection for the proposed industrial estates should be planned according to guidelines of the Central Pollution Control Board’s programme on zoning atlas for locating industries. The planning should be based on the criteria mentioned in the ministry’s Technical EIA Guidance Manual for Industrial Estate (2009). The SIPCOT should work on revised environment impact assessment/environment management plan report for both industrial parks to seek environment clearance.

Title: Former Odisha MLA held in 2016 double-murder case in Chhattisgarh
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Anup Sai

RAIPUR/BHUBANESWAR: Chhattisgarh police on Wednesday night arrested BJD leader Anup Kumar Sai for the 2016 double murder of a woman and her 14-year-old daughter.

An embarrassed BJD sacked Sai (59) from the party on Thursday and he was also removed as chairman of the state warehousing corporation by the Odisha government.

A three-time Congress MLA from Brajrajnagar , Sai was summoned several times by Raigarh (Chhattisgarh) police but he didn’t respond to any of them, leading to his arrest.

Raigarh SP Santosh Singh told TOI, “Chakradhar Nagar police have picked up former MLA Anup Sai for interrogation in connection with the double murder case of two women in May 2016. Sai has admitted that he was involved in the murder with some of his aides. He has been arrested under IPC Sections 302 (murder), 201 (causing disappearance of evidence) and 120B (criminal conspiracy).”

The mutilated bodies of a woman and young girl were found in the forests of Raigarh, bordering Jharsuguda district . Their faces were crushed beyond recognition. It took eight months for the police to identify them as Kalpana Das (35) and her 14-year-old daughter Pravati, residents of Brajarajnagar.

During investigation, police found some clues in 2018 that indicated Sai was a close acquaintance of Kalpana, say sources. Chhattisgarh police repeatedly summoned Sai on the basis of evidence but he ignored them. “He was picked up for interrogation when police found substantial evidence,” the SP added.

Singh said that the woman had been Sai’s live-in partner for several years. “Sai is the prime accused in the murder of his live-in partner. In his confession, he said that the woman was blackmailing him and was insisting on marriage. Though her daughter was from her previous husband, both mother and daughter were killed in cold blood with a sharp-edged weapon,” the SP said.

“We had issued him summons to appear before us for interrogation, but he dodged them. On Wednesday night, we went to Jharsuguda and brought him in for questioning. We arested him after interrogation. Sai killed the woman and her daughter and tried to destroy evidence,” said an officer of Chakradhar Nagar police.

“We had formed several teams to solve this case. Later, we found Sai’s complicity,” said Raigarh additional SP Abhishek Verma. Family members of Sai and Kalpana were unavailable for comment.

Sai represented Brajarajnagar assembly constituency for the Congress from 2000 to 2014. He switched to BJD in 2014 but lost the election and was denied a ticket in 2019. In August 2019, chief minister Naveen Patnaik appointed him as chairperson of Odisha state warehousing corporation, a state-owned public sector undertaking.

Title: Speaker raps mins for entertaining MLAs during session
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Jaipur: Speaker C P Joshi has begun cracking the whip on ministers and MLAs.

Joshi, a stricter for rules on Thursday warned the ministers that he would order to lock up ministers’ chambers in the assembly if they entertain MLAs in the House during the session.

He directed the ministers to be present in the House during Zero Hour as well after the Opposition complained that ministers and officials leave the House once the Question Hour is over and no one listens to issues raised during the rest of the day.

As soon as Question Hour ended and speaker announced Zero Hour business, the MLAs began to rush to the ministers in the front row in the House to get their works done.

Then, the speaker said, “If the ministers attend to the grievances of the MLAs in the House itself what is the use of their chambers.”

He directed the MLAs to approach the ministers in their chamber so that the House proceedings are not disturbed.

The speaker gave the direction after deputy opposition leader Rajendra Rathore complained that the ministers are not attentive to the issues raised by the MLAs for Zero Hour. The speaker also said the ministers should be present in the House for Zero Hour also though they are not mandated to reply to the issues raised during this period.

Later, Rathore said speaker’s directive came as slap to the government as the ministers were not serious on their duties.

Title: Telangana: Irrigation department to be divided into 11 circles in major reforms
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao offers flowers to Godavari on Thursday

HYDERABAD: Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao on Thursday directed irrigation officials to gear up to lift 530 tmcft from Godavari river and fill all the lakes.

Asking the officials to prepare an action plan in this regard, the chief minister said the irrigation department would be reorganised soon, indicating his plans to bring in reforms on the lines of the revenue department.

He said this was to ensure effective functioning of the department by bringing all engineering wings under one umbrella. He said the department would be divided into 11 circles. Each circle will be headed by a chief engineer.

The chief minister held a review meeting with senior irrigation officials along with ministers — Eatala Rajender, Gangula Kamalakar and Koppula Eshwar — and chief secretary Somesh Kumar in Karimnagar after visiting Medigadda barrage of Kaleshwaram project.

KCR said there was no dearth of funds and asked the officials to complete repairs of irrigation canals by May-end this year.

He wanted residential quarters completed by April for irrigation officials and staffers and asked the chief secretary to come up with proposals for construction of new collectorates in Nizamabad and Karimnagar.

Earlier in the day, KCR performed pujas at Kaleswaram-Mukteswaram temple and Triveni Sangam (confluence of Godavari, Pranahita and Saraswati rivers).

He made an aerial tour of Laxmi barrage (Medigadda) and dropped coins into the Godavari thereby fulfilling his Telangana statehood movement vows.

KCR instructed officials to ensure that floodwaters should be lifted from the Laxmi barrage during the monsoon season.

He also explained to irrigation principal secretary and former chief electoral officer Rajat Kumar on what he intends to do on various irrigation projects. Sources said KCR was trying to ease Rajat Kumar in his new role. Rajat was shifted to the irrigation wing in the recent reshuffle of IAS officers.

“From Sri Ram Sagar Project to Kaleswaram project barrages, reservoirs, lift irrigation pumps, canals and to the last acre in the ayacut, irrigated water should wet the land and they should be monitored. Division work should be done at every stage by strengthening the engineering network. If need be, use wireless network like police do,” he said.

Title: Udupi DC to present status report to HC on February 24
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

File photo of protesters during the anti-CAA protest in Mangaluru on December 19, 2019

MANGALURU: Udupi deputy commissioner G Jagadeesha, who is heading the magisterial probe into the alleged police firing on December 19, said that the status report on the inquiry will be presented before the high court on February 24.

The DC had asked eyewitnesses, media and the police, who have evidence or any information about the incident, to depose before the court. This is the third hearing being held, and so far 203 people have deposed before the court.

Providing details about the hearing held on Thursday, Jagadeesha told reporters that during the last hearing, two people who had arrived late, appeared before the court on Thursday. They have submitted their evidence in writing. As per the high court’s directions, we have invited the public, media representatives and police to submit video clips and CCTV footage of the incident. So far, only one person has submitted a mobile recording. “Since Karnataka bandh was observed, we have decided to give the public another opportunity. The next hearing will be held on February 19. Interested people can come forward and submit video or mobile recordings in their original form. Video clips downloaded from social media sites will not be entertained. Public can also submit CCTV footage from their homes or business establishments,” he said.

Meanwhile, the court had requested the city police commissioner to present video footage. “The city police have submitted a pen drive with nearly 50 video clips. In addition, the police had seized 23 DVRs that have already been submitted to the court. An acknowledgement on the submissions has been provided to the court,” he said.

The city police has appointed ACP (North) Belliappa K U as the nodal officer, and he will be present during every hearing.

Following the December 19 violence and the death of Nauseen Kudroli,49, and Jaleel Bengre, 23, due to alleged police firing, the state government to get to the bottom of the issue, commissioned two probes, one magisterial and the other CID. As per the government order, a report on the inquiry into the December 19 violence will be submitted before March 23.

Title: Former Odisha MLA held in 2016 double-murder case in Chhattisgarh

Title: City researcher in Cambridge University’s top 50 teachers’ list
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Surat: A city-based science researcher has made it to the list of top 50 teachers in the world under the dedicated teachers’ award-2020 by the Cambridge University press.

Nitesh Pandey, a researcher with the Indian Astrobiology Research Centre in Mumbai, has figured in the Dedicated Teachers’ Award Shortlist-2020 released by the Cambridge University Press. Pandey (30), a native of Vesu locality in Surat, is the lone candidate from the city, whereas there are other seven teachers from India, who have been celebrated for their vital role played in the lives of their students.

Pandey told TOI: “Being a scientist, I am always passionate about science promotion as well as teaching. I was the first to start Open Science Forum (OSF) in 2013 to teach students chemistry and biology.”

Since the inception of the OSF institute, Pandey has done multiple experiments to make chemistry more fun and accessible to students. He used games like crosswords to make his students learn chemistry with fun. Also, he wrote a song on ‘structure of atom’ so that students could remember all the atomic models in one go.

“We have organized 35 workshops on astrobiology all across the country since 2017. The series of workshops started from Surat in 2017,” said Pandey.

About his achievements, Pandey said, “I have been working on a new type of curriculum that is based on the extensive research done on the way our brain stores information and learn new things. This is going to be a game changer for those who are looking to explore new things with their brains.”

Title: Chandigarh: 110 objections to costlier water, ‘24x7 supply first’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: Miffed with the municipal corporation for increasing water tariff by more than double, residents have filed 110 objections, calling it unjustified in the absence of 24x7 supply.

Of these objections, 100 are on a single paper, signed by people from the housing societies of southern sectors 49 to 51. The MC will put these before the municipal commissioner and the home secretary of the local government for their comments before a final notification. “The officers’ comments will be meant to satisfy the objections,” a source in the civic body said. The MC will comment first and then the home secretary.

The civic body had given the general public 15 days to submit objections and suggestions on the issue of water tariff increase that has the consent of the UT administrator. Sources in the MC said the chances of complete rollback of the hike were negligible but there might be minor chances based on the stakeholders’ views. Since the authority increased the tariff after almost 10 years, it backs its decision firmly.

A senior MC official dealing with the case said: “The hike was a unanimous decision of the general house, biggest body of the MC, so the question of complete reversal doesn’t arise.”

Title: Rights panel seeks report from Panchkula municipal corporation
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Panchkula municipal corporation

CHANDIGARH: Taking suo motu cognizance of the accident in which two fighting bulls had claimed the life of a 22-year-old biker near Nada Sahib Gurdwara on February 8, the Haryana State Human Rights Commission has sought a report from the Panchkula municipal corporation.

“Let a report be requisitioned from the commissioner, municipal corporation, Panchkula, regarding the menace of stray cattle, which has taken the life of one Shahbaj, who was the only earning member of his family,” the commission observed in its order. The matter will come up for hearing on April 21.

On the night of February 8, Shahbaj Khan, a resident of Ramgarh in Panchkula district, was on way home on his motorcycle when the accident took place.

According to eyewitnesses, when he reached near the gurdwara around 11.30pm, two bulls fighting on the roadside came in the middle of the lane and hit his motorcycle. Shahbaj, a private firm employee, fell on the road and suffered a head injury. He was rushed to a nearby private hospital, from where he was referred to PGIMER, Chandigarh. But he succumbed during treatment. His friends informed his family about the incident.

Shahbaj is survived by two younger sisters and parents.

The accident has raised questions over the MC’s claims of ridding Panchkula of stray cattle menace.

Title: T Nagar residents oppose shifting of ration shop
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

The new outlet on Mambalam High Road, T Nagar

CHENNAI: T Nagar residents have condemned a state government agency for shifting ration shop to new location without prior announcement.

The shop, run by Triplicane Urban Co-operative Society (TUCS), was functioning at Rameshwaram Road for over 50 years. It has been shifted to newly-built structure on Mambalam High Road last week.

The shifting of the shops would mean that the cardholders of over 15 streets, who include senior citizens, to walk a long distance," said B Kannan, secretary of T Nagar Residents' Welfare Association. The new location is 2km far from the old site.

“There was no reason for shifting since there was no complaint whatsoever from the residents,” he said. Also, the newly built shops are clear encroachments on public space and safety of residents who queue up on road is at risk as Mambalam High Road always witnesses heavy traffic,” he added, requesting TUCS to shift the shop back to the old location.

Chandrasekar, managing director of TUCS, said the ration shop was functioning from an old and dilapidated structure and it was shifted to new building following T Nagar MLA Sathyanarayanan’s effort. It was becoming difficult to unload stocks there (on interior road) and now the shop is on the main road thereby making operations convenient. Though the MLA assured to get back regarding this, he didn't. Residents, however, complain that they weren’t consulted before any decision on shifting and the new building is situated at an unhygienic location with dust from road settling on food items. Workers can be seen wearing masks to avoid breathing trouble.

“The old building at Rameshwaram Street will be demolished and a super market will come up at the site. Tenders will be floated next week,” Chandrasekar added.

Title: Chullahs, cylinders at Oppn stir against hike in LPG prices
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

SP members protest on Thursday in Allahabad

Allahabad: Congress members reached the district collectorate on Thursday with LPG cylinders to protest against the hike in price of cooking gas. The protesters demanded that the Bharatiya Janata Party-led Union government roll back its decision to hike LPG prices.

Congress leader Mukund Tiwari said, “Congress has planned a series of protests to be staged from streets to the UP assembly. The Union government’s decision to increase LPG prices has hit citizens’ budgets at a time when the public was already reeling under the impact of inflation.” Congress leaders also brought along LPG cylinders and even performed a puja much to the fascination of onlookers. Samajwadi Party members on Thursday cooked a meal on a chulah (earthen oven) at Subhash Crossing to mark their protest against hike in LPG prices. SP spokesman Daan Bahadur said, “The BJP-led Union government has failed to bring down prices of essential commodities.”

Title: Jobless addict, 28, kills father with bricks in Mohali
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

MOHALI: A 28-year-old man, who was hooked to alcohol as well as drugs, killed his father here on Wednesday night when the 50-year-old refused to give him money for his addictions.

The accused, Rinku, was unemployed and unmarried, said the police.

The deceased, Hansraj, a resident of Mundi Kharar, used to work as a daily-wage labourer. Police officials said around 9.30pm, the duo had a quarrel over Rinku’s drinking habit. “Infuriated, Rinku picked up bricks kept outside his house. After closing the door of the house, he smashed his father’s face with around 20-25 bricks,” said a cop, adding that around 12 bricks were recovered from the spot.

At 10pm, when Hansraj’s younger son, Sonu, came home and opened the door, he saw Rinku with a brick in his hand and his father lying in a pool of blood. “Sonu, who also works as a daily-wage labourer, cried for help and called his neighbour Harmanpreet, who informed us,” said the police.

Hansraj was rushed to Kharar civil hospital with the help of neighbours, but doctors declared him dead. According to the police officials, Sonu and Rinku’s mother had died around 14 years ago and they had two married sisters.

Hansraj was so brutally hit that his face had become unidentifiable.

“Father and son used to quarrel often, as Hansraj would ask the accused to find a job,” said a source.

Sonu said, “Rinku was unemployed and took drugs, for which my father would scold him. This was the reason he killed him.”

A case under Section 302 (punishment for murder) of the Indian Penal Code was registered at City Kharar police station. SHO inspector Bhagwant Singh said, “The accused was arrested on Thursday evening from near Mundi Kharar when we received a tip-off that he was trying to flee. He will be produced in the court on Friday. The post-mortem of the deceased has been conducted.”

Title: Linking 3 jyotirlingas, Kashi Mahakal Exp to be launched on Feb 16
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Allahabad: Railway passengers planning to visit the three jyotirlingas — Omkareshwar near Indore, Mahakaleshwar in Ujjain and Kashi Vishwanath in Varanasi — will now have another option for commute. A new train ‘Kashi Mahakal’ between Varanasi and Indore will connect the three jyotirlingas and would be launched on February 16. The train would be the third corporate train to operate between Varanasi and Indore.

North Central Railways’ public relations officer Amit Malviya said the train will be inaugurated on February 16 at Varanasi, followed by routine commercial runs February 20 onwards “The train is in addition to two other corporate trains — the Tejas trains plying between Lucknow and New Delhi and, Ahmedabad and Mumbai. The Kashi-Mahakal Express will be a super-fast air-conditioned train.

Malviya added that the train will also connect Indore and Bhopal. The train will operate thrice a week between Varanasi and Indore, via Ujjain, Sant Hiradnagar, Bina, Jhansi, Kanpur, Lucknow/Allahabad and Sultanpur.

Passengers will be able to enjoy a host of facilities and services on board which include quality vegetarian food, on-board bedrolls and housekeeping services and on-board security.

Title: HC wants poll tribunal to hear Tukkuguda case
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: Justice P Keshava Rao of Telangana high court on Thursday refused to entertain a plea filed by eight BJP councillors from Tukkuguda municipality in Rangareddy district challenging the decision allowing TRS MP K Keshava Rao to vote in the election to the posts of chairman and vice-chairman of the municipality.

They said that as the MP was allotted to Andhra Pradesh, he should not have been allowed to vote at Tukkuguda. The judge said that the issue needs to be first adjudicated before the election tribunal in the district.

The state election commission informed that an election tribunal headed by principal district judge of the district was formed on February 11. Since an election tribunal is now available, the petitioners must approach the tribunal with an election petition, the judge said. tnn

Title: 19-year-old detained under PD Act
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: A 19-year-old offender was detained by police under PD Act. The accused was identified as Esa Khuraishi from Jalpalli, Pahadi Shareef, who was found to have been involved in 6 bike theft cases in Saidabad, Shalibanda, Chatrinaka and Kanchanbagh limits last year. tnn

Title: A love bridge for padlocks in Udaipur
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Chandpole Pulia is emerging as the love bridge of Udaipur

UDAIPUR: Arthur and Celia, a couple from Strasbourg, France, are in the City of Lakes on a romantic holiday. Walking through the heritage streets they come across a bridge at Chandpole and are surprised to see young couples clipping locks on the metal grate.

Reminded of the famous Love Bridge in their country, they too get a lock, clip it to the railing, kiss the key which is flung into the waters of Lake Pichola.

Chandpole Pulia is a new destination discovered in recent times by love birds who throng here in good numbers, especially around February which is the valentine month. “It is just a cute romantic gesture by sweethearts to proclaim their love and intentions to remain together for the rest of their lives,” says Himanshi, a college student who scribbled her boyfriend’s name and abandoned the key in the waters.

“It felt like one of the most romantic things we have ever done. This bridge is a treasure for its serenity and one of the most romantic places in Udaipur ,” say Priyamvada and Varun Raj, a couple from Bengaluru.

Some college youths were seen clipping a big lock to commemorate their bond. “Friendship is precious, and we have clipped the padlock praying for an everlasting bond between us, there is nothing romantic in this gesture, but it is exciting,” say Ankit, Kartik, Saumya and Sushmita, pursuing MBA from a college in Ahmedabad.

However, historians and heritage activists are not so happy with the new trend. “This display of love or romantic gesture can be harmful in the long term and may cause heritage degradation. The city of Paris has removed padlocks from the famous Pont des Arts ending the tourist tradition of attaching ‘love locks’ to the bridge. Here the trend is new, and the locks are in countable numbers today, but when they multiply, it may create problems and the railings would look ugly,” Mahesh Sharma, a retired professor and activist, said.

Title: Bahuroopi all set to tread ‘Gandhi Patha’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Mysuru: ‘Bahuroopi,’ the annual national festival of Rangayana, is back to enthral theatre lovers. The six-day event will be formally inaugurated on Friday. The theme of the festival this year will be Gandhi Patha (The Path of Gandhi).

Multilingual plays, film festival, poetry recitation, bhajans and folk dance will be some of the major attractions.

Theatre personalities and troupes from acros the country will participate in event and present best of the plays and cultural events.

Veeranna Channappa Angadi and troupe will present a ‘lavani’ on Gandhi at 6pm on Friday during the inaugural function.

Eminent theatre personality and actor Ananth Nag will inaugurate the festival. Hindustani classical singer Sangeetha Katti Kulkarni will render Gandhi bhajans.

In the run up to the event, Bahuroopi Folk Festival was inaugurated by Manjamma Jogathi, chairperson, Karnataka Folklore Academy.

In accordance with the theme ‘Gandhi Patha,’ Rangayana has been decorated like a mini-Gandhi ashram with a statue of the Mahatma on the premises, and his quotes displayed in the surroundings. Food huts, craft huts, Charaka spinning and weaving, pottery and basket making will be the other interesting highlights.

Film festival

On Friday, Bahuroopi Film Festival will be inaugurated at 11am at Shri Ranga Rangamandira. Girish Kasaravalli will inaugurate this festival.

Title: Both Kudankulam units shut, 1,000 MW shortfall for Tamil Nadu
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project’s Unit 2, which had stopped power generation in December last, is yet to res... Read More

CHENNAI: Both units at Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project have come to a stand-still, resulting in a shortfall of 1,000MW for Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation ( Tangedco ).

Unit 2, which had stopped power generation in December last, is yet to resume.

The first unit was stopped on Tuesday night owing to a technical snag. About 50% of power generated at Kudankulam power plant is supplied to Tamil Nadu.

“We were getting around 300MW from Unit 1 till a few days ago. As there is no communication from the plant as to what is the real issue and when generation will resume, we are not taking supply from Kudankulam into consideration for our planning,” said a senior Tangedco official.

As per Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited (NPCIL) website, Unit 2 generated 3,641 million units of power in 2019-20 and Unit 1 generated 5,586 million units. Efforts to seek response from NPCIL officials were in vain.

Compared to other nuclear power units in the country, the Kudankulam units have been performing below par. For example, four units in Kaiga have a capacity factor of not less than 90%. Some have crossed 100%. In comparison, the capacity factor of Kudankulam Unit 1 is 80% and Unit 2 is only 50%. Since February 1, power demand has been surging in the state. The peak demand is around 14,500MW, which is a new high for February. “All our thermal units are working at full capacity. Beyond that, we are purchasing power from central thermal and nuclear units as well as from the market to meet the peak demand,” said the official. At times, wind power is available, but it is restricted to evening time.

“Till wind power season begins, we have to depend on thermal and nuclear units for power supply. That explains our dependence on Kudankulam,” said the official.

Title: India to lead global fight against drug trafficking: Shah
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

NEW DELHI: Resolving not to allow illicit trade of narcotics within India’s boundaries, home minister Amit Shah on Thursday stressed on the need for all countries, particularly the Bay of Bengal littoral states, to combat the global menace by engaging with one another on exchange of ideas, policies and best practices.

Addressing the two-day Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (Bimstec) conference on ‘combating drug trafficking” organised by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) here, Shah said India had adopted a zero-tolerance policy towards narcotics and the country’s measures to control it were being overhauled to ensure that smuggling and trade of drugs was completely stopped.

The event was attended by Bimstec secretary-general Shahid-ul-Islam, junior foreign minister V Muraleedharan, visiting representatives of Bimstec member nations Bangladesh, Bhutan, Myanmar, Nepal, Sri Lanka and Thailand, home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla and NCB DG Rakesh Asthana, among others.

Shah said the “dirty money” obtained from narcotics trade was being used to fund global terrorism and other transnational crimes and it was the need of the hour for all countries to join hands and fight the problem.

“We will not allow drugs from any country of the world to enter into our country nor will we allow them to go out of the country... I want to assure that India is committed to end the drug menace and will take the lead role to check narcotics trade in the world,” he said.

According to an official statement, Asian countries are increasingly being affected by drug trafficking and Bimstec, being the key link between South Asian and South-East Asian nations, was one of the most effective platforms to tackle this global threat.

Shah said Manipur and Mizoram, which shared borders with Myanmar, and some coastal states were sensitive and may become a gateway for illicit drugs entering India, which must be prevented.

The minister expressed concern over the increasing rate of drug addiction — a 30% rise in the last 10 years — and termed the menace a “curse for mankind” as it not only killed an addict but also destroyed families and society. He said an estimated $400 billion worth of illicit drug trade happened globally every year, giving an idea of the size of challenge facing humanity.

Quoting PM Narendra Modi, Shah said there was no nation in the world that was not affected by global terrorism, transnational crimes and illicit drug trafficking. He assured the delegates that in line with the PM’s vision of a drug-free India, the government had devised a strategy to ensure inter-agency coordination and revamp the prosecution mechanism to end drug trafficking.

Title: Anti-CAA stir: Kafeel Khan may come out of jail today, 3 days after bail
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Agra: Gorakhpur paediatrician Dr Kafeel Khan, who was granted bail by an Aligarh court in a hate speech case on Monday, is likely to be released from Mathura jail on Friday, after a delay of three days. Chief judicial magistrate (CJM), Aligarh sent a special messenger to the jail with Khan’s release order and directed the jailor to expedite the release process.

The CJM passed the orders on an application filed by Khan’s lawyer, Irfan Ghazi, who alleged that police and jail authorities were unnecessarily harassing his client by detaining him illegally, even after the bail. Ghazi told TOI, “The release order was sent in person to Mathura jail from the court, but they refused to accept it on the plea they the same needed to be verified”.

In his application before the CJM, Ghazi said that his 38-year-old client, who is a heart patient, had illegally been detained in the jail even after bail by the court and verification of the guarantors. The application stated that this is the contempt of court and also the violation of human rights of his client.

The lawyer also urged the CJM to send a “special” messenger to Mathura jail for the release of his client.

After hearing the plea, the CJM Aligarh ordered Mathura jail superintendent to release Kafeel Khan. The order also said that Khan’s release order is being sent through a special messenger, Parmeet Kumar.

The CJM court also ordered Aligarh jail superintendent to expedite the process.

Ghazi said that Khan was not released even after sending the special messenger on Thursday evening. He said jail authorities may release him on Friday morning.

Khan was arrested by UP police’s special task force from Mumbai on January 29, when he reached the city to attend a protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.

He was then arrested in connection with a case registered against him in Aligarh under section 153-A (Promoting enmity between different groups on ground of religion), 153 B, 109 of IPC at civil lines police station on December 13 for disturbing communal harmony by delivering a provocative speech at Aligarh Muslim University (AMU).

Title: Protocol delays inauguration of vending zone
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Eateries infront of Shilparamam yet to open, in Madhapur Pic:P Ajikumar

Hyderabad: The inauguration of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation’s street-vending zone near Shilparamam, which was to be inaugurated on February 3, was postponed allegedly owing to protocol issues.

According to sources, Mayor Bonthu Rammohan was reportedly upset over his name being mentioned below the name of TRS MLA from Seriligampally and government whip Arekapudi Gandhi on an invitation for the inaugural of the vending zone. As per the general administration protocol, the Mayor’s name is supposed to be mentioned below the government whip’s name on plaques and invitations. However, speaking to TOI, both Rammohan and Gandhi denied the allegations. “I was not at all offended, as MA&UD minister KT Rama Rao was not attending the function, my schedule for the day changed,” said Rammohan.

Speaking about the event, Gandhi said, “I am on good terms with the Mayor. I wanted KTR to inaugurate it.”

GHMC officials also denied the allegations stating that the inauguration was postponed as zonal commissioners were transferred just a day before the inauguration.

Meanwhile, a private individual has claimed ownership of the land where the street-vending zone has been set up. He alleged that the TDR (Transfer of Development Rights) certificate was not issued to him after his land was acquired.

GHMC said that the alleged land owner has approached the court and may collect rent from stall owners after obtaining a stay order, till the issue is resolved. “Before the underpass was constructed, the zone was a part of a road that was fully operational, so how could the land be a private individual’s property?” the GHMC said over the allegations.

Title: Dehradun: Delhi police raids house of private club owners
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Delhi police raid at the residences of Sachin Upadhyay and his wife Nazia Yusuf Izuddin

DEHRADUN: A Delhi police team on Thursday carried out searches at the residences of World Integrity Center (WIC) promoter Sachin Upadhyay and his wife Nazia Yusuf Izuddin in connection with a case registered in Delhi by their former business partner Mukesh Joshi in 2012.

The police team, which reached Dehradun on Wednesday, was helped by local police units in carrying out searches at WIC as well as the promoters’ residence.

A member of the team told TOI that the searches were carried out after securing a warrant from the court which is hearing the matter. The police team claimed to have seized several documents from the residence and the office of the upscale club. An official involved in the investigation added that efforts were ongoing to trace Sachin Upadhyay and his wife Nazia Yusuf Izuddin.

Title: Muzrai temples under scanner after staff get away with fraud
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

MYSURU: Muzrai temples here have been in the news recently for all the wrong reasons.

Lack of transparency in temple affairs has caused a loss to the exchequer, claim devotees who make offerings through various sevas and hundis. Authorities are trying to rectify it but keeping a round-the-clock vigil on all temples is challenging.

The authorities of Sri Chamundeshwari Temple atop Chamundi Hills suspended three employees for manipulating software at the special entry counter and swindled over Rs 7 lakh. They entered the date as 2008 instead of 2018 while issuing a few special entry tickets priced at Rs 100 and Rs 30 and pocketed the money. The temple gets over 4,000 devotees on normal days and the number goes up ten-folds on special occasions. The crime came to light only after new software was installed. It’s still not known how much money was swindled and it’s suspected to have been going on for the past eight years.

Three employees of Srikanteshwara Temple in Nanjangud were booked for depositing less money than was collected from devotees performing thulabara and others sevas.

These are the two major muzrai temples among five in Mysuru district. They earn high revenue through offering and other special sevas. These two temples get over Rs 1 crore each once every 45 days from the offerings alone. Money through other sevas is collected separately. There are 18 offering boxes in the Chamundi temple.

BN Nagendra, a 50-year-old devotee, said the root cause for misappropriation is because the employees aren’t transferred. Once appointed, they serve for many years and this enables them find loopholes and siphon off money. “At least now the authorities must make transfers compulsory for all temple employees,” he said.

Mysuru assistant commissioner NC Venkataraju said prima facie Srikanteshwara Temple money received in the form of offerings by devotees was misused. There’s a record for misappropriation of over Rs 17 lakh and those involved have been transferred, said the official conducting a departmental inquiry.

Every temple is managed by an executive officer and directly accountable to the muzrai department. Mysuru muzrai tahsildar Yathiraju told TOI that after misappropriation of money came to light at Sri Chamundeshwari Temple, more CCTV cameras were installed, records checked and all activities monitored.

Title: Tumakuru scores 113 out of 100 on rating ease of living
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

MANGALURU: Tumakuru ranked 70 out of 111 on ease of living in 2018 but the city scored 113% on ease of filling up the Citizen Perception Survey (CPS) for 2019, overshooting its target in just a fortnight. Seven Karnataka cities that were part of the national index in 2018 continue to be in contention; there will be 114 cities in all this time around.

The CPS was launched online on February 1 by the Union housing and urban affairs ministry to gauge citizens’ responses to 22 questions related to ease of living in their city, including education, healthcare, housing, drinking water, safety of women, commuting, green spaces, adequacy of household income and efficiency of emergency services.

While the CPS set a target of 3,181 respondents for Tumakuru, 3,588 citizens had completed the survey by Thursday. The CPS will be available online (at http://eol2019.org/citizenfeedback) till February 29.

Shivamogga came second, with 76% of the target met already. In contrast, only 5% of the target responses have come in from Bengaluru -- 4,381 people took the survey against an expected 90,266.

Karnataka fared poorly on ease of living in 2018, with Mangaluru opening the account at 41st position. The coastal city was followed by Belagavi (ranked 52) while Bengaluru ranked 58. The saving grace for the capital city was that it ranked 16 overall on public open spaces.

Mangaluru, which emerged the most livable city in the state, has not shown much enthusiasm this time around. Only 25% of the target has been met, with over 3,800 responses to go.

Title: Surat-Sharjah flight gets new moniker — ‘smuggling flight’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Surat: With the arrest of a man travelling from Sharjah with 200 grams of gold worth Rs 9 lakh at Surat airport on late Tuesday night, the lone international flight between Surat and Sharjah has earned a bad name of being the ‘smuggling flight’.

Since it has started its commercial operations from February, 2019, the flight operated by Air India Express, has become favourite for gold smugglers. In the last one year, the air intelligence unit of customs department has seized about six kilograms of smuggled gold worth over Rs 4 crore.

In October, 2019, the air intelligence unit had arrested a man hailing from Valsad with gold bars and bracelets valued at over Rs 90 lakh. The accused had hidden the gold bars and bracelets, stitched in his trousers and shoes to escape the preying eyes of the customs officials.

Nainesh Pachchigar, member of All India Gems and Jewellery Domestic Council (GJF) said, “Gold smuggling has increased as the customs duty on gold has not been reduced by the government. Surat is the hub of jewellery manufacturing and people are trying to get gold through illegal channels to escape paying 12.5% customs duty on gold.”

In many smuggling cases, persons involved in smuggling of gold were residents of Mumbai and they used innovative ways to smuggle the contraband into the diamond city.

While some brought the gold capsules hidden in the rectum, other brought the gold paste stitched in the clothes and shoes.

According to the figures available from Airports Authority of India (AAI), about 4,000 passengers per month use Surat airport to travel to Sharjah. In December last year, the number of passengers from the airport has gone up to about 5,500 per month.

Customs officials stated that the smugglers are aware of the loopholes in the customs laws and they smuggle gold less than Rs 20 lakh value to avoid arrest. The customs rules related to gold import had been changed in 2013. Earlier, passengers with imported gold with less than Rs 5 lakh value allowed to go with a penalty. Customs officials had to file criminal case against the passengers only if imported gold valued at above Rs 5 lakh.

Title: Dehradun: TDS violations of Rs 1.5 cr detected in I-T raids
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

DEHRADUN: Income tax officials detected a total Tax Deduction at Source ( TDS ) violation worth Rs 1.5 crore during their inspections at two government offices and at the offices of two private companies on Thursday.

A joint commissioner rank income tax official told TOI, “The inspections were carried out at different places on February 12 and the scrutiny of the documents was completed on Thursday. Now, the notices would be served for clearing the TDS dues.”

Acting on a tip off, the I-T officials of TDS wing had reached the office of district panchayati raj department and seized several documents during the inspection.The second income tax team surveyed the district education officer’s office at Roshanabad and the third team surveyed the offices of Starlite Technology and Kurmanchal Construction.

Notably, the income tax department has been focussing on the TDS violations committed by the state-owned departments which are involved in awarding high value tenders to the contractors.

“The state government has been apprised about the TDS violations,” said the official.

Title: Mathura SHO suspended, another cop removed for not taking FIR of doc’s kidnapping
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020
