Agra: Mathura police on Thursday suspended an SHO and transferred a circle officer (CO) — the first for not registering an FIR in the two-month-old case of kidnapping of a doctor for ransom, the last for letting off one of the four kidnappers without registering a case against him. Police have also registered a case against the four suspects allegedly involved in the kidnapping.

ADG (Agra) Ajay Anand said that besides suspending SHO inspector Jagdamba Singh of Highway police station, they have removed CO (Refinery) Jagveer Singh for dereliction of duty. He added that though the doctor had refused to lodge a kidnapping complaint, the concerned police officers should have taken cognizance of the crime and registered a case on their own. Moreover, they let-off one of the kidnapping suspects, who they had tracked down by then. He said the department took action once senior officials became aware of the matter.

Police has also announced a reward of Rs 50,000 each to anyone providing information on the suspects, said IG (Agra) A Satish Ganesh. He told TOI the case has been transferred from Highway PS to the crime branch, with additional SP (crime) given charge of monitoring the case.

According to police, Dr Nirvikalp Agarwal, an orthopedic, was kidnapped on December 10 and later released, after receiving a ransom amount of Rs 52 lakh.

The kidnappers again called him on January 19 to demand another Rs 50 lakh. The terrified doctor, who had refused to lodge a complaint earlier, called police and told them about the extortion call. Highway police worked out the case, nabbed one of the kidnappers from Meerut and recovered of Rs 15 lakh from him, which they reportedly handed over to the doctor. During interrogation, the suspect revealed the names of his three accomplices in the crime, said police.

However, police released the kidnapper after three days of detention without registering an FIR or entering his arrest in the books. When the matter came to the notice of senior officials, they inquired further and took action against the cops who allowed the kidnapper to go scot free.

The FIR was registered on February 11 against four people — Sani Malik, Mahesh, Anoop and Nitesh — under Section 364A (kidnapping for ransom) of IPC, at Highway PS.

Title: Drafting unified Revenue Act will take years, say officials
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: The Telangana government may have initiated moves on a new unified Revenue Act to bring in revolutionary changes in the revenue department, but senior officials and legal experts say that it could take several years before it is made into a law.

The state government is planning to repeal nearly 124 Acts, which are redundant and obsolete, and draft the new Act. Officials said the law department had been asked to do look into existing laws, rules and Acts pertaining to the revenue department, including the old draft which was prepared by then Andhra Pradesh government when the state was united. The government is mainly studying the revenue code being implemented by Uttar Pradesh since 2016.

“Though the government is keen on the Act immediately, it is a laborious exercise. The UP government had begun the exercise on revenue code in 2002 and a draft was readied only in 2006 and the assembly passed the bill. But, it took 10 years for sending it to the Centre and and finally getting a presidential assent for the Act,” a senior government official explained.

The officials recalled that a similar effort was made by then TDP government in 1999 but it could not go ahead with it as the then central government had raised 140 queries. Finally, the draft was spiked.

Explaining the long exercise involved in this, land laws’ expert and advocate M Sunil Kumar said there are civic codes, revenue codes and state and central Acts on land revenue issues.

“The previous governments had issued about 2,000 to 3,000 GOs which need to be looked into. Various state government departments like revenue, forest, panchayat raj, municipal administration, survey and settlement need to be consulted as there should not be any contradiction and overlapping with their own Acts and rules. Apart from this, various judgments of the Supreme Court and high courts need to be incorporated in the Act,” Sunil said.

He said the role of the central government would arise in tenancy reforms, registration, land acquisition, ceiling issues and succession.

“The government should simultaneously bring the Title Guarantee Act as the present laws give farmers and owners only presumptive title and not a conclusive one. The title guarantee can be given to the farmers after conducting land survey. This can be done as the model law has already been circulated by the government of India,” advocate Ramesh Nagul said.

Title: NCW team visits AU campus, interacts with hostel inmates
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Allahabad: The three-member National Commission for Women team talked to inmates of Allahabad University’s ( AU ) Women’s Hostel about their problems on the second day of their visit on Thursday.

Earlier during the day, the NCW team visited the AU campus and interacted with acting vice-chancellor RR Tewari, the registrar and the finance officer.

The team’s visit comes in the wake of allegations of lapses in security at Women’s Hostel. The team was led by NCW chairperson Rekha Sharma and they talked in length with the hostel inmates about various issues including safety and an internal complaints committee. Former president of AUSU Richa Singh told TOI that the inmates demanded that the AU registrar and finance officer be removed from their respective posts as they could influence the investigation into the hostel security row.

Title: Madras HC orders notice on Saidapet government hospital building
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Thursday ordered notice to the state government on a PIL seeking to release Rs 40 crore for the construction of an eight-storey building in Saidapet government hospital as announced in 2017.

A division bench of Justice M Sathyanarayanan and Justice R Hemalatha passed the order on a plea moved by a person called R Viswanathan alias MGR Viswanathan and directed the state to file its response by March 13.

According to the petitioner, the government hospital, established in 1920, is under severe space crunch.

Though it is functioning as a 24/7 facility with in-house laboratory, it only has a 50-bed capacity.

The hospital which caters to people from Saidapet, Nandanam, Guindy, Velachery, Alandur, Taramani, Adyar, Thoraipakkam and Sholinganallur has no adequate space to fully function, the petitioner said.

Therefore, in a bid to develop the infrastructure of the hospital the state government announced that it would allot Rs 40 crore for the construction of an eight-storey building. However, the announcement has been put in cold storage due to political and administrative reasons, he said.

Claiming further that staff strength of the hospital is the same as it was in 1970, the petitioner said that the strength was not increased in line with the increase in population in the above areas.

Since the government has failed to respond to his representation dated August 8, 2019, he approached the high court.

Title: Coronavirus in Bangalore: Hotel owners cite coronavirus scare, ask MCC to remove food vends
Content:
Representative image

MYSURU: Citing the coronavirus scare prevalent in the city, hotel owners have urged the civic corporation to shut down roadside food vends, calling them a risk to public health.A team of the city Hotel Owners Association, led by president C Narayanagowda and honorary secretary Ravindra Bhat, met mayor Tasneem Bano and MCC commissioner Gurudatta Hegde on Tuesday and urged them to implement the high court’s ban on street food vending.In a statement issued on Thursday, the association said it had raised the poor hygiene at such joints amid the coronavirus threat and increasing incidence of chikungunya and malaria in the city. There is no check on the ingredients or water used and the cleanliness of the kitchens and cooking staff, they pointed out. Many of the joints operate near drains and public urinals and don’t have running water for washing or cleaning utensils, they said. Besides, the vends dump unsegregated garbage and compromise pedestrian safety by blocking pavements, they alleged.“As this involves the livelihood of the vendors, I will take a decision after discussions with the commissioner and elected representatives,” the mayor said while pointing out that MCC had issued identity cards to the vendors after collecting details about them and their stalls. She said the health and education standing committees would also be consulted.Commissioner Hegde said MCC was planning to move the vendors to designated hawking zones to ensure their livelihood was not affected. He explained that any drive to remove the vends was fraught with law and order problems. “False cases have been filed against MCC officers whenever they conducted drives against footpath food vendors in non-hawking zones. We will consult with the city police commissioner before taking any steps,” he said.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Rape accused who shot dead survivor’s dad held after encounter with police
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose.

Title: Priest found dead in basement of SNMC
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Agra: A body of a 70-year-old priest of Prithvinath Mahadev Temple in Peepal Mandi locality was found at the basement of the education block of SN Medical College (SNMC) on Wednesday. The priest was suffering from tuberculosis and was receiving treatment at the SNMC for past two years.

Identified as Devchand Jha, the priest had visited the SNMC on February 7 for a check-up and reportedly went missing. A missing case was then registered at the MM Gate police station on the complaint of his family. The SNMC administration has now constituted a three-member committee to conduct a probe.

Devchand’s son Babu Kant Jha said, “My father was suffering from tuberculosis. He was receiving treatment at SNMC for past two years. On February 7, he along with my mother Urmila Devi went for tests at the seven-storey building. My mother went to do some paperwork on the second floor after making my father wait in the gallery. On her return after 10 minutes, she could not find my father. We searched for him extensively but were not able to find him. Hospital staff didn’t help us. So, we filed a missing complaint at the MM gate police station on February 8.”

On Wednesday, Devchand’s relatives – after searching for him everywhere for the past few days – went to the building’s basement and found his body in a room.

A postmortem report suggests the main cause of his death was septicaemia. Devchand’s relatives, however, want the SNMC’s administration to show them footage of the building’s CCTV cameras.

SNMC principal GK Aneja said, “In the case related to a patient’s body found in the basement, a three-member committee has been constituted to conduct a probe. The panel will submit its report within three days. Suitable action will be taken on the basis of the probe report.”

Title: Fire force gears up to tackle forest blazes in summer
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Mysuru: Summer is here as are challenges for fire and emergency service personnel as well as forest officers.

The departments have geared up by taking precautions and conducting awareness programmes. The fire department has roped in Home Guards to tackle fire emergencies. Fire department personnel have been instructed not to take long leave during summer as that there’s no manpower shortage.

On an average, the fire department receives at least three calls and the number goes up several-fold in summer. Grass fires in forest areas are common. The forest department has stationed fire engines at vulnerable points.

Chief Fire Officer (in-charge) C Gurulingaiah confirmed to TOI that ten vehicles have been spared for the forest department. They have been sent to all reserve forest areas including Bandipur Tiger Reserve and Nagarahole National Park. These two tiger habitats have witnessed the worst fires in summer.

He said: “Special teams have been formed to attend to any emergencies. As dried grass catches fire and spreads fast, we face difficulties in dousing due to various factors including lack of access routes to the spot.” He’s in charge of five districts in southern Karnataka.

KC Prashanth Kumar, deputy conservator of forests, Mysuru, said all the fires reported in Mysuru forests, including Chamundi Hills last year, had spread from outside. He said: “One fire destroyed vast tracts of grass on the hill shrine in 2019, but all others were small. Utmost precaution is being taken this year to prevent fires. Fire lines have been created and there’s round-the-clock vigil, especially on Chamudi Hills, besides creating awareness on protecting the forest.”

Mock drill

Male Mahadeshwara Hills wildlife sanctuary authorities have organised forest fire extinguishing mock drill workshop for forest personnel at Ajjipura Nursery near Hanur in Chamarajanagar district on February 13.

Title: Notification for land acquisition issued
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: A year after the previously-issued notification for land acquisition lapsed, the national highway authority of India (NHAI) has issued another gazette notification for the acquisition of land in the Kadambattukonam–Kazhakkoottam stretch for the Cherthala–Thiruvananthapuram NH stretch widening project.

The 3 (A) notification was issued to announce the plan to acquire around 93 hectares. NHAI has issued 3 (A) notification for the 29-km Kazhakkoottam-Kadambattukonam stretch in the last week of January. Sources in NHAI said that they are expecting to complete the process for 3 (D) notification, which is publication of survey numbers and other details of the land after conducting a detailed survey. “Though the 3 (A) notification announces need to acquire 93 hectares, the actual area will be less after survey,” said sources.

NHAI has set a July target for issuing 3 (D) notification. It is also planning to float tender for the construction after publishing 3 (D) notification.

Already, land acquisition has made progress in remaining stretches in districts such as Alappuzha and Kollam. In Kollam, the land acquisition has made significant progress that NHAI is gearing up to publish 3 (D) notification. In Alappuzha, NHAI has completed 3 (A) proceedings.

If 3 (D) notification is not issued within one year after publishing 3 (A), the first notification will not have validity. This has happened to the Kazhakkoottam-Kadambattukonam stretch after ministry of road transport and highways (MoRTH) removed national highway projects in the state from ‘priority I list’ last year.

Sources in district administration said that though they had uploaded details in NHAI’s online site for publication of 3 (D) notification, it lapsed due to the exclusion of the project from the priority I list. The issue was resolved after the intervention of state government, which agreed to fund 25% of the land acquisition cost for widening of the national highway stretch.

As per the agreement with MoRTH, the 526-km national highway stretch from Thalappady to Kazhakkoottam will be widened in 45 metres.

It will be divided into 13 stretches, including the 29-km Kazhakkoottam–Kadambattukonam stretch. The remaining stretches are 39-km Thalapady–Chengala stretch, 37-km Chengala-Neeleshwaram ROB, 40-km Perole–Thalipparamba stretch, 36-km Thalipparamba–Muzhappilangadu stretch, 39-km Azhiyur–Vengalam stretch, 53-km Ramanattukara–Kuttuppuram stretch, 24-km Kuttippuram–Kappirikkad stretch, 89-km Kappirikkadu–Edappally stretch, 38-km Thuravoor–Paravoor stretch, 38-km Paravoor–Kottankulangara stretch, 32-km Kottankulangara–Kollam bypass stretch and 32-km Kollam bypass–Kadambattukonam stretch.

Title: Out to quell a clash, cops thrashed, locked in room
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Allahabad: It was a bizarre turn of events as law enforcers out on a rescue mission ended up themselves needing help, after a group of villagers allegedly manhandled and locked up three policemen for over an hour in Baharia area of the city on Wednesday night.

On Thursday, 23 persons, including seven women, were arrested for allegedly locking up three policemen in a room for over an hour in Karniapur village, under the limits of Baharia police station.

According to police, a police response vehicle (PRV) team was alerted about two rival groups allegedly clashing over illegal construction on a disputed piece of land in Karniapur village around 11pm on Wednesday.

Baharia police said the two groups were led by Ram Prasad and Ram Kumar, who have been at loggerheads over a property since the past two years.

Police also said that Ram Kumar’s son Manoj was supposed to get married on February 16. “However, when the policemen reached the spot, they saw the women from Ram Kumar’s family singing in celebration.

SSP (Allahabad) Satyarth Anirudh Pankaj said, “As police started inquiring about the allegations, some of the women got agitated and manhandled the cops. They were later joined by the he rest of the family members and they locked the three policemen in a room.”

The policemen tried to assure the women that they were just trying to find out who called them with the fake information, but the latter were not ready to listen them.

Police said that the person who called them on Wednesday night had claimed that he/she was from Ram Prasad’s family. However, police are still verifying the details of the call.

Meanwhile, local villagers alerted Baharia police that the family had locked up three policemen. The policemen were rescued after more cops from other thanas rushed to their help.

The arrested persons include the groom Manoj. The driver of the PRV Lal Chandra lodged a case under sections 147, 148, 149, 341, 342, 332, 353, 323, 504, and 506 of the Indian Penal Code and section 7 of CLA Act.

Title: Touching Samajwadi Party leader’s feet lands Mathura cop in police lines
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose.

AGRA: UP Police has initiated a preliminary inquiry against Mathura’s circle officer (city) Rakesh Yadav, after a photograph purportedly showing him touching the feet of Samajwadi party general secretary Ram Gopal Yadav went viral on social media.

Confirming this, IG (Agra range) A Satish Ganesh told TOI that CO Yadav has been removed from his post, pending inquiry, and has been attached to the police lines.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Rape survivor, 15, left studies after traumatic episode, now demands death for accused who killed dad
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representational Image

Title: Blood spills on city roads: 45 fatal accidents in Jan alone
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

killer roads

Allahabad: Promised efforts of the traffic police to curb accidents notwithstanding, there has been no let-up in bloodspill on city roads this year. In fact, the numbers have only gone up, even if marginally.

As many as 45 people lost their lives and 53 were injured in 109 road accidents in January. Most of the victims who died were in the 18-35 age group. During the corresponding period in 2019, there were 103 accidents, which claimed 42 lives and left 68 injured.

The graph is curiously going north at a time city police say they are analysing each and every accident to find out how and why it happened and whether it could have been averted.

Allahabad SSP Satyarth Anirudh Pankaj said speeding was the single largest factor behind majority of accidents. “We are focussed on checking reckless driving. Three police teams equipped with speed guns are manning 22 streets identified as accident-prone. Police stations are also tightening the noose around speed limit violators,” he said.

To make their plan foolproof, the SSP said, traffic police had decided to rope in educational institutions to spread the message of road safety. “Safe driving practices are no secret, but people choose to ignore them all the time. By roping in students to spread the word, we hope to make city streets safer,” he added.

Despite having the lowest number of black spots — only 10 on national highways, state highways and major city arteries combined — among districts, as many as 570 people lost their lives and over 900 were injured in 1,365 road accidents in Allahabad last year.

The summer of 2019 recorded the maximum bloodspill. June saw 71 fatal accidents, followed by March with 68 and May with 59. December, on the other hand, saw 33 deaths and November 43.

Title: SIT to bust flesh trade, trafficking rackets along Rajasthan border
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Agra: Days after Rajasthan Police rescued a Firozabad woman who was abducted, gang-raped and sold thrice in three years, Agra additional director general of police Ajay Anand has constituted a special investigation team on Thursday to crack down on the human trafficking rackets operating in the region.

The SIT, consisting of Agra SSP and Firozabad SP, would work closely with Rajasthan Police to bust flesh trade and trafficking of women and teen girls in Dholpur, Dausa, Jaipur and other neighbouring areas.

The ADG said, “Agra range IG Satish Ganesh and I will monitor the progress. Sirsaganj circle officer Iraj Raja has started investigation into the Firozabad woman’s case.”

Meanwhile, police in Dholpur conducted multiple raids in the remote forests of Kanchanpur to locate the woman’s two-year-old daughter. Sepau (Dholpur district) circle officer Vijay Kumar said, “We conducted raids at multiple locations but the accused managed to flee.”

Title: Uttarakhand cabinet amends definition of deemed forest
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

CM of Uttrakhand

DEHRADUN: Uttarakhand cabinet , which met late on Thursday evening at chief minister ’s residence, amended the definition of deemed forest. Now, the state definition of a deemed forest is “a land patch of 5 hectares or more with 40 per cent canopy density”.

In November last year, the government had defined a deemed forest as “a land patch of 10 hectare or above with 60% canopy density and 75% native plant species”. This definition had raised the heckles of environmentalist who had accused the government of “favouring the builder lobby by defining deemed forests in such a manner that many actual forests will not be recognised officially as forests and therefore not require clearance by forest department for commercial activity.”

The matter had also reached the high court which had put a stay on the definition.

Title: Rachakonda cops get 143 convictions
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: Two persons were given death sentences and four others life terms in the past six-and-a-half months for various crimes in Rachakonda police commissionerate limits.

In all, 143 persons were convicted in 184 cases. Among those convicted include Marri Srinivas Reddy, who was given death in the Hajipur case.

Police were able to secure one conviction each for 12 years, 10 years and seven years of imprisonment.

In three cases they were able secure conviction of five years. In 10 cases, conviction of three years was secured.

A fast-track court recently convicted Marri Srinivas Reddy, the accused in the Hajipur serial killings, to death for the rape and murder of three minor girls.

In the Hayathnagar case of 2016, the accused, Ch Ramesh, was sentenced to undergo life imprisonment for killing his father.

In another case, accused Challa Shiva Prasad was sentenced to life imprisonment for killing a colleague.

The incident occurred in under Medipally police limits in 2015.

Title: Dehradun: Government staff to protest over reservation in promotion
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

DEHRADUN: Around 1.5 lakh government employees, under the umbrella of over a dozen associations, are all set for what they have termed ‘a mega protest’ on Friday. The employees will protest for “immediate removal of the restrictions on Departmental Promotion Committee and compliance of the Supreme Court order on the issue of reservation in promotion.”

The employees would gather at the Parade Ground and thereafter, stage a march towards the secretariat. Earlier too, the General and OBC employees have held a number of protests to push their demands.

Deepak Joshi, the president of state secretariat association told TOI, "We are expecting presence of over 1.5 lakh employees. Many employees have retired without getting a promotion and we cannot wait any longer. Justice should not be delayed."

He pointed out that the employees have strongly opposed the reaction of former Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on the issue of reservation. "Therefore, we held a protest against him and his party. We will not stop till the time justice is delivered. We are also opposing any change in the reservation roster for direct recruitment in government jobs."

Title: Chennai metro rail labels Southern Railway encroacher, issues notice
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Southern Railway and Chennai Metro Rail Ltd ( CMRL ) are locked in yet another dispute.

In a letter on February 8, the Tamil Nadu government agency accused the central government department of encroaching 2,680sqft of its land on Tiruvottiyur High Road near Wimco Nagar playground . This comes two months after Southern Railway issued a notice to CMRL over taking control of railway land beside Egmore station.

Railway officials, who requested anonymity, said the latest action of CMRL appeared similar to a tit-for-tat battle between both transportation agencies.

In the letter to the chief administrative officer (CAO), construction, CMRL alleged that Southern Railway has unauthorizedly occupied its land by laying a track foundation and erecting an overhead electric line post in block number 14, ward-C, in Tiruvottiyur town.

The letter written by the estate officer and joint general manager (JGM) of CMRL, is a notice under Section (4) of Public Premises (Eviction of Unauthorised Occupants) Act, 1971, which has asked the railway to explain its stand on or before February 24 and threatened to evict it.

The encroachment is 3.6 metres on the north side, 2.2 metres on the south and 35.8, 28.2 and 22.6 metres on the east and the west side. The total area is 240sqm or 2,680sqft.

Chennai divisional railway manager (DRM) P Mahesh did not respond to calls from TOI for a response.

A highly placed source in Southern Railway told TOI that in railway circles, this was being viewed as a counter-attack from CMRL. “In the Egmore issue in December, railways had publicly pasted a notice for everyone to see,” the source said.

Earlier also, Southern Railway and CMRL have had issues over payment of dues with regard to their lines criss-crossing each other’s property. In fact, a retired top SR official was appointed by CMRL as a consultant to iron out differences with his erstwhile department, said railway sources.

Title: Surat-Sharjah flight gets new moniker — ‘smuggling flight’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Surat: With the arrest of a man travelling from Sharjah with 200 grams of gold worth Rs 9 lakh at Surat airport on late Tuesday night, the lone international flight between Surat and Sharjah has earned a bad name of being the ‘smuggling flight’.

Since it has started its commercial operations from February, 2019, the flight operated by Air India Express, has become favourite for gold smugglers. In the last one year, the air intelligence unit of customs department has seized about six kilograms of smuggled gold worth over Rs 4 crore.

In October, 2019, the air intelligence unit had arrested a man hailing from Valsad with gold bars and bracelets valued at over Rs 90 lakh. The accused had hidden the gold bars and bracelets, stitched in his trousers and shoes to escape the preying eyes of the customs officials.

Nainesh Pachchigar, member of All India Gems and Jewellery Domestic Council (GJF) said, “Gold smuggling has increased as the customs duty on gold has not been reduced by the government. Surat is the hub of jewellery manufacturing and people are trying to get gold through illegal channels to escape paying 12.5% customs duty on gold.”

In many smuggling cases, persons involved in smuggling of gold were residents of Mumbai and they used innovative ways to smuggle the contraband into the diamond city.

While some brought the gold capsules hidden in the rectum, other brought the gold paste stitched in the clothes and shoes.

According to the figures available from Airports Authority of India (AAI), about 4,000 passengers per month use Surat airport to travel to Sharjah. In December last year, the number of passengers from the airport has gone up to about 5,500 per month.

Customs officials stated that the smugglers are aware of the loopholes in the customs laws and they smuggle gold less than Rs 20 lakh value to avoid arrest. The customs rules related to gold import had been changed in 2013. Earlier, passengers with imported gold with less than Rs 5 lakh value allowed to go with a penalty. Customs officials had to file criminal case against the passengers only if imported gold valued at above Rs 5 lakh.

Title: Six injured in clash during ‘Bheem Shobha Yatra’, house set afire; 6 held
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Kanpur: As many as six persons were injured and a house was set afire in a clash between members of Dalit and upper caste communities in Mangta village under the limits of Gajner police station in Kanpur Dehat district on Thursday morning. Six persons have been arrested in this connection.

Both the communities allegedly clashed during ‘Bheem Shobha Yatra ’ which was being taken out after the culmination of ‘Bheem Katha’ organised by members of Dalit community in Gautam Buddha park in the village outskirts on February 8.

“After the culmination of ‘Bheem Katha’, members of Dalit community took out ‘Bheem Shobha Yatra’ in the village on Thursday morning. Both the communities entered into an altercation after a minor youth allegedly hit the poster of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar with a stick. Both the groups allegedly started pelting stones at each other injuring around six persons,” said a police official. Additional force from nearby police stations and PAC was rushed to the village to control the situation, said the official. The injured have been admitted to the district hospital in Akbarpur, he added.

SP Kanpur Dehat Anurag Vatsa, who along with senior district officials visited the village, said that adequate force has been deployed and strict action will be initiated against those responsible for the incident.

“We have arrested six persons in this regard. Situation is under control and we have asked villagers to not believe in rumours,” SP said adding that the incident was fallout of a conflict involving a minor boy who had allegedly hit a stick on Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar’s poster. Investigations are underway in this regard.

Title: Rent-a-car service launched at rly station
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Southern railway on Wednesday launched rent-a-car facility at Thiruvananthapuram Central Railway Station .

Passengers arriving at Thiruvananthapuram Central railway station can drive away in the rented cars which they could book online during the travel.

This rental car service is operated by IndusGo Pvt. Ltd.

As many as five cars will be available at the railway station for booking by passengers. The booking and payment system is completely online at Indusgo.in.

Railways had invited quotations to award the licence for operating the rent a car services at Thiruvananthapuram Central for a period of three months on pilot basis. Among the three responses, IndusGo received the quotation.

An initiative of the commercial wing of Thiruvananthapuram division, Southern Railway, the facility will earn railways a non-fare revenue of Rs 3.6 lakh for three months.

Ajay Kaushik, station director, Thiruvananthapuram Central, flagged off the first car, formally inaugurating the facility on Wednesday. Rajesh Chandran, senior divisional commercial manager accompanied by Balamurali M, divisional commercial manager, Thiruvananthapuram division, drove the first rental car service.

“The facility is introduced on pilot basis. Based on the response, the proposal for long-term facility will be considered. Another plan to introduce rent-a-bike scheme at various stations under the division on long term is also under discussion,” said Balamurali.

Parking slots for two vehicles have been provided in front of the station and the station authority will arrange space to park rest of the vehicles too.

The similar rent-a-car facility was also launched at Ernakulam South, Ernakulam North and Thrissur railway stations.

Title: Karnataka: Woman, lover’s plan to kill her hubby fails
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

HASSAN: The attempt of a woman and her boyfriend to kill her husband went horribly wrong with the latter successfully resisting it at Maragondanahalli village in Arasikere Rural police limits.

The incident happened around midnight on Monday, after which the woman, Ramya, 24, and her unidentified lover have gone underground.

It is said Ramya laced poison with food and fed dinner to her husband Anand, 34, a farmer. She and her lover had planned to strangulate Anand when he was fast asleep after dinner that would induce him sound sleep.

With the help of her boyfriend, Ramya allegedly tied her husband’s hands and legs to the cot using veils. But when the lovers tried strangulating Anand using another veil, he woke up and screamed. Hearing his SOS calls, his mother Nanjundamma too woke up and cried for help. Convinced that their game was up, the lovers fled the spot on a motorbike.

After preliminary treatment at the taluk hospital, Anand was referred to the district hospital, where is recovering.

A case was registered on Tuesday evening under IPC sections 307 (attempt to murder) and 34 (criminal act done by several persons in furtherance of common intention).

SP R Srinivas Gowda said a team has been formed to arrest the accused. Whether the woman had an extra-marital affair can be confirmed only after the investigation, he added.

According to police, the couple had an arranged marriage five years ago, and has a son.

Title: 2,000 disabled people to receive motorised wheelchairs in Tamil Nadu
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: As many as 2,000 people with disabilities in the state will be provided new battery-operated wheelchairs by April, said V Saroja, minister of social welfare and nutritious meal programme. She made the announcement at an event on Thursday. “The 2,000 people we have on the list are in dire need and they will be given the wheelchairs first,” said the minister. “Later, we will distribute the chairs to others depending on their medical need,” she said and added that the chairs cost Rs 72,000 each.

The government made the announcement regarding this last year but was criticised by activists and people with disabilities after it allegedly failed to fulfill its promise. In 2017 too the government said it would provide 1,000 motorised wheelchairs , but less than 200 people received it. Some beneficiaries claimed they were damaged.

Johny Tom Varghese, commissioner of department of welfare of differently abled persons, said the wheelchairs have a 3-year guarantee and people can approach the distributing agency in case of repairs. “As many as 872 people have been provided with the automated wheelchairs. They had severe spinal disorders. Five thousand more are in the pipeline and they will be distributed soon.”

Saroja announced that they will also implement home-based intervention programmes in 23 blocks in Tirunelveli and Tuticorin districts. As part this, an early intervention specialist will visit the child and its family at home and provide comprehensive services. It is meant to serve children aged under five with developmental delays and disabilities and help address their unique needs. “A child responds better when he/she is at home with their families. This pilot project was successful, hence we decided to expand it to other rural areas. But, we are also looking at expanding the services across the state,” said Saroja. A sum of Rs 2.37 crore has been sanctioned for the project.

Title: Govt depts need to seek nod for digging road or face action
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Kanpur: To check the practice of digging roads for various projects without seeking permission, the district administration has decided to make a WhatsApp group of officials to monitor such work. Besides, if a department digs road without permission then an FIR would be lodged against it, said the district magistrate.

Divisional commissioner, ADG, DIG, SP Traffic, ADM city, all additional city magistrates, municipal corporation, PWD, Jal Nigam, Jal Sansthan, Kesco and other departments and public representatives will be included in this group which will monitor the situation and will also review it in every 15 days.

If any department will dig road without permission then an FIR would be lodged against it, said DM Kanpur Nagar Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari during a meeting with all departments on Thursday. The meeting was held to work on establishing a better coordination between all the departments.

During the meeting, the DM said that in case of an emergency the concern department must inform the group about digging of road. The spot to be dug should be barricaded properly and a flex board displaying period of completing the project should also be raised near the spot, he added.

He also asked the authorities to lodge an FIR against the contractor in case of violation of norms. No road should be dug without seeking permission and a news should published in newspaper before digging of the road also mentioning the time of completion of the work. The departments which had covered the manholes on the road while construction of roads will be responsible to open them.

In a specific direction, Tiwari asked the municipal officials to ensure that all roads and drains are mapped digitally.

Title: Chennai: Extra Rs 10 lakh compensation for man who died in septic tank
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The National Commission for Safai Karamcharis has ordered an additional Rs 10 lakh compensation to a worker who died of asphyxiation in a septic tank in Express Avenue in November last year.

Metrowater authorities said Jagadish Hirmani, member, National Commission for Safai Karamcharis, visited the city on Tuesday and inspected Express Avenue, where the worker, employed to clean a septic tank, died. Metrowater officials and police officers accompanied Hirmani during the visit.

The police officers told Hirmani that the state government had earlier provided a compensation of Rs 14 lakh to the victim’s family. Hirmani also interacted with the family members of the worker and conveyed his condolences and announced that an additional Rs 10 lakh would be given to the family. Apart from paying additional compensation, Hirmani also ordered Express Avenue to provide employment to one of the family members of the deceased.

Hirmani then visited Jaswanth Nagar in Mogappair West, where a welder and a helper had died in a well. However, Metrowater officials told Hirmani that both were not sanitary workers. Moreover, as per the terms and conditions in the contract, contractors should provide safety gear to the workers hired by them. Metrowater has told contractors to distribute the safety gear to the workers, Hirmani was informed.

Later, Hirmani attended a meeting at Metrowater headquarters in Chintadripet and was informed that Metrowater was not employing people to clean manholes in the city. Instead, an automatic machine developed a year ago was being used.

Title: GVC opinion sought over health certificate issued by pvt veteriarian
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Palanpur: The Banaskantha district veterinary officier has sought opinion from the Gujarat Veterinary Council (GVC) over health certificates issued to 800 sheep and goats issued by a private veterinary doctor in the district.

The health certificates to the animals that were to be exported from Tuna port in Kutch, were issued couple of months back by veterinarian N N Pandhar based in Chibhada village of Banaskantha. On Thursday, trustee of a Rajapur Panjrapole (cattle shed) in Deesa, Bharat Kothari questioned the authority of a private practitioner to issue health certificates for such huge number of animals.

Kothari had raised the issue during meeting of cattle shed operators with chief minister Vijay Rupani.

Deputy district veterinary officer P K Mistry told TOI, “Pandhar is a private veterinary doctor based in in Chibhada village of Deodar taluka and is an authorised practitioner authorised to issue health certificates for animals that are to be exported under Veterinary Council Act 1984.”

“However, after the issue was raised by the cattle shed owners we have sought guidance of GVC,” he added.

Title: Nine hawker zones to end roadside clutter and chaos
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Indore: Smart solutions for Smart City. Roadside haat bazaars and vegetable markets will soon disappear to ensure free flow of traffic in Indore. Nine hawker zones are being developed by Indore Municipal Corporation to accommodate vendors of 11 bazaars to end roadside clutter and chaos. This is a fresh plan by civic officials to set up hawker zones across city as earlier plans could not materialize due to lack of intent, execution plans and resistance from vendors. But this time officials claim that the plan will be successfully implemented.

“Around 900 vendors are running their business in 11 such vegetable markets and weekly haat bazaars and nine alternate space have been identified for shifting these markets,” IMC’s public works department’s executive engineer NS Tomar told TOI.

The list includes markets of areas like Luv Kush Mandi, Barla Khajrana, Malwa Mill, Itwariya Bazaar among others. Three more such markets have earlier been shifted by civic body from Pipliyahana, Navlakha and Patnipura.

Civic body’s public works department officials said that an independent survey was conducted to identify vegetable markets or haat bazaars obstructing free flow of traffic and ascertain number of vendors or shopkeepers in each one of these markets.

“Work on developing alternate space as hawker zones by providing basic facilities to vendors like water, lights etc are on. Once it gets done, corporation will start shifting these markets to hawker zones,” Tomar added.

These markets were identified on basis of a list prepared by city traffic police, where people have to search for parking space and get stuck in long traffic jams. Cops had pointed out roadside encroachments by vendors and shopkeepers on these routes as one of the main reasons affecting vehicular movement.

Title: KWA to conduct revenue adalats in all districts
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Kerala Water Authority ( KWA ) will soon conduct revenue adalats in all districts to resolve complaints of consumers and to improve revenue.

The district-level revenue adalaths are being organized based on the direction of water resources department minister K Krishnankutty.

Consumers with complaints regarding faulty meters, fine for arrears, inaccurate calculation of readings, inaccurate bills for domestic and non-domestic consumers, connections without any documents, revenue recovery and legal cases will be heard during the adalath.

Those participating in Thiruvananthapuram district adalath should submit their complaints at the office of assistant executive engineer of respective divisions.

The applications should contain details such as consumers number, address, pincode and phone number. The date and time of adalath will be announced later.

The Thiruvananthapuram PH circle superintending engineer said that all consumers with complaints must make use of the opportunity and submit their applications.

The following are the contact numbers of assistant executive engineers of central sub-division, Thiruvananthapuram — 8547638177, west sub-division, Pongumoodu — 8547638176, north sub-division, Kowdiar — 8547638186, east sub-division, PTP Nagar — 8547638191, south sub-division, Kuriathy — 8547638194, water supply sub division, Neyyatinkara — 8547638094, water supply sub-division, Kanjiramkulam — 8547638098, water supply sub-division, Varkala — 8547638359, water supply sub-division, Attingal — 8547638356, water supply sub-division, Nedumangadu — 9496586222.

Title: 3 deer found dead in Bankura
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Bankura: The carcass of three deer in Boropukuria, within the sprawling Mukutmanipur Deer Park in the Ranibandh forest range on Thursday led to wide-spread protests. Senior forest officials feel the three, which had visible marks of injuries, had been attacked by dogs or wild boars. Bijoy Kumar, DFO (Bankura South), said, “It appears to be a wild boar or dog attack. The deer had escaped the nets with hem the deer park leading to the incident. A high-level enquiry has been ordered.”

Locals alleged that the net which was set up in 1982 has been torn apart at many places and no steps have been taken to repair or replace it. The Mukutmanipur Deer Park is a major tourist destination which is slowly seeing a rapid fall in its deer population which was around 150 before, locals alleged. The locals also staged a protest.

Title: 23-year-old held hostage, forced to marry ex-lover in UP's Kanpur
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

KANPUR: A youth from Kanpur Dehat district, who had gone to distribute his wedding invites in neighbouring Jalaun district was held hostage by the family of her ex-lover and was forced to marry her on Wednesday. The 23-year-old youth was also thrashed by the girl’s family.

The youth was released only after someone tipped-off Sirsa Kalar police. Cops rushed to the house where he was held captive and rescued him.

SHO Sirsa Kalar, Saurabh Singh said Raghvendra Singh (23), was a native of Nadai village in Rajpur area of Kanpur Dehat district and was in a relationship with a girl from a village in Jalaun district.

His family members, however, had fixed his marriage with another girl. “On Wednesday, he left home on a motorcycle for Bhitari village in Jalaun to distribute wedding invitation cards to his relatives. On way back, he went to meet his ‘ex-lover’, but was held hostage by her parents and siblings,” said the SHO.

Raghvendra was allegedly thrashed and forcibly married to his ex-lover at her house, said the SHO.

The girl’s sibling filmed the entire act. Singh said after the wedding rituals, Raghvendra was allegedly threatened to remain silent and live with the girl.

However, the police, on being alerted by some villagers, rushed to the spot and rescued the youth. “We have rescued the boy, but none from the either sides have lodged any complaint in this regard,” said the SHO.

Title: Notification for social audit chief’s post quashed
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Chennai: The Madras high court has observed that social activists and people who have directly worked with the grass-root level in rural areas, will be more suitable for the post of director of social audit society of Tamil Nadu which implements schemes like MGNREGA.

Justice N Anand Venkatesh made the observation while quashing a notification issued by the state for recruitment to the post without prescribing qualification in accordance with the MGNREGA Act and Rules.

“Only those persons (social activists) will be able to maintain independence and ensure that the scheme is properly implemented and ensure that the money actually reaches poor persons who have been given the minimum guarantee of 100 days employment,” the judge said.

Allowing the plea moved by S Sattanathan, a former director of the body, the court directed the state to issue a fresh notification prescribing qualification in accordance with the act and rules within four weeks.

Title: Odisha: Government, opposition line up ammo for House budget session
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

BHUBANESWAR: Mismanagement in paddy procurement, law and order, corruption, unemployment and irregularities in implementation of rural housing schemes are some on the issues on which the opposition parties are planning to corner the government when the budget session of the assembly kicks off on Friday.

The ruling BJD has also chalked out its strategy to counter the opposition attack with chief minister Naveen Patnaik chairing a meeting of the legislature party members on Thursday.

“The important budget session of the assembly begins on Friday. As far as the opposition parties are concerned, we are ready to face any question on the floor of the house,” Naveen told reporters after the meeting. Naveen also asked his party MLAs to be present in the house during key businesses like question hour, zero-hour, adjournment debates, budget discussion and during discussion on issues related to the state’s interest. The MLAs have been asked to inform government chief whip Pramila Mallik in case they are on leave. The BJP and the Congress too held legislature party meetings on the eve of the budget session. Briefing reporters, BJP chief whip Mohan Majhi said, “The state government has deprived the backward classes in providing their constitutional rights. There has been gross irregularities in selection of beneficiaries under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. The mandi system has collapsed while farmers are facing a tough time. Crime against women are also increasing. All these issues will be raised by our party to corner the government during the session.” Congress legislature party leader Narasingha Mishra said farmers are under distress as they are not able to sell their paddy because of the discrepancies in the paddy procurement system. “Law and order situation has collapsed in the state. Incidents like robbery, murder and rape has increased in Odisha . Corruption is at its peak. Other issues like failure in implementation of state government schemes and unemployment issues will also be raised by the Congress party,” said Mishra.

Reduced central allocation in the Union budget, demand for socio-economic caste census along with the 2021 general census and low allocation to Odisha from the national clean energy cess are some of the issues that the treasury bench plans to raise during the session.

State parliamentary affairs minister Bikram Keshari Arukh said the government will also introduce and pass some legislations during the session. The budget session of the assembly will be on till April 9 in two phases. The 31-day session would begin with an address by governor Ganeshi Lal. Finance minister Niranjan Pujari will table the budget for 2020-21 on February 18.

Title: V-Day no more ‘best of times’ for florists
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Indore: Times change. Arrival of new fancy gifts like stuffed toys, greeting cards, imported chocolates and mirror based digital photo-frames has changed the trend of Valentine’s Day gift making this ‘the best of times’ for florists turn into an era, where survival is considered an existential win.

“It’s only on Rose day of Valentine’s week that flower business flourishes since it’s a mandatory custom followed by the cupid-struck. Earlier, people used to propose by just offering a rose bouquet, when sales were constant and monetary losses incurred were less,” said florist Anil Agrawal.

Another cause for decline in business of floral industry is large influx of artificial flowers, which is hampering livelihood of local and small florists. People are lured towards artificial flowers because of its durability and constant freshness. “This year, business has seen a decline of 35-40% compared to last year’s Valentine’s week sale. The new age couples are inclined towards exchange of gifts and purchase flowers only as a symbolic gesture,” said another florist Akash Limbodiya.

Lifespan of flowers is two weeks at the most but gift items stay intact for a longer duration thereby making it more preferable.

“Without a flower bouquet, my Valentine’s Day would be incomplete, but now the prices of rose bouquets are sky high. I only buy a pair of rose to keep with the spirit of Valentine’s Day,” said Ushma Upadhayaya.

Title: Amit Shah: Provocative slogans may have hurt BJP in Delhi elections, but not sure
Content: NEW DELHI: In his first public address after the Delhi elections, Union home minister Amit Shah on Thursday said BJP may have suffered in the Delhi elections because of controversial statements like "goli maaro" and "India-Pakistan match", but added that there was no way to really know why "people pressed which button" inside a polling booth.Speaking at the Times Now Summit, Shah termed the controversial remarks "unfortunate" and said those should not have been made. He also said the party had distanced itself from those comments immediately. The minister, who was responding to a question, did not rule out the possibility of the provocative utterances contributing to the setback. "BJP may have suffered but there was no precise way to figure out why people pressed which button inside the polling booth," he said.Shah, who spearheaded BJP's campaign and had predicted a win, conceded that his assessment of the party's prospects turned out to be wrong.Responding to questions on the space for protests in a democratic set-up, Amit Shah said while peaceful protests ought to be allowed, no one had permission to break the law. Shah also defended Delhi Police for entering the Jamia Millia Islamia University, saying cops went after students who had burnt buses, scooters and cars. "Those whose cars and scooters were burnt also have rights," he said, adding, "I stand firmly with the police" for entering the campus.The home minister accepted that his "assessment" of BJP's performance in the Delhi elections had turned out to be wrong, but emphasised that he had been right in his assessment in many states.He argued that BJP did not contest polls only to win them but also, equally, to increase the party's ideological footprint and dismissed suggestions that the debacle in Delhi marked a rejection of the party's ideology."We do not fight elections just for electoral victory or defeat. BJP is a party that believes in expanding its ideology. I have given everything in every election. This is not the first time we have lost. I am a worker of BJP and I believe it is important for us to go out to the people of the country to take the idea of BJP and our views to people. BJP is an ideology-based party. Elections are an opportunity for us to spread our ideology. We don't fight only to win. I accept the Delhi verdict with all humility and in good spirit, we will sit it in the opposition and will see how the Delhi government works," he said.Debunking the argument that a string of defeats in state polls meant the party's ideology was "shrinking" (after losses in Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Maharashtra and Delhi), Shah said, "In Lok Sabha elections, Arvind Kejriwal came third (in Delhi). But does that mean he was rejected? That is a wrong analogy. Ideology is only one of the many things that contribute to an electoral win."The minister attacked Congress for vitiating the political atmosphere by spreading misinformation about CAA. "I welcome the discussion on CAA but those who are opposing it should also tell me the reason for their criticism of it. No one is able to tell me why they think it is anti-Muslim or anti-minority," he said.He defended the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) against the charge that it was discriminatory and was designed to strip Muslims of their citizenship, but said he was ready to debate the changes in law with "anyone" - even those protesting at Shaheen Bagh. "Whoever wants to meet me is welcome. Seek time from my office and I promise I will meet them within three days. The discussion, however, will have to be on the merits of the case," the minister said.Shah, however, emphasised that for every person protesting against CAA, there were lakhs who stood in support of the government’s move.Shah also reiterated the BJP's charge that both the CAA and NRC were originally conceptualised by previous Congress governments.He did not agree with the contention that fear of CAA being a precursor to a National Register of Citizens had led to unrest. "You cannot protest in anticipation of what will come. Raise issues about NRC when it comes. But I have already clarified that there is no decision about NRC in the government as yet," he added.Shah said the government was investigating Popular Front of India's alleged involvement in funding anti-CAA protests around India and the report, once prepared, would be put in public domain and suitable action would be taken, if needed.Commenting on the issue of restoring "normalcy" in J&K after the abrogation of Article 370, Shah said the decision to book former CMs Mehbooba Mufti, Omar Abdullah and Farooq Abdullah was taken by the local administration. He claimed that the Centre had no role in it, and said opposition politicians were free to travel to the region if they wanted. "No one tried to go. If they try to go now, they can go. Yashwant Sinha went. So did Arun Shourie. It is just that they didn't get the media attention they wanted," Shah said.In Video: Delhi polls: BJP may have suffered due to controversial remarks made by some party leaders, says Amit Shah at Times Now summit

Title: Amit Shah: Provocative slogans may have hurt BJP in Delhi elections, but not sure
Content: NEW DELHI: In his first public address after the Delhi elections, Union home minister Amit Shah on Thursday said BJP may have suffered in the Delhi elections because of controversial statements like "goli maaro" and "India-Pakistan match", but added that there was no way to really know why "people pressed which button" inside a polling booth.Speaking at the Times Now Summit, Shah termed the controversial remarks "unfortunate" and said those should not have been made. He also said the party had distanced itself from those comments immediately. The minister, who was responding to a question, did not rule out the possibility of the provocative utterances contributing to the setback. "BJP may have suffered but there was no precise way to figure out why people pressed which button inside the polling booth," he said.Shah, who spearheaded BJP's campaign and had predicted a win, conceded that his assessment of the party's prospects turned out to be wrong.Responding to questions on the space for protests in a democratic set-up, Amit Shah said while peaceful protests ought to be allowed, no one had permission to break the law. Shah also defended Delhi Police for entering the Jamia Millia Islamia University, saying cops went after students who had burnt buses, scooters and cars. "Those whose cars and scooters were burnt also have rights," he said, adding, "I stand firmly with the police" for entering the campus.The home minister accepted that his "assessment" of BJP's performance in the Delhi elections had turned out to be wrong, but emphasised that he had been right in his assessment in many states.He argued that BJP did not contest polls only to win them but also, equally, to increase the party's ideological footprint and dismissed suggestions that the debacle in Delhi marked a rejection of the party's ideology."We do not fight elections just for electoral victory or defeat. BJP is a party that believes in expanding its ideology. I have given everything in every election. This is not the first time we have lost. I am a worker of BJP and I believe it is important for us to go out to the people of the country to take the idea of BJP and our views to people. BJP is an ideology-based party. Elections are an opportunity for us to spread our ideology. We don't fight only to win. I accept the Delhi verdict with all humility and in good spirit, we will sit it in the opposition and will see how the Delhi government works," he said.Debunking the argument that a string of defeats in state polls meant the party's ideology was "shrinking" (after losses in Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Maharashtra and Delhi), Shah said, "In Lok Sabha elections, Arvind Kejriwal came third (in Delhi). But does that mean he was rejected? That is a wrong analogy. Ideology is only one of the many things that contribute to an electoral win."The minister attacked Congress for vitiating the political atmosphere by spreading misinformation about CAA. "I welcome the discussion on CAA but those who are opposing it should also tell me the reason for their criticism of it. No one is able to tell me why they think it is anti-Muslim or anti-minority," he said.He defended the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) against the charge that it was discriminatory and was designed to strip Muslims of their citizenship, but said he was ready to debate the changes in law with "anyone" - even those protesting at Shaheen Bagh. It is just that they didn't get the media attention they wanted," Shah said.In Video: Delhi polls: BJP may have suffered due to controversial remarks made by some party leaders, says Amit Shah at Times Now summit

Title: Prisoners allege atrocities by Chamoli Jail warder, HC takes suo motu cognizance
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

The Uttarakhand high court

NAINITAL: The Uttarakhand high court (HC) on Thursday ordered the state government to look into the allegations of atrocities committed by the chief warder of Chamoli Jail .

The high court has taken suo motu cognizance of a letter written by a group of prisoners who alleged that warder of the jail has brutally beaten up several prisoners and in some cases even draped them in blanket and then used a stick to deal severe blows on the feet. “The court has taken a stern view on these allegations and has asked us to check the veracity of the allegations and respond within a week,” said Paresh Tripathi, chief standing counsel for the Uttarakhand government.

The letter has also alleged that warder doesn’t even allow inmates basic activities and if his orders are not followed, the inmates are again harassed. The inmates alleged that the harassment and physical torture are very common in the jail but the authorities have taken no action against the warder

Tripathi, meanwhile, added that they will look into the serious allegations and file a response on the next date of hearing.

The condition of jails and the lack of even basic facilities have been an issue in Uttarakhand. The court had earlier taken cognizance of another letter written by the inmates who had said that jail didn’t even have telephones for inmates to call their families.

The government, meanwhile, has now said that it will install calling facilities in jails across the state in collaboration with the BSNL and the inmates will be allowed to talk to their families for a limited time.

Title: Odisha: Khurda-Balangir railway line land acquisition likely by August
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The state government has set an August 2020 target to complete the land acquisition for the crucial Khurda Road-Balangir railway line , implementation of which has been delayed by years. Sanctioned in 1994-95, only 94 km (14 km from Balangir side and 80 km from Khurda Road side) of the 289-km project has been completed so far.

Slow progress of land acquisition and lack of adequate funds are some of the reasons behind delay in implementation of the project, an official said. “I reviewed the progress of the Khurda Road-Balangir rail project. Instruction has been issued to expedite the land acquisition process,” said state commerce and transport minister Padmanabha Behera.

An official said the Prime Minister’s Office has been reviewing progress of the major infrastructure project.

Responding to queries on delay in land acquisition, Behera said, the delay in land acquisition is because of hurdles in acquisition of forest land. As the project is set to pass through some of the economically-backward and less-rail connected districts like Nayagarh, Boudh, Sonepur and Balangir, completion of the project is one of the priorities of both the state government and railways.

An official source said land acquisition for the project in Sonepur and Nayagarh district is in the final stage while that in Balangir has been completed. Land acquisition is mostly incomplete in Boudh district.

“Of around 2,050 acres of private land, we have so far acquired around 200 acres for the project. The process has been expedited to acquire the remaining land. In Boudh, around 500 acres of forest land will be acquired,” said a senior government official.

In Sonepur, the government has so far acquired over 400 acres of private land of the total requirement of 522 acres. Acquisition of 80 acres of total 105 acres of government land has been completed. All private land in Nayagarh district has been acquired except land in two villages, an official said.

The government and rail ministry had signed an MoU in July 2015 to jointly develop the Daspalla-Balangir (177km) stretch. According to the MoU, the state government commits to provide land free of cost and bear 50% of the project cost.

The Centre has also made substantial allocation for the project in last few years. While around Rs 700 crore was allocated in 2017-18, it got Rs 625 crore in 2018-19. It received Rs 350 crore in 2019-20 and Rs 520 crore in 2020-21.

Title: Thai princess visits IMA in Dehradun and ARIES in Nainital
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Thai princess

NAINITAL: Thai princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn, who is on a trip to India, visited the Indian Military Academy in Dehradun and Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observational Sciences (ARIES) in Nainital on Thursday.

The princess, who teaches history at Chulachomklao Royal Military Academy (CRMA), interacted with Commandant Lt Gen JS Negi and held a range of discussions on training and administration aspects. The 64-year-old princess visited the IMA with a 20-member delegation of Thai diplomats.

"The visiting dignitary and the delegation were briefed on the training imparted at the IMA to Indian and Foreign Gentlemen Cadets. This was followed by a windshield tour of training facilities. The tour was also joined by the ambassador of Thailand to India," read a press statement issued by the IMA. Later in the day, the princess flew to Pantnagar airport and then visited the Circuit House in Nainital's Kathgodam. "The picture of Chipko Andolan caught her special attention and she asked about it. We explained her how women hugged trees to protect them from being cut down," said city magistrate Pratyush Singh.

After the Circuit House, she went to Devasthal Observatory to see the optical telescope set up by Aryabhatta Institute of Observational Sciences (ARIES) in Nainital. "The princess saw Asia’s largest telescope and asked several questions related to astronomy. She was accompanied by a group of scientists as well and she said that she wants to strengthen the bilateral relationship between Thailand and India in the field of Astronomy," said Sashi Bhushan Pandey, scientist at ARIES, who was accompanying the delegation.

The princess left ARIES late in the evening.

Title: Gay Dating App: 50 executives trapped on gay dating app, robbed by gang
Content:
Representative image

GURUGRAM: A gang that honeytrapped people after luring them on an online dating app for gay , bisexual and transgenders is believed to have targeted at least 50 senior officials employed with multinational and homegrown companies in the city.Inspector Mukesh, the SHO of Badshapur police station whose team arrested five members of the gang, said they had targeted scores of affluent people over the past few months but most had refrained from approaching police for fear of social stigma. That the victims held senior posts in their offices made the job easier for the gang, which worked on the assumption that the targets would not share their ordeal with others.The SHO said the gang’s kingpin, who is from Bhondsi, had told interrogators they got the idea of honeytrapping senior officials from a friend who had targeted gullible people with the same modus operandi. The gang would first trap officials on a dating app for gay and bisexual people, and then one of their members would fix up a meeting. He would then ask the victim to drive him to a secluded place on the highway, where other members of the gang would attack him. The victims, who included even CEOs of private companies, would not only be robbed of valuables but also blackmailed with objectionable pictures. “The kingpin told us he had got the idea from a friend and then formed a gang to execute it. We are sure more people have been targeted by the gang in a similar manner. So far, only one person has forward to lodge a complaint,” said Mukesh.The lone complaint lodged against the gang states, “I got a request on the site and they called me to Southern Peripheral Road. Then, they made me sit in the front seat next to a man who identified himself as Prince. Three men seated themselves in the rear seat and moments later, they snatched my wallet and bag and withdrew money from my bank account.” On the basis of the complaint, an FIR has been registered against the gang under sections 379 A and 34 of the IPC, accounting for theft and acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention.Sources said though the gang members were not very educated, they hired engineers with good command over English so that they can cast an impression on their targets over time. Though profiles of members are not mentioned in detail on the app, the gang went for relatively affluent people so that they can exact a good amount.In Video: Gurugram: 50 executives trapped on gay dating app, robbed by gang

Title: IMC launches inquiry into fake letter seeking e-nagar palika id
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Indore: Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) on Thursday launched an inquiry to identify employees involved in sending a letter with fake signature of an additional commissioner to obtain login id and password of e-nagar palika system.

Sources claimed involvement of four to five employees, but corporation officials said that those involved in the act are yet to be identified.

IMC commissioner Asheesh Singh launched an inquiry into the matter stating that employees found involved in the forgery won’t be spared.

“The matter has come to my knowledge. Thankfully, the matter has come to light before any misconduct or fraud could be committed. An additional commissioner level inquiry has been launched into the matter. Those found involved would not only face departmental inquiry, but police complaint would also be filed against them,” said the commissioner.

Corporation officials said that unidentified employees were found to have used digital image of signature of IMC additional commissioner SK Chaitanya to raise a request for obtaining login id and password of e-NagarPalika.

“The accused sent a letter to e-NagarPalika cell of state urban administration department on February 10 for issuance of fresh login id and password in name of a senior clerk level employee,” they said.

The matter came to light after officials in Bhopal suspected the language in which the letter was written and raised a query with the additional commissioner if he had sent a letter.

The additional commissioner SK Chaitanya said that the matter came to his knowledge when a query was raised by e-palika cell. “I was in Bhopal on the day when this letter was sent to e-nagar palika cell. We found that the letter was not sent from IMC’s revenue department. We are looking into the matter,” Chaitanya told TOI.

“If needed, we would also seek assistance from cyber cell to nab those involved in this act of forgery,” he added. TNN

Title: Namrata Damor case: CBI files closure report before spl court
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Indore: Central Bureau of Investigation ( CBI ) on Thursday filed closure report before a special court in case of MBBS student Namrata Damor ’s death, whose body was found in Ujjain near railway tracks in 2012.

Her name had surfaced in Vyapam scam. CBI filed the closure report before a special court concluding that Damor had committed suicide, official sources said.

A similar report was filed by CBI in 2017, but it was rejected by court last year after finding several loopholes. CBI officials claimed that they have recorded fresh statements of witnesses and doctors, who conducted autopsy. Some witnesses featuring in the old report were also re-examined. The suspicion over nature of death grew, when two panels of doctors gave conflicting reports – one suggested it was a murder by smothering while other concluded that it was a suicide by jumping in front of a train. Damor’s case came to limelight following exposure of Vyapam scam in 2013 involving illegal admissions in professional courses. A student of MBBS course in MGM Medical College, Damor was suspected of securing admission through Vyapam racketeers.

Deaths of people known to be associated with the scam raised eyebrows from different quarters. The mysterious death of a TV journalist in Jhabua brought the focus back on to the death. TNN

Title: Nurses allege rape attempt, doctor flees from police custody
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

Title: High court issues notices to CBSE, Nainital education officer
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Uttarakhand high court

NAINITAL: The Uttarakhand high court (HC) on Thursday issued notices to the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) as well as the chief education officer of the Nainital district after a letter written to the HC alleged that schools are forcing parents to buy books, uniforms and other school items from a designated shop.

Speaking to TOI, chief standing counsel for the state government Paresh Tripathi said that HC has made CBSE and chief education officer, Nainital, a party to the case. “The court has taken suo motu cognizance of the allegations and has asked CBSE and the education department to file their responses within two weeks,” Tripathi said.

Parents have also alleged that schools are charging arbitrary fees and that several schools in the district have been forcing parents and students to buy all the school accessories and even help books from shops within schools or designated contractors outside the campus. “These shops sell books as well as uniforms at prices much higher than the market rates and therefore are harassing us. If students choose to buy the items from the market, the schools even harass them,” the parents alleged.

Title: Raid at quack’s clinic, docus & allopathic medicines seized
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Indore: A joint team of health department, district administration and police raided dispensary of a quack in Banganga on Thursday evening.

The team comprising in charge of PC Sethi Hospital Dr Madhav Hasani and district health officer (second) Dr Praveen Sisodia seized allopathic medicine, syringe and other items.

Hasani said that they had seized allopathic drugs, syringe and injections from shop of one quack with degree of Bachelor of Electro-Homeopathy Medicine and Surgery (BEMS) but prescribing allopathic medicine to patients. “We will issue notice to him as per rules,” said Hasani.

According to a source in health department, there are over 5000 quacks operating in the city. Chief medical and health officer Dr Praveen Jadia said that they had received complaint against one Heeralal Jhade operating allopathic clinic in Kushwaha Nagar without relevant degree.

When a team raided his clinic, they found many allopathic drugs, injection, nebulizer and other things required in allopathic treatment. “We have also seized his document,” said Jadia.

Dr Sanjay Lodhe, vice-president of MP state chapter of IMA said, “There are over 6,000 quacks in district. We have been fighting this for last one decade. The health department has taken a good initiative and this should continue.”

“The problem is that there is no prescribed law under which quacks can be booked. The norms prescribed by MCI only bars ill practice but there are no law to book them neither in IPC nor in health,” added Lodhe.

Title: Lesbian couple to lead V-Day celebration on Kerala varsity campus
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Breaking away from the clichéd love letter writing competition, the students of Kerala University ’s Kariavattom Campus have arranged a special Valentine’s Day celebration on Friday.

The institute has invited lesbian couple Ashitha and Sulfath to the campus to interact with the students. They will be interacting with the students on the topic ‘Love and Boundaries’. The event is organized by departments, students’ union and researchers union at aquatic biology hall at 11am.

Ashitha Dhavanya, is a final year student at School of Drama, Thrissur, while Sulfath A, is a third-year graduation student of Chemistry at Sanatana Dharma College, Alappuzha.

“Every year we organize some activity to mark the Valentine’s Day. While planning the event this year, we thought of making it a platform for people from LGBTIQ community to communicate with the students,” said Ramshad Khan, chairman of departments students’ union.

“When the government supporting them (LGBTIQ) and adopting policy, we as students have some responsibility towards society and those who are part of the society. We believe that love does not have any boundaries. Being a special day, we decided to invite a couple. We reached out to Ashitha and Sulfath through our network of friends,” added Ramshad.

The couple will share their story with the students, which will be followed by the interactive session.

“We (Ashitha and Sulfath) met during queer pride events and later fell in love. Her family was supportive when she came out, but I did not get the same support. Now, I am working with government agencies to meet the expenses of my education. It is our first Valentine’s Day and we are glad to be invited to the University of Kerala campus in our own identity. The campus is always associated with liberals and we are glad to be part of the V-Day event. We both are busy with our studies and research and will be meeting each other after a long time at the programme,” said Sulfath.

Title: Pleasant weekend ahead as weather turns cooler today in Pune
Content:
According to IMD officials night temperatures in Pune may fall by 3-4 degrees celsius till February 17.

PUNE: The last chance to enjoy the mild winter this year will come up between Friday and Monday when the city will experience a night temperature drop.This weekend could be cooler than the last one.
