Title: Irrigation scam: HC ‘no’ to add CBI, ED, SFIO as respondents
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: In a setback to the petitioner, the Nagpur bench of Bombay High Court on Thursday rejected his prayer to add Central Bureau of Investigation ( CBI ), Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) as respondents in the alleged multi-crore irrigation scam PILs.

While clarifying that the court would appoint these agencies when deemed fit, a division bench comprising justices RV Ghuge and Shreeram Modak adjourned the final hearing till March 13. The bench further directed petitioners and respondents to submit their contentions before February 29.

The court was hearing five PILs, first by NGO Janmanch (PIL No. 12/2016) through counsel Firdos Mirza and four others by social worker Atul Jagtap (PIL Nos 141, 142, 172 & 173/2016) through lawyer Shreedhar Purohit.

In his application, Jagtap stressed adding Union home ministry, principal income tax commissioner besides CBI, ED and SFIO as respondents for investigating the scam stating that he didn’t trust the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) which is conducting open probe into the case.

Defending his prayer, Jagtap said that after change of guard in the state, Ajit Pawar, who was named as a respondent in the PIL, assumed important charge of deputy chief minister in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government led by CM Uddhav Thackeray, and, therefore, “the ACB is directly working under him”.

Quoting ACB’s former director general (DG) Sanjay Barve, the petitioner stated that he had elaborated on the role played by Pawar and other accused officers in illegally granting mobilization advance to the contractors for projects.

While endorsing petitioner’s contentions, the then DG had held that various irregularities were committed in majority of tenders with uncanny similarity. Terming the entire conspiracy as an attempt to “defraud the government”, he claimed that contractors obtained tenders on the basis of forged documents.

The petitioner claimed that Pawar’s personal secretary had written to then water resources department (WRD) directing it that “circulars of not granting mobilization advance should be cancelled”.

“The former WRD minister had directed that all the disputed files should be directly sent to him without following due procedure as per Rules 10 and 14 of Rules of Business,” the petitioner said.

Jagtap pointed out that “after change in the government, ACB also changed its stance and granted a clean chit to Pawar through three affidavits, two of which were filed by incumbent DG Parambir Singh”.

“In view of changing political equations and roles played by NCP to which Pawar belongs, I don’t have faith in ACB as it’s directly controlled by the government. For neutral and impartial investigations, it’s necessary to add CBI, ED, SFIO and others to take over the investigations,” Jagtap said.

Title: Blaze in MIDC building, local fire dept ill-equipped to fight it
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

MUMBAI: A major tragedy was averted after a massive blaze broke out inside a ground-plus-four-storey commercial structure in the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation ( MIDC ) area at Andheri (East) on Thursday. Eyewitnesses said all offices in the building are empty, except for a bank on the ground floor.

While no one sustained injuries in the incident at the Rolta Technology Park structure, a woman who resides in a building across the road complained of suffocation after inhaling the thick smoke and had to be rushed to a hospital .

The fire , which started in a server room on the second floor, damaged the wiring, furniture, office records, computers, ACs, aluminium plates and other material stored in passages.

Mumbai fire department declared it a Level 4 blaze and deployed 13 fire engines and 100 personnel. Firemen evacuated all buildings in the complex as well as those in the neighbourhood as smoke began to spread in the area.

The MIDC is the planning authority for the area and has its own system to fight minor blazes as it has merely two fire engines. It had not conducted any fire audit of commercial structures in its jurisdiction for four years. “We conduct fire audits only while giving occupation permission to buildings. Thereafter, we do not conduct routine fire audits. Since 2016, we have not checked any of the occupied buildings for fire compliance,” said Santosh Warick, deputy chief fire officer, MIDC.

Mumbai fire department officials said they found several violations. The building’s firefighting system was not operational too.

Mumbai fire department said it will launch a probe into the blaze and has suggested the building’s water and power supply be disconnected.

Mumbai fire department officials were upset as their chief fire officer, P S Rahangdale, led the firefighting operation but MIDC’s senior-most fire officer, who has an office in the vicinity, did not visit the site. Rahangdale said, “We noticed several violations in the building. For instance, a covered roof, encroachment in passages and lack of ventilation. This created hurdles in firefighting. We will ask MIDC to submit the building plan documents and examine the violations.”

Local activist Umashankar Gautam said, “Several companies in MIDC area have shut shop. But fires keep recurring in one building or the other every year. The reason must be investigated. Someone should be made accountable for the fire incidents.”

Title: For Wendell Rodricks, Colvale comes alive to bid a final goodbye
Content:
Wendell Rodricks celebrated life and gave back to society what he earned

Wendell Rodricks celebrated life and gave back to society what he earned

PANAJI: Noted fashion designer Wendell Rodricks ’ love for environment and recent protest against the felling of trees at Colvale resonated at his funeral service attended by hundreds on Thursday.“We are not here to sell but to protect land. We go against the creator when we cut trees,” Fr Freddy Lobo, during his homily at St Francis of Assisi Church, said.Drawing parallels with Rodricks’ linen whites — that earned him the tag of ‘guru of minimalism’ — and angels, he said Rodricks gave people a “foretaste of heaven where angels are dressed in white”.“Let’s go with this message that each one of us is called to protect the environment,” Lobo said.He also advised people to learn from the Padma Shri awardee’s humility and philanthropy.Among the earliest and most prominent public figures to come out about his sexual orientation, Rodricks left behind his partner Jerome, who along with family bid him a tearful farewell.A regular churchgoer, Rodricks’ funeral mass was concelebrated by five priests, including the secretary to the archbishop, Fr Joaquim Loiola Pereira, director of Caritas, Fr Maverick Fernandes and parish priest as well as former parish priests of Colvale.The church couldn’t contain the outpouring of love for the designer, teacher, writer, LGBTQIA activist and environmentalist as big names from the fashion industry in the state and beyond, models, politicians, students and teachers of the Government Polytechnic, Altinho and friends and family spilled into the church hall and the courtyard in front.Towards the end of the Eucharistic celebration, Rodricks’ youngest brother Joel, based in Dubai thanked him for bringing music into their lives after their mother sent him as a youth for guitar classes at a time when the instrument was larger in size than him.Talking about Rodricks’ sudden demise — three months before he would turn 60 — which shocked even their own family, Joel said it was not the years of life but the “life in his years” that mattered.‘Somewhere over the rainbow’ played in the background as Rodricks was laid to rest in the church cemetery. Fadista Sonia Shirsat sang the soulful ‘Ave Maria’, while friends and family shed tears.

Title: Nashik: Asaram’s ‘followers’ give lecture in civic school
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Asaram’s ‘followers’ give lecture in civic school in Satpur


NASHIK: The principal and two teachers of a civic school in Satpur have been slapped with a show-cause notice for allowing a group of people claiming to be followers of self-styled godman Asaram to deliver a lecture to students on the school premises on Wednesday. The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) also directed the principal to lodge a police complaint against the people. Asaram is serving a life sentence for a minor’s rape. “We have taken serious cognizance of this as permission of the education department is mandatory for organising programmes in civic schools. I myself visited the school in this connection on Thursday morning,” said Devidas Mahajan, education officer of NMC on Thursday. “A directive has been issued to the principal to lodge FIR against those who addressed the students on the thoughts of the self-styled godman in the school,” he said. “Moreover, action will also to be taken against the principal for allowing them to address students.” According to sources in the NMC, the followers of Asaram went to the said school on Wednesday afternoon and delivered a lecture to students on his thoughts. They also told the students not to celebrate Valentine’s Day, and instead celebrate the day as “Parents’ day” and worship them. The followers also distributed pamphlets about Asaram’s thoughts among students while also putting up a banner displaying a photograph of the disgraced and jailed ‘guru’. Soon after learning about the incident, a number of corporators complained to the civic administration and demanded action against the school principal as well as the visitors. The NMC has 90 schools with over 30,000 students across all its six divisions —Panchavati, Nashik Road, Satpur, Nashik East, Nashik West and Cidco.

Title: Secunderabad: Stagnant drain turns health hazard for Uppal residents
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Nala in Uppal that has turned into a garbage dumping site

SECUNDERABAD: The 1.5 kilometre-long water channel near National Geophysical Research Institute (NGRI) on Uppal road in Habsiguda that was built to drain out rainwater into Musi has turned into a major water stagnation point.

Over 600 households living in 15 residential colonies located around the drain have raised alarm over the increasing mosquito menace in the area on account of stagnation of the drain water. Residents have urged authorities to desilt and clean the drain before the unhealthy situation leads to an outbreak of diseases in the area.

“The water channel has turned into a breeding ground for mosquitoes. We fear the outbreak of vector borne diseases. I request GHMC to desilt the drain at the earliest,” said Suman Sharma, resident of Kalyanpur colony.

According to GHMC officials, the civic body is taking up special programs to control the mosquito population. As part of the program, anti-larval operations will be carried out in the locality, every eight days, officials said.

“We are taking up a localised, pointed program near the water channel and in other parts of the city. Bio-remediation and anti-larval operations with drones are also being taken up in the city,” said GHMC commissioner DS Lokesh Kumar.

Adding to the health hazard problem, is the unbearable stench emanating from the garbage being dumped in the drain, rue residents. Locals say that some parties are also discharging sewage into the water channel, further polluting it. “The practise of dumping garbage in the nala has been occurring for many years now. The rancid smell emanating from the drain is unbearable,” said R Pratap, a resident of Raghavendra Nagar Colony.

Some residents took matter into their own hands and laid slabs on the drain to curb the stench and control the mosquito menace. GHMC said that this has placed a roadblock on their desilting efforts. “To desilt the nala, these slabs have to be demolished. As of today, we are unable to press the desilting machines into service due to the slabs,” said a GHMC official.

The water channel is located near the NGRI compound and runs along Seetarama Colony, Teachers Colony, Raghavendra Nagar Colony, Laxmi Narayana Colony in addition to ten other colonies. The drain was built to ensure that water inside NGRI drains out in a properly.

Title: ‘In-charge’ officers manage statutory posts in many state-run universities
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Trichy: The situation is no different in many of the state-run universities where posts of registrars and other statutory posts are being managed by officer in-charges for months together.

Higher education secretary Sunil Paliwal, in a review meeting in 2018, insisted universities to appoint full-time officers to statutory posts. He had highlighted the need for filling up these posts to ensure effective governance.

However, not many universities have taken note of it and most of the vital posts remain vacant.

A random check has revealed that the controller of examination (CoE) in Bharathiar, Alagappa, Periyar and Thiruvalluvar universities are ‘in-charge’ officers. Further, there is no full-time registrar expect for Alagappa among these universities.

Manonmaniam Sundaranar and Alagappa universities have the statutory post of distance education director managed by ‘in-charge’ officers.

Speaking on the merits of filling these statutory posts, a senior staff from BDU said, “A regular officer is appointed for a period of three years. The confidence of holding the post for a long time will give enough strength to the officer to take decisions on any matter unlike an ‘in-charge’ staff who would only think of safeguarding his temporary post. This would prevent him from taking important decisions.”

Title: HC grants stay on conduct of cultural event at resort in Kodai
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Madurai: The Madras high court has granted interim stay on an order permitting a cultural event at a private resort situated in Poombarai in Kodaikanal from February 13 to 16 after the state government filed an appeal apprehending that narcotic substances might be used in the event.

Bodhee Satvikanath Raju, director of Club India Resorts and Metro Hotels Private Limited, had moved the high court Madurai bench seeking to quash the rejection order passed by the inspector of Kodaikanal police station. Based on the undertakings given by the petitioner, a single judge in an order dated February 11, directed the officials to permit the petitioner to conduct the cultural programme by imposing several conditions including that he shall ensure that no liquor, narcotic substance, psychotropic drugs and banned substances be used.

The Dindigul superintendent of police, Kodaikanal DSP and inspector of police of Kodaikanal police station appealed against the order, saying the event expecting 1,000 participants, during the night hours, could also disturb wildlife as Poombarai is in the Anamalai Tiger Reserve.TNN

Title: Chennai: One problem, many proposals and no result
Content:
Traffic at the Koyambedu junction, where a flyover is being built, proceeds at a snail’s pace throughout the d... Read More

CHENNAI: When the Chennai Metropolitan Development Authority ( CMDA ) handed over plans for the Chennai Bypass Road , the state highways invested several crores in it, hoping that the stretch would act as the primary truck route between southern districts and Chennai Port.Today, less than a decade later, the road has been reduced to an expensive urban road. Truckers now prefer the newly constructed Outer Ring Road built by another government agency, Tamil Nadu Road Development Company . The old 32km access controlled expressway that interconnects four radial national highways around Chennai from Perungalathur to Madhavaram no longer serves its purpose. “People pay tolls because government has to take back the money it had invested on these roads,” said a senior official. The bypass is one of the many examples of how a slew of projects lined up by the government to decongest traffic continue to leave Chennai roads in a chaos.City planners and activists pinned their hopes on the comprehensive mobility plan (CMP) to setting things right. “But the plan hasn’t had a great start either,” said a senior official from CMDA. “The recent plan is largely a repeat of the Chennai Comprehensive Transportation Study released in 2010. Instead of looking at the effectiveness of projects taken up based on CTTS 2010suggestions, the new team is repeating the same set of suggestions,” he said.The CMP doesn’t discuss whether spending so much on the Chennai Bypass and surrounding areas had paid dividends. Instead, it is looking to connect missing links, which experts fear will cause more traffic snarls. “The same applies to footpaths, grade separators, junction improvements and traffic signals. There has been no coordinated effort,” said a senior transport department official.The Chennai Unified Metropolitan Transport Authority (CUMTA), to coordinate all transport and traffic related departments, is a distant dream even after 10 years of formal announcement. “The problem right now is that each department wants to solve the problems it faces with the easiest possible solution,” the official said. The dedicated two-wheeler lane introduced by traffic police, for instance, was rolled back months after launch. The dedicated cycle tracks built by corporation near school zones with wide footpaths are now parking lots for residents and commercial establishments.M Radhakrishnan of Thozhan, an NGO that works on road safety, said the best way to reduce traffic and accidents on roads is by to promote public transportation. “For this, all proposed infrastructure projects must be completed without delays. We should encourage people to use buses, suburban trains and metro. The connectivity among these modes of transport should be appealing and people friendly,” he said. But many infrastructure projects, even those announced as early as 2011-12, are still pending in Chennai. While some are under construction for years, others including the Bus Rapid Transit System and Tambaram elevated corridor are still on paper.

Title: Tamil Nadu: 620kg ganja seized, 5 smugglers held
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Narcotic Control Bureau seized 620 kg of ganja in Nagapattinam

NAGAPATTINAM: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted a drug smuggling bid near Kodiyakkadu in Nagapattinam district and seized 620kg of ganja worth several lakh rupees on Wednesday night. Police said the drugs were to be smuggled to Sri Lanka.

S Iyappan, 35, of Kodiyakadu, M Selvaraj, 54, of Vedaranyam, R Paramanantham, 35, from Kodiyakarai, S Ramanan, 40, and G Thavamani, 37, of Thiruvottiyur in Chennai, were arrested in connection and a container and two cars were recovered.

Based on a tip, NCB sleuths from Madurai followed the container vehicle heading towards Nagapattinam via Madurai. While one of the accused drove the vehicle, the other four followed in two cars. The NCB team intercepted when the accused halted their vehicles in Kodiyakkadu. Further investigations are on.

Title: Delhi: Wazirabad-Burari stretch gets underpasses, subway
Content:
Construction has started for the subway at Jagatpur

NEW DELHI: Two underpasses for U-turns and a subway will be constructed on Outer Ring Road between Wazirabad and Burari by Delhi government’s PWD to cut down on travel time, decongest the stretch and make it safe for users. Commuters going from northeast Delhi’s Gopalpur side towards Majnu ka Tila and ITO are now forced to travel in the opposite direction for almost 8km and take a U-turn at the Burari roundabout to get to the other side. Once this project is completed, they will be using the underpasses for either way, reducing travel time and also decongesting the roundabout. (See map)In order to ensure that the traffic on this busy 12-lane stretch — six lanes on either side — is not disrupted, segments of these structures will be pre-cast at an open area and installed later. This method has multiple advantages. The first is that there won’t be any traffic disruption as the road will be dug up in three phases — the right side, median and then the left side, in that order. The second advantage is that this method is cheaper and will cost the agency almost half the amount it would have otherwise spent. And the third advantage is that it will save time.A senior government official said this project would have taken over a year to complete had they adopted the conventional method. It will now take less than two months! This is the first PWD project in Delhi where this technique is being used. It it’s successfully implemented, it will be adopted for other projects as well.These underpasses are being called ‘half underpasses’ because the stretch for entry and exit on either side will be at least three metres above the level of a drain that is running alongside the road. This is to prevent any flooding.During peak hours, according to officials, the Burari roundabout gets clogged as hundreds of vehicles line up to take the U turn. That will no longer happen once the project is completed.“Constructing an FOB costs at least Rs 2 crore and an underpass about Rs 20 crore. But unlike the expenditure on the other underpasses that we have constructed in the past, these two and the subway will be constructed at a total cost of Rs 35 crore,” said the official. “We will construct the subway at Jagatpur first, as that is required the most.”The subway is being constructed at Jagatpur because several accidents have been reported from this area where people from both sides of the road cross abruptly. “Since both carriageways of the road are very wide, people are unable to safely cross the road. There are foot overbridges on this stretch too but people barely use them because they are at a distance,” said the official.The road is almost 10 metres above the level of the service lane. Students attending coaching classes at Mukherjee Nagar have to cross over to the other side where many of them stay on rent. Hence, the agency has prioritised this part of the project. Construction of the segments for the underpass and their placement will be completed by March-end. The pre-cast sections for the underpasses are also being made and the work on all these structures will be over by the end of June, said the officials.

Title: NMC properties leased without any agreement to be sealed immediately
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Nashik Municipal Corporation standing commitee

NASHIK: All Nashik Municipal Corporation ( NMC ) properties, which had either been leased out without any agreement or which the lessees are using despite the expiry of the agreement period, will soon be sealed.

On Thursday, the NMC standing committee directed the civic administration to take immediate action.

TOI had recently reported on the findings of an internal audit of the civic body. The audit had found out that many of the municipal corporation’s properties were leased without agreements and the NMC had not been receiving any rent from about 400 of its 900 properties.

Uddhav Nimse, the chairperson of the standing committee, directed the civic administration to seal such properties. The directive came after the panel members complained that some of the NMC properties are being used by parties without agreement and also few years after the end of the agreement.

Standing panel member Swati Bhamre said that in her ward, the NMC had leased one of its properties to a particular party for 30 years. The lease period ended two years ago, but the party is still using the property.

Kalpana Pande, another panel member, complained about a party that used an NMC property for 10 years free of charge. Pande said the party recently signed an agreement and paid a lease amount for the next four months. “But what about the payment for the past 10 years?” she asked.

Pande asked standing committee chairman to recover all the rent from the party concerned.

Nimse pulled up the civic officials and directed them to look into the issue.

Civic officials said the municipal commissioner has directed all the six divisional officers to recover the rent pending for years.

Title: One year on, no headway in pawn shop burglary case
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The city police are yet to solve a sensational burglary incident which took place a year ago at a pawn shop run in a house at a thickly populated residential area in Narimedu.

Unidentified people broke into the pawnshop in the wee hours of February 19, 2019, and escaped with gold jewellery weighing around 11.93 kgs. The incident created ripples in the locality as a large number of people had pledged their gold jewellery.

Madurai city police commissioner S Davidson Devasirvatham said that the city police have been working on the case incessantly. A special team is working on the case every day covering various angles. A few times, it seemed that they almost solved the case, but it did not lead to a conclusion, he said.

He added that they have done all sorts of inquiries including checking various CCTV footage, call data records, analyzed tower dump etc.

Police officials said that there is a strong suspicion on the owners as well since there was no security measure in place. There was no security person, CCTV camera or burglary alarm despite a large quantity of gold jewellery in the shop.

Title: Nagpur: Six held in separate road rage cases
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Four persons, of whom one was stabbed and another hit by brick on head, were injured in two different cases of road rage in the city within 24 hours.

Police have so far arrested six persons, including four having serious criminal records, for their alleged role in the crime.

In the first incident shortly before Tuesday midnight, two painters were allegedly attacked by goons at Ambedkar Chowk. It’s learnt that Ramavtar Rajput and Nilesh Ganvir were heading to their residence at Kushi Nagar after work.

On the way, Singh and Ganvir raised objection after a group of around six people on two bikes grazed past them. The group returned to confront Singh and Ganvir. One of them pulled out a knife and started stabbing Ganvir.

The others thrashed Singh who later approached Jaripatka police to lodge a complaint. The Jaripatka police team led by senior PI Khusal Tijare and comprising head constable Roshan Tiwari and others rounded up Goldie Shambarkar, Akash Katare and two others.

In the other incident, Rahul Ghadge and his friend Swapnil Thakre were attacked by two goons, including a minor, over a quarrel. It’s learnt that Thakre and Ghadge, heading towards Shatabdi Chowk, were overtaken by Ankur Dhakate and a minor on the bike.

Ghadge and Thakre objected to Dhakate and his aides driving rashly. Dhakate and the minor, both having several offences against them, returned to the spot and picked up a fight with Ghadge and Thakre.

The minor then picked up a brick and hit Thakre on his head while Dhakate and Ghadge were scuffling. The onlookers raised an alarm and alerted police control room. The cops from Beltarodi police station reached the spot and nabbed Dhakate and Thakre.

Title: NCP women wing protest against LPG price rise in Aurangabad
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: The members of Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Thursday staged a demonstration at Kranti Chowk against the rise in LPG cylinder prices.

As part of the protest, the women cooked food at the site.

The central government on Wednesday hiked the price of non-subsidised LPG cylinder weighing 14.2 kg by Rs 144.50 to Rs 149. The price hike is the steepest since January 2014. The government also announced that the subsidy for domestic users will be doubled.

Soon after the announcement, opposition parties launched a scathing attack on the government demanding a rollback on the price. Women wing of Congress and NCP held rallies and demonstrations across the country to protest the hike.

In Aurangabad , district NCP women wing led by president Chhaya Jangle Patil held a demonstration at Kranti Chowk. The activists held placards and raised slogans condemning the hike. The protestors said that people, especially homemakers, are dejected with the rising inflation. Jangle Patil said that the protest against the price rise was held simultaneously by NCP women wings in all districts of the state on the directives of state chief Rupali Chakankar.

As part of the protest, the women also cooked food in an earthen stove at the protest site. The activists said that in wake of rise of cooking gas price, poor people are left with no alternative but to switch to earthen stove.

Congress spokesperson Pawan Dongre termed the government’s move as ‘bluff.’

“The government had made an emotional appeal to people to give up their subsidy so that poor people can cook on gas stove. However, the government failed in ensuring that poor people can afford the gas on a regular basis which is why many people in Aurangabad have now switched alternative ways of cooking,” he said.

Title: Rs 10,000 cost on litigant for wasting high court’s time
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Madras high court

MADURAI: Taking a serious view for wasting the court’s time, the Madras high court has imposed a cost of Rs 10,000 on a public interest litigation (PIL) which sought to release the names of corporate companies who have not repaid bank loans and to waive Rs 55,000 crores of educational loans across the country.

In his petition, A M Sundaravel, a resident of Tirunelveli district , moved the high court Madurai bench seeking for a direction to publish the name list of multinational corporate and private companies who have not repaid bank loans in all the media, newspapers and websites for public view. When the petition was taken up for hearing on Thursday, a division bench of justice M Duraiswamy and justice T Ravindran took a serious view for wasting the court’s time and dismissed the petition.

Title: South Central Railway gets 13 energy neutral railway stations
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

SECUNDERABAD: South Central Railway ( SCR ) has converted 13 railway stations into energy neutral railway stations . These stations will meet its electricity requirements through solar energy .

“These stations are capable of meeting 100% energy requirements by tapping natural solar power through Solar Photo Voltaic (SPV) Panels commissioned on the station buildings,” read an official statement issued by SCR.

With anticipated energy generation from these stations to be around 1.3 lakh units annually, it is expected that the usage of solar power will lead to savings of Rs 13 lakh each year for SCR.

“The generation of clean solar energy enables reducing carbon foot prints to the tune of 1,170 tons per annum,” read a statement by SCR. Lights, fans,pumps and other electrical appliances will be powered by the solar energy generated, thereby bringing down the net traditional energy consumption.

Ghatkesar, Dharur, Raghunathpalli, Mellacheruvu, Ontimitta, Kadiyam and Dwarapudi are among 13 stations that will now use solar power.

Title: Chennai: Hit by speeding car, milk vendor out of business for a year
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Seethapathy had never imagined accidents could happen when roads were empty. But last November, a car knocked him down around 6am on the Pondy Bazaar pavement where he was selling milk.

That fateful morning, almost overcome by sleep, he was walking towards his tricycle to wash his face when a speeding car hit him. The vehicle ran over his thigh and Seethapathy lost

consciousness at the sight of blood. He woke up, hours later, at a hospital.

Police told Seethapathy that the car’s driver, an elderly man, had pressed the accelerator instead of applying the brakes. But Seethapathy did not pursue the case as the driver assured him that he would pay the hospital bills and take care of his children’s education. Three months on, Seethapathy is still bedridden. Post the operation, the doctor has advised him a year’s rest.

From Vandavasi, Seethapathy sold milk in the city to support his family back home. He put his sons, aged 10 and seven, in a private school hoping that they would not become milk vendors like him.

Seethapathy told TOI that he believes that his children will have a bright future as only a few people from his village study at a private school in Vandavasi. But with the family’s sole breadwinner confined to bed, the times ahead are bleak. For his family, it’s a tight squeeze to make ends meet.

Title: In rural Nashik, 50 operators yet to register drones with DGCA
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: Nearly 50 drone operators in rural Nashik are yet to register their gadgets with Directorate General of Civil Aviation ( DGCA ).

“There are about 100 drone operators in rural Nashik. While 50 of them have already applied to the DGCA online, the remaining are yet to do so,” said Arti Singh, the Nashik rural superintendent of police. She has directed these operators to complete the online formalities as soon as possible.

According to Singh, many of these erring drone operators said they were unaware of the rules that the Center had announced about the mandatory one-time registration of drones . “But these are just excuses as the Union government had announced well in advance about the compulsory registration,” she said.

After scrutiny of the online applications, the DGCA would issue a unique identification number to each drone operator.

According to the police, the drone operators here mainly use the gadgets during events like weddings. “Some operators told us that the gadgets are bought either from Mumbai or Nashik,” added police officials.

Police sources said operating unregistered drones could lead to legal action against the operators under the Indian Penal Code. The civil aviation ministry has made it mandatory for all drone operators to register their gadgets as some drones and drone operators do not comply with Civil Aviation Requirement (CAR) standards. The Centre is keen on maintaining a database of drones as they could be used for subversive activities.

According to the Nashik rural police sources, although the deadline for online registration was January 31, there is a likelihood more time being given to the operators to register the gadgets. In the third week of January, even the state police headquarters had instructed police of all districts and commissionerates to ensure that the drone operators comply with the directives.

Title: Recreation spots around new and old Holkar bridges
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Pimpri Chinchwad: The Khadki Cantonment Board (KCB) plans to develop the areas around new and old Holkar bridges as recreation spots for residents.

Pramod Singh, chief executive officer, KCB, said, “We want to install six benches with sheds on an unused strip on the new bridge where people can sit and relax. We will develop two arches, one on each side of the bridge for people to access this strip. They can watch the river flowing below, the greenery around the adjacent Rajiv Gandhi garden.”

He said the garbage thrown on land near the approach road of old and new bridges would be cleared. The cantonment also proposes to light up the two bridges in the evening and at night. Boards would be put up displaying old photographs of old Holkar bridge as well as its 100-year-old history, Singh said.

Title: Disqualification plea: Ex-Cong MLAs get 4 weeks to file reply
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Panaji: Goa speaker Rajesh Patnekar on Thursday held the first hearing in the disqualification petition filed against the ten Congress MLAs who joined BJP in July 2019.

The speaker has given the respondents four weeks’ time to file their reply in the case, and also handed them a copy of the petition.

The speaker will hear the disqualification petition filed against tourism minister Manohar Ajgaonkar and PWD minister Deepak Pauskar by senior MGP leader Ramkrishna ‘Sudin’ Dhavalikar on Friday. Two hearings have already been held in Dhavalikar’s petition.

Counsel for petitioner Abhijit Gosavi informed the speaker that the Supreme Court, in a recent judgment, has laid down the law that disqualification petitions must be decided within three months of the date of filing, and requested the speaker to take into consideration this three-month deadline while granting the respondents time to file a reply.

Gosavi said that the entire matter should be decided within three months.

In May 2019, Dhavalikar filed a petition before the Goa legislative assembly speaker seeking disqualification of Ajgaonkar and Pauskar, who quit MGP to join BJP in March 2019.

The MGP challenged their claim that two-thirds of the MGP legislative party has merged with BJP. MGP had three MLAs in the 40-member House, and the number been reduced to one.

Dhavalikar had said that the 10th schedule of the Constitution does not postulate such a merger, by which the members of the legislative party would meet at midnight and claim that a merger has taken place.

In August 2019, Congress filed a disqualification petition against the 10 rebel MLAs who quit and joined BJP in July 2019. State Congress president Girish Chodankar, who has filed the petition before the speaker, had sought that the 10 MLAs be restrained from attending assembly proceedings and holding constitutional posts till the case is decided by the speaker.

On July 10, the rebel Congress MLAs led by deputy chief minister Chandrakant Kavalekar joined BJP claiming that the Congress Legislative Party had split. The remaining nine MLAs were Isidore Fernandes, Nilkanth Halarnkar, revenue minister Jennifer Monserrate, Antonio Fernandes, Francisco Silveira, Wilfred D’sa, Clafasio Dias, water resources minister Filipe Rodrigues and Atanasio Monserrate.

Congress wanted its 10 MLAs to be disqualified under Article 191 (2) para 2, and the tenth schedule of the Constitution.

“In the present case, there is no merger of the Indian National Congress. The party still exists and is duly recognised, and consequently, there cannot be a claim of a valid merger, as contemplated under tenth schedule,” Chodankar had said.

Title: Nirbhaya Case: Hanging of four Nirbhaya convicts gets entangled in procedural maze
Content:
The convicts in Nirbhaya gang rape and murder case

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

NEW DELHI: Nearly three years after the Supreme Court sent the Nirbhaya case convicts to the gallows, the noose seems to have got entangled in a procedural maze with lawyers filing petition after petition in various courts since a Delhi trial court fixed January 22 as the date for the convicts’ hanging .On Thursday, a bench of Justices R Banumathi, Ashok Bhushan and A S Bopanna found themselves dealing with two petitions related to the case. One was filed by the Union government seeking separate hanging of the four convicts — Mukesh Singh, Vinay Sharma, Pawan Gupta and Akshay Thakur — as and when their mercy petitions were dismissed by the President. The other was a petition by Sharma challenging the President’s rejection of his mercy plea.The SC reserved its verdict on Sharma’s petition and said it would pronounce judgment on Friday, when it will also hear the counsel for all four death-row convicts on the Centre’s plea for their hangings to be separated. So, no one knows when the death row convicts will be deemed to have exhausted their legal remedies and a finality reached about the date when they will be hanged.After the SC rejected review and curative petitions of the four convicts, Gupta had filed a plea in Delhi high court claiming to be a juvenile at the time of crime on December 16, 2012. The high court dismissed his plea. His appeal was rejected by Supreme Court as well. Mercy petitions of other three — Singh, Sharma and Thakur — who invoked the President’s mercy powers for commutation of death penalty to life imprisonment, have also been turned down.The Centre is challenging a Delhi HC order of February 5 declining the plea for the convicts to be hanged separately by de-linking those who have already exhausted all their remedies from those who have not. The HC had set a deadline of 7 days for the convicts to exhaust all options.The bench will hear this petition on Friday and appointed senior advocate Anjana Prakash Sharma as amicus for Gupta, who was unrepresented. “Otherwise, tomorrow, they will come and seek adjournment saying he is not represented. That appears to be the tactic,” the bench noted.The SC is aware of the delaying tactics, but can do little except hear the petitions filed through advocates A P Singh and Vrinda Grover as these were within the convicts’ rights. Once the seven-day period granted by the HC got over, Sharma filed a petition in the SC challenging rejection of his mercy plea by the President.Among many grounds, his counsel claimed the convict suffered from mental illness and was hence unfit for execution, he suffered constant physical torture in jail, there was complete lack of application of mind to various factors by the Union and Delhi governments in recommending to the President to reject his mercy plea and that the President adopted a pick and choose policy to reject his plea when many such pleas were pending with him.Sharma’s counsel kept repeating his arguments for two hours, leaving Justices Banumathi, Bhushan and Bopanna at the brink of exasperation. Solicitor general Tushar Mehta took just 15 minutes to show the files of the Union home ministry and the Delhi government to point out that each and every aspect and fact narrated in the mercy petition were carefully scrutinised and considered, including Sharma’s family background and economic condition.He said the Union home minister recommended rejection of the mercy petition saying the case fell in the rarest of the rare category and the crime was a “dastardly and unpardonable act” that shocked the conscience of the nation.

Title: Katti brothers return empty-handed from Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

A file picture of Umesh Katti and BS Yediyurappa

BENGALURU: Senior leader Umesh Katti , who had hoped to persuade the BJP’s central leadership to hand him a ministerial post, returned empty-handed from Delhi on Thursday after being denied an audience with Union home minister Amit Shah.

Katti and his brother Ramesh had camped in Delhi since Wednesday to lobby for a ministerial berth for himself and a Rajya Sabha nomination for Ramesh. He had met BJP national president JP Nadda on Wednesday and was scheduled to call on Shah on Thursday. Sources said Shah could not meet him owing to prior engagements.

Umesh served as minister in different governments for 13 years, but this is the first time he is not part of the cabinet. "This is the first time the Katti brothers are facing a political crisis. Chief minister BS Yediyurappa is keen to induct him into the cabinet , but the central leadership is not in favour," said a BJP functionary.

Katti’s name apparently figured in the list prepared by Yediyurappa when he expanded his cabinet for the first time in August last year. But, to everyone’s surprise, the central leadership replaced his name with that of Laxman Savadi.

Even before expanding his cabinet for a second time last week, Yediyurappa had categorically said Katti would be made minister. But that assurance fell flat. Yediyurappa has assured Katti a spot in his cabinet when it is expanded the next time.

Ramesh was reportedly assured of a Rajya Sabha ticket when he was denied a ticket to contest the Lok Sabha elections from Chikkodi last year. "Both Umesh and Ramesh had gone to Delhi to remind the party high command about their assurance," said a source close to the brothers. In the Lok Sabha elections, the party preferred Annasaheb Jolle over Ramesh. The brothers had made efforts till last minute to get ticket but in vain.

Title: Couple shows solidarity with anti-CAA protests on their wedding day
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Madurai: A silent protest against the citizenship amendment Act (CAA), national register of citizens (NRC) and national population register (NPR) was staged at a wedding held in Karaikudi on Wednesday.

The newly-married couple, Mohammed Ghani and bride Afrina, posed for photographs with their friends and relatives, who held placards against CAA, NRC and NPR. Protests are being staged throughout the country against these acts and this couple decided to do it at their wedding.

Guests and relatives were told to hold up the placards which said-- No CAA, No NRC and No NPR. Nobody was compelled to hold up their placards and the guests were told that they could pose with them if they wanted to express solidarity with the couple and many of the guests came forward to do so.

Many of the guests also expressed happiness over this move by the couple on one of the most important days of their life.

Title: Man stabs teenage daughter for talking with boys : Nagpur
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

father stabbed daughter after drinking

NAGPUR: A 17-year-old Std XII student sustained injuries in stomach after her father stabbed her under the influence of alcohol at their residence at Kuhadkarpeth on Wednesday. It is learnt the father, identified as Dinesh Burade, was angry with his daughter Nisha for talking with boys in her school.

The academically good teenager, who has her board examination starting from February 18, is recuperating at Mayo Hospital .

It’s learnt Nisha’s mother Varsha had consumed poison around a year ago after she couldn’t cope with her husband’s torture. The mother of two works as a governess at Jaripatka to supplement the family’s income.

Dinesh, now in custody of Pachpaoli police, is a carpenter. He is a habitual drinker and the addiction worsened in the last few years.

Nisha told TOI that her father, as usual, was behaving in uncouth manner and using filthy language to target her. “When I said that as a father he shouldn’t abuse his daughter, he suddenly got violent. He stabbed me even before I could apprehend it,” she said.

Nisha’s mother Varsha said that her husband objected to their daughter speaking to anyone, especially boys. “He would doubt her whenever she spoke to her classmates and school friends,” she said.

The woman said that they had not approached police earlier believing that they do not take domestic issues seriously. “This time though we told cops that we do not want my husband at home. He was in possession of the knife for quite some time. We had even questioned him over this in the past,” she said.

The Pachpaoli police have registered a case of serious assault against Dinesh.

Title: IIIT- Hyderabad model to automate lip sync, translation in videos
Content:
IIIT- Hyderabad

HYDERABAD: Watching a video originally conceived in an unfamiliar language to one that is known to you will soon be a reality as a team of researchers from the International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad ( IIIT-H ) has developed a machine learning (ML) model that can automatically translate a video of any person speaking in one language to another.Currently, translation systems for videos generate translated speech output or textual subtitles. An out-of-sync dubbed movie or other video content ruins the viewer experience. In order to automate videos translation, a team of researchers led by professor CV Jawahar, dean (research and development) at IIIT-H developed a ML model that can perform face-to-face translation.Using ML, the model can take a video of a person speaking in one language and deliver a video output of the same speaker in another language. For example, a video of a person speaking in Telugu can automatically be translated in any other desired language such as Marathi, Hindi, Bengali etc. such that the voice style and lip movements match the desired language.“Earlier when we spoke about automatic translation, it used to be text-to-text, then came speech-to-speech translation. They do not handle the visual component. As a result, when such translated speech is overlaid on the video, the lip movements are typically out of sync with the audio,” said Prajwal KR, a student who worked on the model.To obtain a fully translated video with accurate lip synchronization, the researchers introduced a visual module called LipGAN. The module can also correct lip movements in an original video to match the translated speech. For example, badly dubbed movies with out-of-sync lip movements can be corrected with LipGAN, that has been trained on large video datasets, making it possible to work for any voice, any language and any identity.The research paper titled ‘Towards Automatic Face-to-Face Translation’ was presented at ACM International Conference on Multimedia at Nice, France in October 2019. A comparative analysis of their tool vis-a-vis Google Translate found the in-house tool to be more accurate.

Title: In-charge appointments on rise in BDU as nepotism takes over merit
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Bharathidasan University started a separate directorate of research in 2018

TRICHY: To speed up the evaluation of PhD thesis and award degrees without delay, Bharathidasan University started a separate directorate of research in 2018. A director in-charge was appointed after separating research section from the controller of examination.

Head of chemistry department S Muthusamy was appointed as director in-charge, but the move didn’t seem to have served the purpose, said members of the Tamil Nadu Government College Teachers Association (TNGCTA) who have threatened to go on an indefinite protest seeking appointment of a full-time director for research section a few days ago. Delay has indeed become the order of the day, they said in the absence of a full-time director.

This is one example of how the ‘in-charge syndrome’ has gripped Bharathidasan University as 12 of the statutory and non-statutory posts including that of the controller or examination and director of distance education have been filled with in-charge officers.

What’s worse, such posts are being rewarded to those who do not have the required qualification, which is against the BDU Act. For instance, when controller of examination (CoE) K Duraiarasan left the office a few weeks ago, S Srinivasa Ragavan, librarian in-charge, BDU, has been made the CoE. Srinivasa Ragavan was one among the candidates for the post of director, Centre for Distance Education (CDE), for which none was found suitable.

"The BDU clearly states that temporary appointment to such posts should not be extended beyond a year, but the director of research has been holding the post for close to two years. It is unfair that the vice-chancellor is rewarding such posts to the staff close to him without bothering about the eligibility criteria," alleged a senior faculty from BDU.

The VC was unavailable to take calls. When asked, BDU registrar G Gopinath has said university is taking steps to fill full-time officers to all the statutory posts. "We have got finance committee approval to appoint a full-time director for directorate of research created for fast tracking research. We will be filling other statutory posts simultaneously," he said.

Regarding the non-statutory posts created by the university for convenience, we are contemplating the idea of giving full additional charge for our staff than appointing people from outside, he said.

Title: Nagpur: Experts stress on women’s role on country’s development
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Nirmala Jadhav speaks at the MSS event held on Wednesday

NAGPUR: Various experts outlined women’s role in a nation’s development during the inaugural function of three-day interdisciplinary international seminar on ‘Women in India and Israel: Past, present and future’ at Matru Sewa Sangh Institute of Social Work (MSSISW), Bajaj Nagar, on Wednesday.

The seminar is being jointly organized by MSSISW, School of Social Work, Sapir College, Israel, Mahatma Gandhi Fuji Guruji Centre for Social Work, Wardha, and Tirpude College of Social Work.

Present at the inaugural function were chief guest Nirmala Jadhav from Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University, Aurangabad, guest of honour Nagpur University pro-VC Vinayak Deshpande, Prof Menahem Malka from Israel, Prof Manoj Kumar from Mahatma Gandhi International Hindi University, Wardha, Tirpude College of Social Work principal Keshav Patil, Leena Gahane, Matru Sewa Sangh secretary Lata Deshmukh and principal of the institute Jyoti Niswade.

Giving introductory remarks, Niswade gave a brief overview of the three-day seminar.

Focussing on the swift technological development in Israel, Deshpande said, “The way a country like Israel has evolved and advanced in the technological sector in a short span of time is an aspect to marvel at. Israel being a country unique in itself, we have a lot to learn from their rapid progress. From the agricultural perspective, the country has taught us how to save water and increase productivity at the same time.”

Appreciating Israel’s efforts in expansion of women’s involvement in several respects, he added, “I believe that the developmental level of a country depends on the participation of women in economic activities.”

He went on to discuss the association between India and Israel regarding innovation and sharing of knowledge.

Kumar delved into the status of women in both the countries across the timeline while Patil dealt with the seminar’s perspectives. Malka spoke about the social problems and education revolving around social work from Israel’s point of view.

Jadhav said that the topic chosen for the seminar is very relevant and it is the need of the hour to open a discussion on it. She outlined various issues like gender discrimination, female foeticide, unequal pay, dowry system and other pressing problems.

Gahane pointed out the common threats in both the countries and highlighted a mother's role in development of a nation. Deshmukh spoke about the status of women in nuclear and joint families, women safety and liberalization of women.

The inaugural ceremony concluded with Amod Gurjar proposing a vote of thanks. Shilpa Puranik was the anchor for the programme.

Title: Bhajanpura Murder Case: Kin 'played' with kids, killed them one by one, say Delhi cops
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Police personnel stand outside the house in east Delhi’s Bhajanpura, where five members of a family were found... Read More

NEW DELHI: The sensational murder of the five members of a family in Bhajanpura has been cracked. The crime was committed by a 26-year-old relative, Prabhu Nath, who had borrowed Rs 30,000 from the house owner Shambhu Chaudhary. Nath was arrested from north-east Delhi on Thursday after he confessed to have eliminated Chaudhary and his family members with an iron rod.

While bodies of Chaudhary (43) and his wife Sunita (37) were found lying in their bedroom on Wednesday, the children, Shivam (17), Sachin (14) and Komal (12) were found dead in another room.

A police officer said that on February 3, Nath went to Chaudhary’s house and committed the crime. He was seen leaving the colony after the incident in a CCTV footage that helped the cops crack the case.

Alok Kumar, joint commissioner of police, eastern range, said: “ The case was cracked within 24 hours. The accused, Nath, belongs to Supaul in Bihar. He was working at an institute in Laxmi Nagar and also as a collection agent for some money lenders.”

Investigating officials revealed that Nath had borrowed the money from Chaudhary about six months back. Since it was the accused who made Chaudhary invest in “committees,” police are also probing if he secretly withdrew his money to spend.

Earlier, the cops found that the children had not attended their school after February 3. Chaudhary had spoken to Nath seven times on February 3, which brought the latter’s role under the scanner. With the help of his number, Nath was nabbed near his house.

Explaining the sequence of events, Ved Prakash Surya, deputy commissioner of police, Northeast, said: “When Nath reached Chaudhary’s residence, Sunita was alone. The accused had a heated argument with her, who taunted him for not paying their money back. Nath claims that he murdered her in a fit of rage with an iron rod he was carrying.”

Before he could flee, Komal, who had gone for her tuition class, returned home. Nath then allegedly hit her with the same weapon. Since it was post- school hours, it was time for Shivam and Sachin to return home. First Shivam entered the house and was killed in the same manner as his sister and later Sachin. The kids were blindfolded before the murder on the pretext of playing a game. The accused then locked the house from outside and fled.

Nath later called up Chaudhary and asked the latter to meet him around 7.30 pm near his house. “The two then went to a village area where they drank together. They both returned together. Around 11pm, when Chaudhary was entering his house, Nath attacked him and later shifted his body to a room,” said Surya.

In the CCTV footage recovered, Nath could be seen going towards the deceased’s house around 3.30 pm. He had left the place around 7pm to meet Chaudhary.

Title: Cyberabad traffic cops turn accident video into road safety lesson
Content:
Screengrab of CCTV footage uploaded by Cyberabad traffic police

Two-wheeler driver (in green shirt) trying to go in the opposite direction which forces another two-wheeler to chan… https://t.co/ruyfniqmiO — CYBERABAD TRAFFIC POLICE (@CYBTRAFFIC) 1581506298000

HYDERABAD: A video of an accident released by Cyberabad traffic police of a biker endangering fellow commuters’ life by driving on the wrong side has gone viral on the internet. The CCTV footage on Twitter shows how traffic violations can lead to accidents even without knowledge of the offender.“Two-wheeler driver (in green shirt) trying to go in the opposite direction which forces another two-wheeler to change lane abruptly. The sad part of is two-wheeler rider doesn't understand his role in the accident,” tweeted Cyberabad traffic cops @CYBTRAFFIC.However, the video received mixed reactions with many holding police accountable for unruly traffic culture. “The real sad part of this accident is , it is because of unplanned U turns placed on the road, where there are no speed breakers to reduce the speed of the vehicles at U turns. @cybtraffic do some ground level study,” tweeted Pavan Gopi @DrPavanGopi.Meanwhile, appreciating police for educating public, a twitter handle @TrafficSahayak read, “Really appreciate you diving deep to understand cause and effect!More such videos needed to educate masses.”

Title: Bihar: Seven from Motihari among 14 killed in UP bus mishap
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

A bus travelling from Delhi to Motihari in East Champaran crashed into a stationary truck on the Agra-Lucknow ... Read More

AGRA/MOTIHARI: Altogether 14 people were killed and 31 passengers injured when a bus travelling from Delhi to Motihari in East Champaran crashed into a stationary truck on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway late on Wednesday night. “Seven of those killed in the accident are from Motihari,” said East Champaran DM Raman Kumar.

Three of those killed from Bihar were crew members of the bus while the others were passengers. The bus was on way to Sheohar from New Delhi via Motihari. Sources said the owner of the double-decker bus is a Motihari resident.

According to the Firozabad district administration, most of the dead hailed from Bihar and Delhi. The deceased from Motihari were identified as Kalimuddin (45), Bhagwan Choudhary (54), Chandan Mahto (24), Gulshan (21), Anil Shah (50), Rakesh Kumar (35), and Zafarullah Haq. Sources claimed the death of another person from Motihari, but it could not be confirmed.

Firozabad SP (rural) Rajesh Kumar said the accident took place around 10 pm when the double-decker bus carrying 61 passengers from the national capital to Motihari, crashed into the stationary truck from behind. The injured were taken to Saifai Medical College. Drivers of both heavy vehicles were killed on the spot.

“The impact of the accident was so severe that the bus was crushed to half its length,” said inspector general of police (Agra range) Satish Ganesh, adding, “It took over three hours to evacuate the injured and retrieve bodies from the mangled bus.”

Jagdish Singh, chief security officer of Agra-Lucknow Expressway, Uttar Pradesh Expressways Industrial Development Authority (UPEIDA), said, “The driver of the truck halted the vehicle on the extreme right lane of the expressway to change a flat tyre. The bus, which is registered with Gorakhpur RTO and was coming from the national capital, hit the truck from behind.”

Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed district officials to ensure proper treatment of the injured while Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his condolences to the families of the deceased and wished the injured a speedy recovery.

“The road accident on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway in Uttar Pradesh has caused deep grief. Many passengers have lost their lives ... My condolences to the families of the victims in this hour of grief. I wish those injured recovers soon,” the Prime Minister's Office said in a tweet quoting Modi.

Parents of the deceased driver Mohd Kalimuddin and cleaner Mohd Seraz from Fenehara village lost consciousness after getting the news of death of their sons.

Chandan Mahato of Mahamada and had got married in January this year and had gone to Delhi on Monday for buying some electronic items. Family members of the deceased have left Motihari for Saifai Hospital, where the postmortem was done.

Title: Juvenile detained in Porvorim case
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Panaji: Porvorim police on Thursday detained a juvenile for the rape and murder of a 28-year-old woman from Odisha whose body was recovered from shrubbery near the Kadamba depot, at Porvorim, on Monday. They are yet to trace one more person in connection with the case.

A postmortem report established that the woman was raped and that she died due to smothering. Based on the report, police began investigations and questioned several construction labourers who were working at a site near where the body was found.

Police said that during investigations, it came to light that one person had been missing since the incident occurred. The police later traced the accused.

The victim is believed to have been brought to Goa by a man from Odisha on the assurance of marriage. Police said that when the man went over to his friends’ place for a drink recently, he got inebriated and fell asleep there. When the victim came in search of him, the accused told her that he would take her to him. He, however, took her into the bushes nearby and raped her.

Title: Madurai collector flags off Red Cross centenary rally
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Madurai: District collector Dr TG Vinay, who is also the president of Indian Red Cross Society (IRCS) Madurai branch, flagged off the IRCS centenary vehicle rally at the collectorate on Friday. Over 50 bikes, including members from Junior Red Cross, took part in the rally which ended at Vellamal Engineering College in Viraganoor.

“It is a relay rally from Kanyakumari to Chennai celebrating the service done by Red Cross. The baton will be passed on to the next district at Viraganoor,” said VM Jose, vice-chairman of IRCS Madurai. The rally was led by a Red Cross van with banners highlighting Red Cross’ service in the district.

School students also participated showing their support carrying flags. The rally passed through various schools and colleges in the city before finally reaching Viraganoor.

The collector also unveiled a board marking 100 years of IRCS service. “IRCS Madurai has been particularly involved in providing first aid and disaster management. We also continue to be actively involved in awareness campaigns and conducting blood donation camps,” added Jose. Around 2,500 volunteers are currently part of IRCS Madurai. Recently, the team provided assistance to the injured at Jallikattu events held in the district in January.

The IRCS centenary celebrations in Tamil Nadu began on January 28, inaugurated by the governor Banwarilal Purohit.

Title: Hyderabad: Techie killed in bike mishap
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A 25-year-old software engineer died after he lost control of his bike and rammed into an electric pole in Miyapur on Thursday.

Duggina Vijay Kumar of Vivekananda Nagar, Kukatpally, was on his way home from Miyapur when the accident occurred on Bachupally road. “He was riding without wearing a helmet. He lost control and crashed into the pole at 7.40 am,” said Miyapur police.

“He was declared brought dead at a private hospital,” cops said. A case under 304-A of IPC was filed.

Title: Region MLAs, MPs skip power regulator hearing
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Aurangabad: Barring Aurangabd MP Imtiyaz Jaleel and Jintur MLA Meghana Bordikar, all other public representatives from the eight districts of Marathwada skipped the crucial public hearing organised by Maharashtra Energy Regulatory Commission (MERC) on the proposed tariff hike here on Thursday.

The hearing saw fewer voices against the tariff hike for residential consumers, whereas solar power unit manufacturers dominated the proceedings, raising their voice against the proposed grid-support charges.

While Marathwada has 46 assembly constituencies and eight parliamentary constituencies, a total of 52 MLAs and MPs did not attend the MERC hearing.

Aurangabad MP Imtiyaz Jaleel personally presented his say before MERC authorities, while Bordikar had submitted a detail memorandum on the proposed power hike and other demands and issues. While Jaleel sought special sops for Marathwada from the state power utility. Bordikar demanded infrastructural works in her constituency.

When contacted, senior functionaries of different political parties gave their reasons for their MPs and MLAs skipping the MERC hearing.

BJP spokesperson Shirish Boralkar said his party has already taken up the issue of flaws in the government policy decisions for the power sector at different levels. “We have been at the forefront of protecting the interests of the power consumers. Moreover, one of our party MLAs has submitted necessary presentation before the MERC,” he said.

State Congress delegate Jitendra Dehade said the state government was already mooting plans to offer free power to domestic consumers upto 100 units. “No doubt the MERC hearing was important, but our party has been advocating the demand for free power since beginning,” he said.

A senior Shiv Sena functionary said his party MLAs and MPs could not attend MERC hearing due to the visit of Yuva Sena chief Aaditya Thackeray and Aurangabad district guardian minister Subhash Desai on Thursday. “The top-brass of the party was in the city for important review meetings and therefore all party works and functionaries were busy in making necessary preparations,” he said.

Title: Couple shows solidarity with anti-CAA protests on their wedding day
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: A silent protest against the citizenship amendment Act (CAA), national register of citizens (NRC) and national population register (NPR) was staged at a wedding held in Karaikudi on Wednesday.

The newly-married couple, Mohammed Ghani and bride Afrina, posed for photographs with their friends and relatives, who held placards against CAA, NRC and NPR. Protests are being staged throughout the country against these acts and this couple decided to do it at their wedding.

Guests and relatives were told to hold up the placards which said-- No CAA, No NRC and No NPR. Nobody was compelled to hold up their placards and the guests were told that they could pose with them if they wanted to express solidarity with the couple and many of the guests came forward to do so.

Many of the guests also expressed happiness over this move by the couple on one of the most important days of their life.

Title: Coronavirus: 45 persons isolated till date, 35 under watch in Goa
Content:
Representative image

PANAJI: The cumulative count of persons who have been monitored for novel coronavirus infection in Goa has reached 45, of which ten patients have completed their mandatory 28-day quarantine period. While 35 travelers continue to be under observation, no new cases of suspected nCoV were reported on Thursday. A foreigner who was quarantined in the Goa Medical College (GMC) and hospital, Bambolim, since last week, was discharged two days ago.State epidemiologist Utkarsh Betodkar, said the numbers are likely to dip due to the travel restrictions in force. Stating that they are prepared to handle any eventuality, he said, “I don’t think the number of cases (suspected) will increase,” he said.The directorate of health services (DHS) sends samples to the National Institute of Virology (NIV) Pune, and in suspected cases, samples are collected and tested twice within a span of 24 hours, he said.For persons who test positive for cornonavirus, he said, it is required to test samples every day, since the disease is new. This also helps to study the disease, Betodkar said.“Travelers under observation are advised to maintain a distance of around a metre, even when interacting with their family members, to reduce the risk of transmission, just in case, he/she is a carrier,” Dr Betodkar said.A local health official keeps a tab on the cases in their area. “The travelers are house-quarantined instead of in the hospital,” he said.He said that 14 days’ quarantine is adequate, but the period is doubled in order to be on the safer side.

Title: Bail plea of Mirchi ‘frontman’ denied again
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act ( PMLA ) court on Thursday rejected the bail plea of Humayun Merchant (70), the alleged frontman of drug smuggler Iqbal Mirchi . Merchant was arrested in October in the money laundering case involving the now deceased Mirchi and his three Worli properties. This is the second time the court has rejected his bail plea.

Merchant is accused of holding the power of attorney for the properties and creating forged tenants in the properties that were later sold for redevelopment and proceeds allegedly laundered.

Opposing his bail plea, the enforcement directorate had submitted the probe revealed that Merchant had arranged for carriers to smuggle drugs to various countries for Mirchi. “For the said smuggling, he was arrested in Hong Kong and convicted there, and faced three years’ rigorous imprisonment.”

The ED also told the court after the prosecution complaint (chargesheet) was submitted, during further investigations, the statement of Mirchi’s second wife was recorded and she told them about this too. The woman had said she was acquitted in the case. The ED said it had recorded the statements of various persons convicted for carrying drugs at Merchant’s behest. “It is evident that he worked as front of Iqbal not only in property dealings but also in his other illegal deeds,” the ED said.

The ED also argued that Merchant had evaded law enforcement agencies for long and he could abscond if granted bail. Stating that further probe is underway and at a crucial stage, the prosecution had said, “He is now aware of the direction of the investigations and may tip off other suspects to evade the investigations.”

Defence advocate Sujay Kantawala submitted the prosecution complaint was already submitted and cited Merchant’s age and health. The defence said a key accused, Dheeraj Wadhawan aka Baba Dewan, had been granted bail. The court said their roles could not be compared.

Title: Kappalur fire: One more person dies
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The death toll in the Kappalur fire accident has risen to three after one more injured person R Vijayakumar, 35, succumbed at the Government Rajaji Hospital on Thursday.

The incident took place on Monday, when diesel and petrol pilfered from trucks, and stored in a container in a temporary shed in Kappalur went up in flames. The fire broke out when fire from gas stove spread to inflammable materials illegally hoarded in the shed.

While P Ganesan, 40, died on the spot, five people including the shed owner M Asaithambi, 50, Vijayakumar A Karthick, 24, V Arumugam, 66, and R Ravi were admitted in government hospitals for treatment. tnn

Title: Tiger from Goa caught on camera in Karnataka forest
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

The camera has caught the wild cat returning to the site of the killing to eat the cow.

KERI: A camera trap has captured images of a tiger in the forests of Huland which may have migrated from Satre village in Sattari, Goa, on Wednesday. The equipment was installed by forest officials of Kankumbi range in Karnataka after a cow was killed and four buffaloes injured on February 12 in the same forests.

The camera has caught the wild cat returning to the site of the killing to eat the cow. The new images are being compared to previous ones of a cub from 2016 and 2017. A wildlifer working in the forested areas of Goa, Maharashtra and Karnataka, on the condition of anonymity, said, “The images of the tiger taken in Huland are most probably of the same cub that was camera trapped in Satre in 2016 and again in 2017. The stripes of this tiger matches the images of the tiger photographed in Huland.”

Deputy conservator of forests (wildlife division) Vikas Desai told TOI, “The images of the tiger captured by the camera trap in Huland and the images of a tiger cub available in our database has indicated that this tiger is from the forests of Satre. On a day-to-day basis, our staff has been involved in monitoring tiger movements. So far we have not obtained any concrete evidence if the said tiger is in the forests of Karnataka or Goa.”

On February 12, Babu Bodke lost another cow to a wild animal killing in the Kankumbi forest range. The family alleges that it was killed by the tiger. Deputy conservator of forests of Belgaum, Amarnath told TOI, “A domesticated animal has been killed in Huland. So far we have no evidence of whether the animal was killed by a tiger or a leopard. Our officials have installed camera traps in the forests where the animal was killed and are investigating the matter.”

Title: NRI women safety cell logs 70 petitions
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: The NRI Cell of Women Safety Wing, (WSW) which was inaugurated last July, has received 70 complaints. Of them, 29 are under investigation, while 41 are at trial stage.

In five cases, look out circulars were executed against NRI spouses, while in six passports of NRI accused were impounded.

On Thursday, a two-day workshop was inaugurated at NRI Cell, aiming at capacity building to bring convergence among investigating officers, public prosecutors and victims. TS IT Cell launched its voice over app and information brochure on ‘Services of TS NRI Cell’. Inspector-general of police , (WSW) , Swati Lakra said standard operating procedures have to be followed during investigation and NRI cases.

Title: City sees spike in woman harassment cases
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: A 25-year-old private firm employee created a fake ID on an app to harass a woman. Similarly, a hotel supervisor harassed his colleague by calling her frequently. Both accused have been arrested.

As per records, Cyberabad SHE Team have registered 75 such cases in January alone, this year.

In the first incident, the employee created the fake ID on ‘MeetMe’ App to blackmail the woman. After receiving a complaint, Kukatpally cops conducted a decoy operation and nabbed him.

In the second case, the hotel supervisor kept harassing his colleague that she should talk to him. When she refused, he threatened to defame her. Shamshabad police arrested the offender following a complaint. Dundigal police said in another case, a man morphed and created nude pictures of his friend’s wife. The accused was arrested after a complaint was filed. TNN

Title: Madurai walls come alive with paintings of birds, animals
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Madurai corporation and EFI have joined hands to beautify the city in this manner while building environmental... Read More

MADURAI: Prominent walls of Madurai city are getting a facelift with a difference — they will come alive with paintings of birds and animals which were once common to the city and suburbs but are now rare. Madurai corporation and Environmentalist Foundation of India (EFI) have joined hands to beautify the city in this manner while building environmental awareness.

``Two to three decades ago, every child knew how to identify an animal or bird, but children of today do not have this knowledge. So we decided to take up paintings on the prominent walls,’’ said corporation commissioner S Visakan. He reached out to environmentalist and founder of EFI Arun Krishnamurthy, who readily agreed to chip in to develop the city’s environment. The EFI does the work with the help of corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds while the civic body’s responsibility is to identify the spots. Many important parts of the city, including the zonal offices of Madurai corporation, now have beautiful colourful paintings of these birds and animals on them, which do not fail to attract the attention of those who pass by.

Education and CSR associate of EFI, H Prestha said many of these birds and animals were now confined to hotspots like Madurai airport. What they wanted to do was help students identify and know about the birds and animals which are seen in Madurai. The names of the birds and animals are given in clear big letters below the pictures.

T Venkatesh of Vanavil Fine Arts School, the man behind the drawings, says he was handpicked by EFI which had been looking for good artists in Madurai. He uses water-based exterior emulsion paints which would look good for five years with proper maintenance. The photographs of the birds and animals were sent to him by EFI and he tries his best to adhere to the colours in the photographs.

``Even I haven’t seen many of these birds, but villagers who pass by while I draw say they have seen them in their village many years ago. That is rewarding as it proves that the paintings look like the real birds,’’ he said. The commissioner said they hoped to transform the prominent walls in the city with these paintings in the next three to four months. EFI has also come forward to rejuvenate three ponds in the city, he added.

Title: Trump's Ahmedabad visit: Air Force One to be accompanied by 7 other aircraft
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image.
