AHMEDABAD: In a first, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International (SVPI) airport in Ahmedabad, will handle the arrival and departure of Air Force One – a Boeing 747 aircraft, as US President Donald Trump is scheduled to arrive in Ahmedabad around noon on February 24. The famed flying fortress that will fly President Trump and the US first lady, Melania Trump ,will be accompanied by seven other aircraft to Ahmedabad.

Sources stated that a total of eight aircraft will arrive at the city airport. These include two Boeing 747 including the Air Force One, in addition to six cargo aircraft. The cargo aircraft are used to ferry the car in which the US president will travel, in addition to other logistics support and material that may be required.

The six cargo aircraft will include the Globe Master and Hercules cargo aircraft, which usually accompany the president on his foreign trips. Hercules is used to transport the presidential vehicles. Four cargo aircraft are expected to arrive in advance, whereas the remaining two will arrive on February 24, along with the two passenger aircraft.

American security agencies have been deployed to oversee the security of the US president. Sources confirmed that the presidential suite along with other rooms have been blocked for the US president and the US first lady at city-based Hyatt Regency. “It is not sure whether the US president will be going to the hotel because the schedule is extremely time-pressed,” a source said. Rooms have also been blocked for the US Embassy officials at Hotel Hyatt in Vastrapur area of the city, revealed sources.

Title: Our fin performance was better than that of EPS government: DMK
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

CM Edappadi K Palaniswami

CHENNAI: The Tamil Nadu government’s data on revenue and fiscal deficit differs from revised budgets and annual accounts, said DMK MLA and financial analyst P T R Palanivel Thiagarajan. In an interaction with reporters on Thursday, Thiagarajan compared the financial situation of the DMK and AIADMK governments during their tenures between 2006 to 2019.

“One best example to show the current financial situation in Tamil Nadu is to compare the budget and the annual accounts of 2018-19. The budget said the revenue deficit will be Rs 17,490 crore. The financial year ended with Rs 23,459 crore revenue deficit.

Comparing revenue data between 2006 and 2011 under the DMK government, with 2011-2016 and 2016 to 2019 when the AIADMK was governing the state, Thiagarajan said the average financial performance in the DMK regime was far better than it is now. “Under the DMK regime, on an average, 100% revenue was spent for welfare schemes. During the Jayalalithaa regime, 82% of the revenue was spent on welfare schemes. Under the present (Edappadi K Palaniswami) regime, however, 100% of spending for welfare schemes is from borrowings,” said Thiagarajan.

He said the EPS government was taking loans to pay interest on loans. “Nearly 18% of the debt is used to pay interest while this was not the case under both Jayalalithaa and Kalaignar (M Karunanidhi) regimes,” he said, adding that his assessment was based on data collated from the state government website.

The MLA said the state’s revenue as per the GSDP has been declining over the years. “While it was 10.46% in the DMK government, it declined to 9.62% in Jayalalithaa’s government. Under the current government, it is 7.29%,” he said. The MLA accused the government of not being transparent in uploading the data. “The half year report was not given to MLAs and I had to ask the assembly secretary for a copy,” said Thiagarajan.

Title: Bangalore Airport: Karnataka gets nod for three more airports
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Officials say Mysuru airport is witnessing occupancy of 60-70% daily

BENGALURU: The government, buoyed by launching Kalaburagi and Bidar airports, is set to build four more in the state and already has in-principle approvals from the civil aviation ministry for airports in Hassan, Shivamogga and Vijayapura. The government is also tying up with the Indian Navy to build an airport near Ankola.

Should these plans fructify, it will take the number of airports outside Bengaluru to 10. However, the government will have to fund construction of all four airports as the Centre had put the onus on the “respective project proponent”.

As per a written response tabled by the civil aviation ministry in the Lok Sabha last week, Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri said his ministry has given “in-principle” approval for airports at Vijayapura (Rs 150 crore), Hassan (Rs 592 crore) and Shivamogga (Rs 39 crore).

Sources say land acquisition for all three greenfield airports have been completed, but construction costs need to be factored-in. “Since the Centre has put the onus on the respective project proponent, effectively the state government, the state must allocate Rs 800 to Rs 1,000 crore for the purpose,” an official said.

The government though, is close to inking a pact with the navy to develop an airport at Ankola. The Navy already owns property which it is willing to concede for a civilian airport. “It will be on similar lines to the one the government constructed in Bidar with the Indian Air Force,” said another official.

Meanwhile, the government says it is seeing increased interest from “smaller” and new airlines to operate to Tier-II cities. Officials say since most established airlines have monopolised trunk routes, newer and smaller airlines are bidding under the regional connectivity scheme (RCS).

The advantages for firms operating on RCS routes are no landing or hanger costs, subsidy of almost 25% on at least 50% of occupied seats and the only 2% excise duty on air turbine fuel (ATF).

The government says three airports — Belagavi, Hubballi and Mysuru — are well settled with daily occupancy at 60% to 70%, Kalaburagi is already seeing 80% occupancy.

Title: Your electricity bill may get higher in Tamil Nadu
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Power consumers in Tamil Nadu should be prepared to pay more for electricity in the coming months as the Tamil Nadu Electricity Regulatory Commission (TNERC) has started the tariff revision process by asking Tangedco to submit the Aggregate Revenue Requirement (ARR) before the end of the month.

Tangedco had sought more time from TNERC to submit ARR and proposal for tariff revision, but the regulatory commission has ordered that the discom comply with the deadline.

Once the ARR and tariff revision proposal are presented to TNERC, the process of revising the tariff will begin with the commission holding consultation meetings with consumers across the state. It will culminate in the commission passing final orders on tariff revision. Sources told TOI that the tariff revision process will start after the urban local body elections are over.

“Once ARR is submitted by Tangedco, we will upload it on the TNERC website,” said a senior TNERC official.

He said the entire process of tariff revision including eliciting public response will take not less than four months. “If Tangedco submits its tariff revision demand by February end, latest by July we will award the final order on tariff revision,” said the official.

As per the Electricity Act, tariff must be revised every year. “We should be getting ARR every November and by April the new tariff has to be announced. But the state, for political reasons, has been refraining from tariff revision exercise for more than five years. The last tariff revision happened in Tamil Nadu in 2014. No state allows its discom to file ARR annually,” said the official.

“We have started the work on ARR,” said a senior Tangedco official. “The last revision did not help the discom mop up much revenue as the state announced free power of 100 units per billing cycle to all consumers. This is in addition to the free power supplied to huts, weavers and farmers. Though we get subsidy from the government, there is a time lag between the supply of power and receipt of subsidy,” said the Tangedco official.

Title: Chef’s wife petitions collector to bring back quarantined ship crew
Content:
Malliga (L), wife of chef Anbalagan who is on board quarantined ship Diamond Princess made an appeal to the go... Read More

MADURAI: Malliga, the wife of chef Anbalagan of the cruise ship “Diamond Princess”, which has been quarantined off Yokohama in Japan for more than a week, on Thursday petitioned Madurai district collector T G Vinay seeking steps to bring home the Indians on board including the Tamil crew.“I am not here for my husband alone but on behalf of the 160 Indians including five Tamil Nadu crew,” she said after petitioning the collector. The mother of two said her husband is healthy, confident and also comforting her. “But our fear is on the rise as coronavirus is spreading day after day. Everyone please pray (for them),” she said and appealed to the Union and state governments to reunite the men with their families before the quarantine period ended on February 19.Thiruparankundram MLA P Saravanan (DMK) who accompanied her said his party is taking efforts to bring the stranded men home through Anbalagan who is from his assembly segment. He said the collector promised to make all efforts in this regard. Meanwhile, on Thursday, Anbalagan told TOI that the crew members on board have been separated. “Yesterday when the Indian Embassy officials in Tokyo contacted me I expressed concern over the crowded crew mess and that it could result in the virus spreading. I don’t know if they have made the changes because of my complaint but I am happy about it,” he said.The chef said the Japanese health officials have made arrangements in such a way that the crew members are not seated opposite or close to each other while having food. “Only six more days (quarantine) to go. By then those with symptoms will be known. It will be over on the 19th and we will be sent home. We are likely to return home any time next week after 20th,” he added.Meanwhile, Japanese health officials are planning to get the guests to voluntarily disembark to complete their quarantine period at a shoreside facility. This was stated by Princess Cruises, the parent company of Diamond Princess, in a statement on their official website. It said the most medically vulnerable guests will go out in the first phase and be tested for the novel coronavirus . If the test is positive they will be transported to a local hospital for further evaluation and isolation. If negative, they will be given the option to leave the ship and be transported to a quarantine housing facility. There are no clinics in these facilities, but prescription medication will be provided. Medical care will require transportation to a hospital or clinic.

Title: Kerala: Crime branch summons all Insas rifles from battalions
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

A verification of records by crime branch earlier proved that the 25 missing Insas rifles had been distributed... Read More

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The crime branch (CB) has launched a physical verification of all 660 Insas rifles with the state armed police battalion, after a CAG report said 25 rifles were missing.

Crime branch ADGP Tomin Thachankary formed a special team under Thiruvananthapuram unit DSP Anilkumar to probe the charges and to expedite the departmental probe.

The rifles, distributed to various armed batallion, would be summoned back to the police headquarters for verification of stocks. “We have asked all battalions to surrender the rifles for verification by Friday evening. The rifles will be re-issued after stock taking,” the ADGP said .

Earlier, a CB verification revealed that the missing rifles had been distributed to armed reserve camps. The information was passed to CAG officials during the exit conference held in November last year.

The exit conference records show that as many as 660 Insas 5.56mm rifles were received by the SAP battalion from the police chief store in the capital during various periods from June 29, 2005. From the 660 rifles, the SAP issued 616 permanently to various battalions and other units as per the orders issued by the police headquarters during various periods. These included 95 to KAP-1 battalion, Thrissur, 335 to KAP-3 battalion, Adoor, 135 rifles to KAP-5 battalion, Kuttikanam, 31 rifles to India Reserve Battalion , 15 rifles to quick response team, armed reserve camp, Thiruvananthapuram city, and five to armed reserve, Thiruvananthapuram coastal.

“The remaining 44 Insas rifles are very much available and are kept in the SAP battalion. As per the existing stock mentioned above, there are no deficits in receiving, issuing or current stock of the Insas rifles in SAP,” said the report.

During the exit conference, the police had promised that due departmental action was on the anvil for the gratuitous lapses in upkeep of records.

The records further said that the police replied the audit team that even though as per the audit report, 25 rifles are missing from SAP battalion’s stock, the rifles, categorized as missing have been found.

The exit meeting records added that a preliminary inquiry initiated—as the scrutiny of ammunition and stock registers has also revealed that the shortage of ammunition/cartridges— is seen from 1994.

“The physical verifications and the stock registers, etc. are being further verified and the responsibility would be fixed based on the result of the preliminary inquiry,” police said.

Title: Eight injured after FOB ramp caves in at Bhopal station
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

The gaping hole in the ramp at platform No. 2 after a portion of it collapsed at Bhopal railway station on Thu... Read More

BHOPAL: Eight people including two minors were injured when the ramp of a foot overbridge (FOB) at Bhopal railway station collapsed on Thursday morning. All the victim were passengers and they were coming out of station. They fell from around 20 feet height and sustained severe injuries. The incident led to chaos at the railway station. Railway and police officials somehow controlled the situation.

Seven of the eight victims including two women and two boys belonged to the same family and were part of a 35-member family group that had gone to Hyderabad to attend a marriage function. Apart from them, a 28-year-old contractual teacher at Rajiv Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidyalaya (RGPV) who hails from Vidisha, was also injured in the incident.

One of the minor boys was rushed to Hamidia hospital by the family members themselves in an auto-rickshaw while others were rushed to railway hospital by officials from where they were referred to a private medical college in Bhainsakhedi area.

When TOI visited the hospital, there was a situation of complete chaos. Patients were screaming in pain and mediapersons were trying to gather details from family members and relatives of the injured. Many news channels were shooting right from the emergency wards and talking to the injured lying on beds.

An eyewitness of the incident and member of victim family, Abdul Nasir Khan (54), a resident of Krishna Nagar near Gitanjali College on Berasia Road, told TOI that around 35 members of Rehman family including women and children had gone to Hyderabad to attend a marriage function. He said he still could not believe that his relatives who were returning happily after attending a marriage function were injured in the freak accident.

Nasir said that his nephew Ejaz Ur Rehman, a resident of Jeddah Colony Jehangirabad, was married to Mariyam on January 22. The family had gone to Hyderabad to attend the wedding of Ejaz’s sister.

Nasir said they reached Bhopal by Sampark Kranti express and alighted at platform number 2. All of them got down and started walking over the ramp of the foot overbridge. He was walking behind. As soon as they reached just near the top of the ramp, it made some sound and a part of it collapsed.

Nasir said before he could understand anything, he heard cries of his relatives. He went down and found that some of his family members were stuck under the debris.

The injured members of his family include Salim Ur Rehman (38), Khalil Ur Rehman (28), Mariyam Beg (19), all residents of Jeddah Colony Jehangirabad, along with Khalid Beg (48), a resident of Chhavni, Nahid (37), wife of Mohammed Azhar, a resident of Arif Nagar and her two sons Ayan (15) and Aman (17), were stuck under the debris.

Nasir said panic gripped the railway station just after the incident. People including passengers, railway officials, policemen and vendors started rushing towards the spot. Family members started rescuing the relatives as officials were busy in clearing the crowd. Family members themselves rushed some injured to a hospital while other injured were rushed to railway hospital by officials. After providing primary treatment the injured were shifted to a private medical college in Bhainsakhedi.

Nasir said that Nahid sustained multiple fractures in her limbs and serious injury on face. Mariyam’s hand was fractured. Khalid’s sustained severe injury in his back while Salim’s legs were fractured. Khalil too sustained severe injury in back while Aman and Ayan sustained severe head injuries.

The injured RGPV PhD scholar was identified as Anupam Sharma, 28, a resident of Arihant Vihar Vidisha. He commuted to Bhopal daily by train. His brother-in-law Shekhar Sharma, a resident of Neelbad, told TOI that Anupam had come from Vidisha by train and was climbing the overbridge through ramp when the accident took place. His colleague, who was walking behind him, informed his wife Nidhi about the incident over phone. Subsequently Nidhi informed her brother Abhishek Sharma, who resides in Sehore and works at Sanchi Milk Federation in Bhopal about the incident.

Shekhar said that Anupam sustained severe back injury and could not lift his lower body. He could not even get up from bed on his own.

IG (Rail) Jaideep Prasad said that GRP Bhopal have registered a case in the matter against unidentified accused under section 337, 338 and 288 of IPC. Probe was on and the railway officials, who will be found responsible for the incident, will be prosecuted.

Title: Bhopal station ‘ramp’ collapse : Against norms, victims taken to 18-km away private hospital
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Victims admitted at a private hospital in Bhopal on Thursday

BHOPAL: Facilities at government-run Hamidia hospital were disregarded as injured victims of Bhopal station ‘ramp’ collapse were taken to a private hospital instead, here on Thursday. Two patients who were treated at Hamidia hospital, were also shifted to a private hospital by 2 pm, confirmed Hamidia hospital superintendent Dr AK Chourasia. CT scan and other live saving measures were conducted at the government hospital.

Railway officials told the relatives of the injured that they have a tie-up with a private hospital. The same agreement is not with the government-run hospital. As per Indian railway medical manual, 2000 amended in 2006 determines that ‘injured should be sent to railway or government hospital’.

Soon after the accident, seven of the injured were rushed to a 60-bed divisional ‘Model’ railway hospital just 2.2 kms away from the spot, and it hardly takes 9 minutes to reach there. But the ‘Model’ railway hospital, in turn, referred the patients, after primary treatment, to a private hospital which is 18 kms. Sources say that the railway hospital was not equipped to handle the patients as it does not have a surgeon, no ventilator and in casualty care, there is only one orthopaedic.

Going by West Central Railway annual report, medical facilities available at the divisional hospital include ‘Indoor Services along with ICU and Casualty’. Medical services officials of the railway hospital Dr Asha Chamania and Dr Ajita Tausane did not respond to repeated calls and SMSes.

In fact the patients were treated at private medical hospital 18 km away whereas in the zonal disaster management plan, the private hospital is listed 8 km away, which is near Hamidia Hospital.

Questions over lack of medical staff and outsourcing have been raised against the railway hospital in the past too. Indian Railways Disaster Management Plan of September, 2018 calls for ‘specialised training initially to a few select doctors in each Divisional Hospital (and the Zonal Hospitals) to support Incident Response Team (IRT).

Bhopal railway division PRO, IA Siddique said injured were taken to the private hospital as it has better facilities. “We wanted to admit victims in a hospital equipped with best facilities,” said Siddique.

Title: BR Ambedkar was more intelligent than Jawaharlal Nehru, says Telangana BJP chief K Laxman
Content:
K Laxman

Learnt from the book that Nehru did not want Patel in the Cabinet in 1947 and omitted him from the initial Cabinet… https://t.co/pP3kXio9T9 — Dr. S. Jaishankar (@DrSJaishankar) 1581519462000

HYDERABAD: Days after external affairs minister S Jaishankar triggered a Twitter war with his remarks that Jawaharlal Nehru did not want Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel in his cabinet, Telangana BJP president K Laxman on Thursday alleged that Nehru had always suppressed BR Ambedkar .Laxman said Nehru could not stand Ambedkar, who was more intelligent than him. Jaishankar, citing a new book, claimed that Nehru did not want Patel in his cabinet and historian Ramachandra Guha joined Congress leaders to discount the argument and hit out at the minister.Coming down heavily on AIMIM, he said: “Everyone knows what love (Asaduddin) Owaisi has towards Hindus.”

Title: Arvind Kejriwal: Education, jobs, health for all will make Tricolour fly high
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Arvind Kejriwal will take oath as the chief minister of Delhi, along with six colleagues, at Ramlila Maidan on... Read More

NEW DELHI: After leading his party to the third successive term in Delhi, AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday invited Delhiites to attend the swearing-in ceremony at Ramlila Maidan on Sunday.

In an emotional message, which was posted on Twitter and Facebook and played on FM channels all day, Kejriwal connected the honour of Tricolour with good education, health facilities, safety of women and jobs for the youth — the promises made by AAP in its election manifesto.

“Only when every child of Mother India gets good education, every person gets good treatment, women get self-confidence from her safety and honour, the tag of unemployed gets removed from the youth, every drop of farmers’ sweat brings happiness to their homes, every Indian citizen gets basic amenities and each person rises above caste and religion to take country forward, only then the Tricolour will fly high with honour,” the chief minister said, asking every Delhiite to reach Ramlila Maidan with the family at 10am on Sunday to “bless your son”.

Kejriwal will take oath along with six colleagues, who were part of his council of ministers in the previous term as well.

AAP has also invited ‘Baby Mufflerman’ Aavyan Tomar, who dressed up as Kejriwal on the day of the counting, as a special invitee, a functionary said. Tomar, a little more than a year old, hogged the headlines after he was spotted at the party headquarters. His family couldn’t meet Kejriwal on Tuesday.

Kejriwal has also written to party volunteers and supporters that their message of “vote on work” was effectively communicated, and in response, Delhiites showered AAP with their love. “I look forward to your continued support and conviction that together we can take this model of governance to people across our country,” he wrote, adding that education, healthcare, water, electricity, women’s safety and empowerment had now become winnable, mainstream electoral issues.

“Our work in providing these basic necessities has provided a dignified life to lakhs of needy people and opened up opportunities for them, besides growing the economy. It has now set a new benchmark for honest politics and good governance for governments across the country,” Kejriwal said in the letter. “Thank you for believing in us.”

A source said Kejriwal might call a meeting of his new cabinet later on Sunday to announce portfolios and call a two-day assembly session from Tuesday, when the other MLAs would take oath.

The party has decided not to invite any chief minister or politician from other states. AAP-Delhi convener Gopal Rai said the event would be a “Delhi-specific” ceremony. However, AAP is likely to invite all seven BJP MPs of Delhi and its eight MLAs. AAP has won 62 seats in the 70-member assembly.

Title: Vicky Kaushal on 'Takht': We'll be sensitive to history
Content: Actor Vicky Kaushal on Thursday said that the team of the upcoming historical 'Takht' will be sensitive to history and will try to chronicle it with utmost honesty. 'Takht' marks Karan Johar 's first attempt at directing a period drama which traces the relationship between Mughal emperor Aurangzeb and his brother Dara Shukoh.Vicky, who plays Aurangzeb in the film, said the team is aware of the pressure of staying true to the narrative."I've always wanted to be a part of historical drama. This one is as big as it gets, with a great ensemble cast and Karan helming it. They have their own pressure to make the narrative as true as what's written in history. For us as performers too the pressure is the same," Vicky said in a group interview.The actor said that he will follow the vision of the director and it is the filmmaker's prerogative to take "what part of the story he wants to narrate and stick to that.""If I'm playing the character of Prithvi in 'Bhoot' and Aurangzeb in 'Takht', the emotion has to be honest... We are trying to be as sensitive as possible to what was part of history. We are doing exactly that. Like Karan sir answered earlier that he's just telling a story that history has already written."The historical drama also features Anil Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor Khan Ranveer Singh , Vicky, Alia Bhatt , Janhvi Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar.Vicky will be next seen in 'Bhoot: The Haunted Ship', backed by Karan. The horror film, directed by Bhanu Pratap Singh , will release on February 21.Apart from 'Bhoot' and 'Takht', Vicky will also be seen in Shoojit Sircar 's biopic on Udham Singh and will reunite with 'Uri' director Aditya Dhar for his next in which he will play Ashwatthama.Vicky said Dhar's film is a "superhero mythology" project and will require physical transformation.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Panic as infant dies after vaccination at PHC
Content:
Representative image

TIRUVANNAMALAI/CHENNAI: The death of a five-month-old boy a day after vaccination led to a protest outside the Nesal primary health centre in Tiruvannamalai district on Thursday. While relatives of the baby said the death was caused by negligence of the village health nurse, health department officials said the baby died due to milk aspiration.On Wednesday, Litish was taken to the vaccination camp at Pudhupattu village by his father Seeranjeevi 28, a lorry driver and his wife Tamilarasi. He was administered pentavalent vaccine by a village health nurse Senthamizhselvi of Saidapet in Arani town during the camp. After vaccination, Litish was sent home. “An otherwise healthy baby, Litish became restless after the vaccination and also developed fever. At night, after feeding him, Tamil left him in the cloth cradle. When she saw him the next day, he was lying motionless,” said the boy’s uncle Baskar.Parents rushed him to Nesal PHC that is 4km away from their house. At the PHC, the duty doctor declared the infant brought dead and the family began protesting outside the hospital demanding action against nurse Senthamizhselvi. The Arani Taluk police pacified the protestors and sent infant’s body for a postmortem.Block medical officer Dr Sudha, who read the copy of the post-mortem, said the death was due to respiratory distress. Samples have been sent for further pathological tests. “The same batch of vaccines were given to several hundred children on Wednesday. In the same PHC, the nurse has given the vaccine to eight other infants. There were no adverse reports,” she said.The directorate of public health has registered the death as an adverse event following immunization (AEFI) and will place it before a ten-member committee for a death audit. The committee will comprise of members including officials from the central government, who will look at the medical case sheet, post-mortem report and speak to parents, doctors and nurses. “That is a protocol,” said joint director ( immunisation ) Dr C Sekar. “Going by the symptoms, it looks like the child died because milk aspiration. This is very common among young children,” he said.

Title: Chennithala seeks CBI, NIA probes, wants DGP sacked
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala demanded a CBI inquiry against state police chief Lokanath Behera with regard to the financial irregularities and misappropriation of funds cited in the comptroller and auditor general ( CAG ) report tabled in the assembly on Wednesday.

In his letter to chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan, the opposition leader also demanded a probe by National Investigation Agency (NIA) into the findings of the report about rifles and cartridges missing from the police.

He also demanded that the state police chief be immediately removed from the post.

“The CAG has come up with grave findings that as many as 25 rifles that can fire 600-650 bullets in a minute are missing from the armed reserve camp; this is a grave threat to the national security. The report also accuses that Rs 4.35 crore that is meant for construction of official quarters for sub-inspectors and assistant sub-inspectors has been diverted for the construction of villas and camp houses for DGP and ADGPs,” Chennithala said in his letter.

Chennithala further added that all norms have been violated for purchasing of VVIP security vehicles using the funds for the modernisation of police force. Placing of supply orders without inviting tenders and granting Rs 33 lakh to the contractor without seeking the permission of the government are nothing but corruption and irregularity, Chennithala said in his letter.

Union minister of state for external affairs V Muraleedharan expressed concerns over whether the missing arms and ammunitions would have reached the hands of terrorists.

Amid the brewing controversies, Lokanath Behera met the chief minister here on Thursday and held a closed-door meeting for more than 30 minutes.

After the meeting, the police chief refused to make any comment on the CAG report citing that it would be inappropriate for him to make any comment. The chief minister, however, said that there is a specific way for replying to the findings of the CAG report.

Title: Nagpur: Alibaug tailor’s daughter, IAS aspirant teens among toppers at Government Polytechnic
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Toppers at Government Polytechnic

NAGPUR: Rohinee Wankhede, who hails from a village in Alibaug, overcame several financial and family hurdles to emerge topper in diploma in travel and tourism during the 22nd convocation ceremony of Government Polytechnic at Sadar on Thursday.

Apart from her, the toppers included 19-year-olds Pratik Wankhede and Viditee Jaltare, both from civil engineering, and Nikhil Ambulkuar of electrical branch. All of them aspire to become IAS officers.

Working part-time, Rohinee is now saving to fund her higher studies. Her father shifted to Akola to look after her ailing mother while her mother and two siblings live in Alibaug. “My mother worked part-time to meet the expenses on my studies in Nagpur,” she said.

These students were among the 21 toppers from 12 branches, while 711 in all were conferred diplomas during the ceremony on the campus. They received gold, silver, and bronze medals beside 28 sponsored awards.

Rohinee did her HSC in commerce and wanted to make a career in the financial sector. “But I decided to take up the new diploma course to start working early to support my family’s financial needs,” she said.

Her elder sister is pursuing fashion designing while younger brother is an engineering student in Penn.

Her dad shifter to Akola in 2010 and had been working there. After her final exams, she started working as front office executive at a resort in Tadoba. Now, she is back to Nagpur and working under a chartered accountant.

Pratik, Viditee and Nikhil have enrolled for BTech and BE degrees while their ultimate aim is to clear civil services.

“I want to ensure housing to all poor people of India and make education free. Our literacy rate is too low,” said Pratik, who topped among all disciplines.

His classmate and second overall topper Viditee said she wishes to be an IAS officer to serve the nation and disseminate knowledge.

Topper among all girls, Monica Dholwani’s reason to opt for computer science engineering was her limited access to technology as a kid. “We lived in a joint family and had only one computer. I always wanted to know more about it and developed liking for gadgets,” she said.

Monica now wants go for innovations and propagate use of technology in rural areas of the country. “I want to take technology-enabled services to villages,” she said.

Title: Sodala incident exposes chink in safety at JDA’s construction sites
Content:
The Sodala elevated road site on Thursday. The incident occurred here on Wednesday

Times View After claiming the life of a citizen at the construction site of the elevated road in Sodala last year and having a miraculous escape from a bigger mishap on Wednesday at the same site, the Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) has failed to learn any lessons from these accidents. Without acknowledging the obvious failure on their part in taking safety measures, authorities have blamed the accident on ‘mechanical failure’. The response of JDA shows that it does not even want to question the lapses of the private company that caused the ‘mechanical failure’. If the JDA does not introspect and rectify its mistakes, commuters passing along such sites will be running bigger risk putting their lives in danger. Hopefully, authorities will wake up before it’s too late.

JAIPUR: While the Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) remains casual, commuters and residents fear that the incident at Sodala elevated road on Wednesday could have turned into a horrific accident, probably one of the biggest, if the 65-tonne iron cast would have come crashing down.The incident has exposed the glaring chink in security measures near the sites taken up by the authorities, while using heavy machinery. The authorities have expressed their helplessness saying that the accident occurred due to mechanical failure. But commuters have pointed out the lackadaisical approach of the civic body and the contracted firm. Vardharn Singh, a retired civil engineer said, “The JDA should thoroughly check the machines used by the contractor. If these kind of accidents occur, heavy penalty should be imposed on the contractor in order to prevent this in future. Will the civic body implement stringent measures only when people are dead?”A senior JDA engineer said, that the firm has trained staff and a safety officer at site who assigns the duty to every driver on various machines as per his experience and qualification. However, there is no way to stop accidents due to machine failure. An official on the condition of anonymity, said, “No action has been taken against the firm. The only precautionary measure JDA takes is that it works at night using heavy machines when there is no traffic flow.”The heavy machines working on construction sites at flyover routes will continue for several months threatening the safety of commuters. The skeletal pillars of the much-delayed projects, which are erected on the most arterial routes, have not only triggered severe congestion during peak hours, but also pose a risk for commuters who are travelling beneath the heavy machinery. Many heavy machines, such as piling machine, trucks and cranes, above the narrow road with traffic flowing on either sides, have made it an accident-prone area. “Wednesday’s incident could have caused immense damage. The JDA is waiting for a bigger incident to happen,” he said.This is not the first accident on the elevated road ever since the construction started. In April 2019, a 25-year-old youth riding pillion on his brother's bike was killed after an overhead height barrier crashed on his head near Hawa Sadak in Sodala.

Title: Coimbatore KSRTC bus tragedy: ‘Truck driver dozed off, lost control’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

19 people were killed when a container truck rammed into Kerala bound bus in Tirupur district on Thursday

The bodies were sent to the Avinashi Government Hospital and then to the Tirupur Government Hospital for postmortem. Rescue work was completed around 8.30 am. Police had blocked the stretch on the Avinashi-Salem NHAI road and diverted vehicles.

With the help of two earth movers, the bus was taken to a spot and 3 km away. The public were seen at the spot clicking photographs.

Tirupur city police commissioner Sanjay Kumar said the truck driver who was arrested by the Tamil Nadu police said he had dozed off and lost control of the vehicle. The rear tyres were damaged after they hit the centre median.

The container truck driver was booked under Sections 279 (rash driving or riding on a public way), 337 (causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others) and 304 A (causing death by negligence) of the Indian Penal Code.

V K Sreekandan, Palakkad MP, D Balamurali, Palakkad collector, G Shiva Vikaram, Palakkad superintendent of police, and other police officials were at the accident spot coordinating the rescue work.

Kerala transport minister A K Saseendran and agriculture minister V S Sunilkumar visited the spot and consoled relatives of the deceased. The transport minister announced a solatium of 10 lakh to the family of each passenger and 30 lakh each to the drivers.

Officials from the regional transport office visited the accident spot and checked the KSRTC bus and the container truck.

Following the postmortem, the bodies were handed over to the family members.

Title: Jaipur: Prostitution racket busted: 17 women, 10 men held
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The Jaipur rural police have arrested 27 persons involved in a prostitution racket in Jamwa Ramgarh police station area. Ten men and 17 women have been arrested. They all are from Rajasthan and were running the racket in houses on NH-148. The policemen posed as customers and once the prostitution racket was confirmed, raided the houses.

The accused were arrested from Raisar police station area by a team of around 50 police personnel. SP Jaipur rural, Shankar Dutt Sharma said, “For last six months, we have been running an operation to curb all criminal activities on the highways. We received information that there was a sex racket operating in our jurisdiction and formed a team to get to the bottom of the matter.”

The arrested persons are from neighbouring districts including Sawai Madhopur, Karauli, Alwar and others. They all are aged between 20 to 30 years. “After receiving information, we sent few of our personnel to the place where prostitution was happening. They posed as clients and once money exchanged hands for a woman sex worker, we raided the houses and arrested all those who were present at the time of the raid,” added the SP. According to officials, the sex workers charged around Rs 500 to Rs 1,000 per client and cops are also looking for more people involved in the racket.

Elaborating further, the official added, “This is one of the biggest rackets that we have uncovered in over a year and there are high chances that more people are involved in it. We are investigating further to find how the women were brought into prostitution. There is a network working here through which the women are brought here. Money is the only motivation and most likely all of them are from poor families.”

The arrested persons have been booked under the relevant sections of IPC.

Title: Cyberdome effective in securing cyberspace: CAG
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Though the state police lost face for lack of transparency, fund diversion and out-of-the-way procurements, the only silver lining for it in the comptroller and auditor general ( CAG ) report is the pat on the back for intervention in cyberspace through the Cyberdome project .

The CAG report observed that the Cyberdome, till January 2019, had monitored and reported for further action 120 data breaches, about 50 online frauds, 50 online sexual violence, 10 women-safety issues, about five instances of child abuse/pornography, 25 instances of terrorist activities, and about seven instances of ransomware. “The activities of Cyberdome in preventing online frauds through testing for vulnerabilities in banking applications are praise worthy,” CAG observed.

The audit found that Cyberdome detected vulnerabilities in four out of 10 tested banking applications, after which RBI and National Payment Corporation of India directed the banks concerned to withdraw the applications and recommended implementation of multi-factor authentication process to prevent frauds.

The audit report further said that various other activities, including conduct of child safety awareness programme for students, parents and teachers, developing and rolling out applications on creating traffic awareness and cybersecurity among students and conduct of workshops for police cybertraining throughout the state, have all helped Cyberdome earn the ISO 27001:2013 certification for law enforcement units, and this is commendable.

Cyberdome was conceived in 2014 as a cyber centre of excellence in cybersecurity as well as technology augmentation for effective policing. It is a collaborative effort of public-private partnership by different stakeholders in cybersecurity and handling of cybercrimes. Cyberdome has been emulated in other states like Assam, Punjab and Tamil Nadu and more states have evinced interest in this model for cybersecurity.

The Cyberdome, currently headed by ADGP (administration) Manoj Abraham, is manned by 16 personnel drawn from various wings of the police department. Besides, services of about 600 cybersecurity experts and 20 organisations are also availed.

Title: People can track waste pick-up vehicles soon
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Jaipur: Residents of city will be able to track the location of garbage pick-up vehicles on their mobile phones within two weeks.

BVG Company, responsible for door-to-door garbage collection in the city, is developing an application for the citizens called Nuevas GPS system which at present is just for official use. Manager of BVG Company Rajesh Chaudhary said, “At present, this application is for the official use but within two weeks, we will launch it for people. Officials of Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) are able to keep a track on any garbage collecting vehicles in the city. But when this application will be made available for the general public, they would be able to see the location of the vehicles in their ward,” said Chaudhary.

As per the information provided, people would have to register their house through KYC on the application and then they would be able to locate the vehicles in their ward. “When the address is registered, people would be able to check the time when the vehicle arrived in their ward. They will be able to contact the driver as well. This application will work in any part of Jaipur but only for the ward their house is registered not in any other ward. This is done to avoid unnecessary traffic on the website or application,” said Rajesh. JMC officials say it is necessary to have this application as it will help people to keep tab over the vehicles’ activity.

“We receive many complaints about the irregularity of the vehicles in their wards. Many times, drivers deliberately leave many lanes in an area but this application will curtail all such issues as people will directly contact the driver,” said a JMC official anonymously.

Title: ‘Agri board not allowed to fix cashew rates’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Saligao: The Goa State Agricultural Marketing Board has no powers to fix the rate of cashews, or any notified commodities, said board chairman Prakash Velip, at a press conference on Wednesday.

Raising concerns over the rates of cashewnuts, Velip had recently said the government needs to frame a policy for fixing cashew rates.

Velip further told the reporters that a detailed project report (DPR) for upgrading four market yards — Sakhali, Mapusa, Curchorem and Margao — is being prepared by agri consultanc agency NABCONS.

“By the end of March, the work of agri bazaar in Ponda, costing around Rs 32 crore, will be undertaken under Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana ,” Velip said.

He said the improvement of another sub-yard in Pernem, costing around Rs 3 crore, will be complete by March, and added that an additional Rs 3 crore would be utilised to upgrade and spruce up sub-yards in Canacona.

Title: Nagpur doctor to lead non-political SMSN forum’s state body
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: After the politically active faction of Save Merit Save Nation (SMSN) forum formed its state-level body two months ago, the non-political faction also announced its state-level executive body on Tuesday.

Dr Sanjay Deshpande from Nagpur will be state president of this body, while Shreekrishna Buty will be working president. Dr Anup Marar took over as general secretary.

With Dr Anil Laddhad being state president of the politically active faction, now both factions of SMSN are having leadership from Nagpur and office-bearers from other cities across Maharashtra.

Marar claimed that this faction affiliated to the Save Merit Foundation is the ‘original group’ and it has all legal rights on the intellectual property like logo. “We have taken strong objection to the misuse of our logo. The SMSN logo is intellectual property of Save Merit Foundation and can only be used by its affiliate organizations which agree to its core non-political non-communal and social sensitization movement ideology,” said Marar.

The logo of SMSN was designed by Shree Graphics and officially purchased by Save Merit Foundation, he added.

The newly formed SMSN group’s state body will soon be meeting chief minister and all guardian ministers of Maharashtra to highlight the need to limit reservation within 50%.

Members of the new body include Utpala Mulawkar as state coordinator and Shrirang Choudhary as legal adviser. Sachin Poshattiwar will be treasurer with Rajesh Atal and Roy Thomas as joint treasurers. Anand Dave (Pune), Pramod Pusrekar (Beed), RG Chandak (Nagpur) and Ravindra Halsagikar (Solapur) will be vice-presidents. Ashutosh Gotey (Nagpur), Sachin Wazalvar (Chandrapur), Mahesh Moharir (Aurangabad) and Ankit Kane (Pune) will serve as secretaries.

State regional coordinators are Abhijeet Ambhaikar — West Vidarbha, Prashant Aarwey — East Vidarbha, Aabha Nemivant — Marathwada and Vijay Datar — Mumbai.

Sanjay Heda, Manoj Mujumdar and Pranesh Yevatikar are conveners of government employees cell, while Aparna Ranadive will look after medical admission cell. Brijesh Segan, Uday Maha, Aarti Laddha, Santosh Ranjalkar, S Soni, Kamalkishor Agrawal, Praveen Kulkarni, Parmeshwar Pathak, Devendra Muley, Pappu Chhangani, Shubhangi Mundhada, Vidyut Khandewale, Hemant Pathak, Deepak Sakhare, Amit Pendharkar, Yashashree Madiwale, Deepak Saraswat and Vikram Mardhekar are the executive committee members.

Title: Former CJI addresses law students in Nagpur
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Nagpur: Former Chief Justice of India, Justice Dipak Misra, addressed students at Maharashtra National Law University, (Nagpur) on Friday about ‘Fundamental Duties in Contemporary Era’.

In his speech, justice Misra emphasized the importance of fundamental duties enshrined in the Constitution and said that it is obligatory for all the citizens to know the fundamental duties which are the command of the Constitution to be followed by all.

Justice Misra referred several duties enshrined in Article 51A of the Constitution such as Article 51A(h) which says that every citizen needs to develop scientific temper, humanism and the spirit of inquiry and reform. He further emphasized on Article 51A(e) which demands that citizens promote harmony and the spirit of common brotherhood amongst all the people of India transcending religious, linguistic, regional or sectional diversities; to renounce practices derogatory to the dignity of women. He lamented that peace and prosperity can be brought in the country by following this duty imposed by the constitution. He also suggested that students of law must inquire, investigate and not be guided by any superstition.

The visiting dignitaries also released Volume 2 of Contemporary Law and Policy Review, the flagship student journal of the university. Prof. (Dr) Vijender Kumar, Vice Chancellor welcomed and felicitated the guest in the presence of Justice V S Sirpurkar, former judge, Supreme Court of India, Justice R C Chavan, former judge, Bombay High Court, Suprama Misra along with students, faculty and administrative staff of MNLU, Nagpur.

Title: Rally to improve green cover held at Charminar
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Hyderabad: An awareness rally was organised at Charminar by Telangana Rashtra Samiti Vidyardi (TRSV) in collaboration with Green India Challenge on Thursday. The rally was aimed at creating awareness among students and citizens about the important of planting trees.

TRS activists, students took out the rally from Charminar to Gulzar Houz. Mir Qurram Ali, TRSV GHMC Coordinator, told TOI that they would visit schools, colleges and government offices to plant saplings and generate awareness on the importance of green cover.

“We have organised an awareness rally with the slogan: ‘Each One Plant One’ and will plant saplings on the occasion of CM K Chandrashekar Rao’s birthday on February 17. Saplings will be planted from tomorrow onwards,’’ Quram Ali said.

Title: 60% of all rape accused persons are friends of survivors: Goa police
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Goa police statistics state that since 2017, over 60% of persons accused of rape were friends of the survivor . Data available till 2019 shows that out of 205 rape cases, registered in Goa, 128 of them were committed by a friend of the survivor. Apart from the ‘friends’, Goa police also booked family members, teachers, and other relatives. In fact, in only 9 cases was the accused rapist unknown to the victim.

The force also said that out of these 128 cases, 53 were initially registered as elopement before being converted into rape case. Also, 47 of the cases involved the “pretext of marriage”.

IGP Jaspal Singh told TOI that in rape cases, accused persons are both from Goa and outside the state. In 2017 and 2018, a British national was arrested for rape each year, and in 2019, an Iranian was arrested.

While rape cases are reported both soon after the crime and days later, police say that cases registered beyond 96 hours after the incident becoome difficult for police to probe and collect vital evidence.

Singh said that in rape cases, the accused is usually a known person, and parents need to be aware about who their children are friends with.

Over the past few years, Goa police also registered various cases involving crimes against women — kidnapping, eve-teasing, marital abuse, dowry death, immoral trafficking, etc. While chargesheets have been filed in many cases, most are pending trial. Some have even been closed due to lack of evidence.

The past five years have seen 230 cases of crimes against women remain undetected.

Goa police said they are trying to solve the undetected cases. “From time to time, directions are given to all investigating officers to conduct thorough and speedy investigations and to make sincere efforts to solve the cases,” chief minister Pramod Sawant said in a written reply tabled in the assembly.

Title: Calcutta University shuts door on Aishe Ghosh but anti-CAA fight continues
Content:
Aishe Ghosh walks with intellectuals and artists from College Street to Shyambazar

KOLKATA: Calcutta University on Thursday denied permission to JNU student union president Aishe Ghosh to attend a programme on the campus organised by students and a section of staff to protest against “commercialisation of education” and to advocate autonomy, free speech and secularism.This, after police denied Ghosh permission to take out a march in Durgapur, her hometown, on Wednesday.Aishe’s bloodied image became the face of the anti-CAA movement after she was attacked by masked goons on the JNU campus on the night of January 5, leaving her with a gash on her forehead from repeated rod blows and a fractured arm. Many of the attackers are yet to be hauled up.The gates of Calcutta University on College Street were kept closed on Thursday, and even students from affiliated colleges were barred from entering. But the shut door could not deter the organizers.Faculty members, non-teaching staff and students, some of whom are members of Left-leaning unions, decided to hold the programme outside the main gate. Explaining their reason for not allowing Ghosh on their campus, a senior official at the university said outsiders could not be granted permission to hold programmes inside the campus.“We have ordered security personnel to shut the gates and allow people inside only after checking their identity cards,” said the official.Ghosh expressed her dismay at being stopped from entering the campus. “A university is a place for exchange of ideas and counterpoints. But some regimes want to muzzle free speech on campuses because they are scared of the power of students. Trinamool is doing in Bengal what Modi and Shah are doing in Delhi. But I am happy to see how people are fighting against these regimes on the street,” she said.The youngster compared the movement against CAA and NRC to the freedom struggle against the British. “Freedom did not come in a week or a year. It took us several decades and sacrifices. Even Gandhi and Bhagat Singh were called anti-nationals. So I don’t mind being termed ‘anti-national’ by the RSS. But what is important is that we must see whether we are ready to fight on the streets against this authoritarian regime. They will try to divide us on religious lines so that we don’t unite against them but we must continue our fight,” said Ghosh.Later in the day, Ghosh, along with several intellectuals, Left Front leaders and artists, walked in a rally, named ‘Jana Gana Mana’, from College Street to Shyambazar.

Title: Work of Jaipur Municipal Corporation Heritage office yet to start
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Jaipur Municipal Corporation

JAIPUR: Work for the new office of the Jaipur Municipal Corporation , Heritage is yet to start, which may cause adjustment issues due to space crunch.

As Jaipur has now been divided into two corporations, JMC , Greater will function from Lal Kothi office and Heritage will function at the old police headquarters near Hawa Mahal .

The building of the JMC Heritage has to be renovated but the work hasn’t started and election for the new board is expected to be complete by April end. When the new board will be created, if the JMC Heritage building is not ready, both the municipal corporations will function from the Lal Kothi office.

A JMC official who did not wish to be named said that it seems the work of another office will take some time. Until then, both the municipal corporations will function from the Lal Kothi office.

“It would take another six months to complete the renovation work of the new office. The elections of the JMC will be held soon, after which there will be a space crunch at Lal Kothi office. We need two mayors’, two commissioners’, additional commissioners’ offices in the same building. In the last board, there were 20 committees of various departments and with two municipal corporations, there will be at least 40. How will they all be accommodated here?” said a JMC official on condition of anonymity.

Recently, authorities sanctioned Rs 7.7 crore for the renovation of the new Heritage office. As per department sources, there will be 80 rooms in the office. “The building is ready but it needs new doors, windows, whitewash, sewage, electricity, telephone lines, toilets etc. Work will start soon but it is expected to take at least six months to complete,” said a source.

Title: Rajasthan: Villagers attack officials, cops who went to nab poachers
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

The two poachers (centre) along with seized weapons in custody

JAIPUR: Four foresters and policemen were injured in an attack by villagers in Sawai Madhopur when a joint team went to nab suspected poachers in Jetpur village of Khandar Tehsil on Thursday.

On a tip off, the forest staff, along with a police team, reached the village around 4am and started a search operation to arrest the poachers whose images were captured in a trap camera after they hunted a Cheetal (spotted deer) in Ranthambore Tiger Reserve (RTR). According to an official, after one poacher was caught in the raid, the villagers pelted stones. As it was dark, police and forest department personnel were injured in the sudden attack. Sources said, police also opened fire in air in retaliation to keep attackers at bay. “After reaching the village around 4am, police gheraoed the village. The houses of the poachers were already zeroed in. The team started searching the houses. After one poacher was nabbed, the villagers started pelting stones,” said a source

As per the reports, assistant conservator of forest Arvind Kumar Jha and assistant forester Mukesh Gurjar were injured along with policemen and forest staff. They are being treated at the district hospital.

Though the team returned bare-handed in the morning, two poachers surrendered around 3pm after officials put pressure on the locals. Ranthambore Tiger Project field director Manoj Parashar said, “A case has been registered under appropriate sections of Wildlife Protection Act, 1972.”

Title: Goa government organises hackathon on trash for youth
Content:
Students will have access to nine mentors who will assist the teams in fine-tuning their projects

PANAJI: Budding innovators from educational institutions in the state will vie for a chance to help Goa Waste Management Corporation tackle the state’s burgeoning trash. Goa State Innovation Council is organising a two-day hackathon from February 18 where teams from different colleges will ideate and offer solutions for four problems — segregation of waste, removal of trash from water bodies, disposal of LEDs and bulbs, and disposal of sanitary pads and diapers.According to the department of science and technology, 19 teams from technical as well as non-technical institutes have signed up to take a shot at hacking away at Goa’s waste.“We will see the ideas. If two ideas are similar, we will combine them to form one group. On the second day, eight teams will be selected to give a presentation about their innovation,” said an official with the council.Goa Waste Management Hackathon 2020 is an initiative of the state government to provide students a platform to solve challenges faced in solid waste management and disposal in Goa and thus incubate the culture of innovation with problem solving mindset among students.Students will have access to nine mentors who will assist the teams in fine-tuning their projects.“The winner of the hackathon will get access to funding and government support to implement their projects on the ground and scale up. As a start, the most innovative project will work with Goa Waste Management Corporation,” the official said.Goa Waste Management Corporation has identified four major challenges that urban and local bodies face while collecting and processing solid waste in the state — segregation of dry waste and elimination of moisture from domestic and commercial waste along with disposal of lighting equipment, sanitary pads and diapers.Interestingly, most of the teams have shown interest in the fourth category, which deals with removal of waste from water bodies.The state innovation council has partnered with AccelerateSD Foundation, Hyderabad to guide the students and even after the hackathon, the winner of the contest will get the opportunity to continue with the accelerator.

Title: Nagpur: Recharging groundwater only long-term solution to fluorosis, says experts
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

CS Gundewar felicitating Deepak malpe

NAGPUR: Exposure to high concentrations of fluoride through drinking water is the reason for incidence of fluorosis in Vidarbha. It is made worse because we are drawing groundwater from greater depths that has higher fluoride content.

Terming defluorination techniques such as Reverse Osmosis (RO) as temporary fixes, Deepak Malpe, who has been heading research on fluoride for two decades, emphasized that recharging groundwater sources with rainwater was the only affordable and long term solution.

“Water coming from dug wells in Vidarbha has fluoride content anywhere between 0.08 and 7.7 mg/litre. Borewell water has 0.13 to 19 mg/litre fluoride which was way higher than permissible limit of 0.7 mg/litre. If we recharged borewells with fresh rainwater, fluoride-level can be decreased effectively,” Malpe said. Expensive and complex techniques like RO, activated alumina, and Nalgonda techniques were temporary solutions and not suitable for rural areas, he said.

Malpe heads Post Graduate Department of Geology at RTM Nagpur University. He delivered Shivani Ghosh memorial lecture organized by Indian Institute of Mineral Engineers (IIME) at Indian Bureau of Mines (IBM) on Wednesday. CS Gundewar, controller general (retd.), IBM, and president of IIME, Nagpur chapter, presided over the function. Indira Ravindran, controller general of IBM and G Vidya Sagar, additional director general and HOD of Central Region Geological Survey of India, were special guests.

Malpe presented alarming facts from his study that covered seven most affected tehsils of Yavatmal and Chandrapur districts.

“Over the years, rural population too has become highly dependent on groundwater. Tooth and bone decay are known forms of fluorosis, but it also has hazardous effects on renal, reproductive, neurological, endocrine, and development systems. Non-skeletal fluorosis can be carcinogenic and may cause cancer,” he said.

Those living in cities and getting drinking water from borewells should eat calcium-rich food, Malpe stated, adding that they too should install rainwater harvesting systems to recharge borewells at the earliest.

Title: MLA Vikas Kumbhare, NVCC want Duronto operates to stay at main station : Nagpur
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

BJP MLA from Central Nagpur Vikas Kumbhare

Nagpur: The Nagpur division of Central Railway’s decision to operate 12289-90 Nagpur-Mumbai-Nagpur Duronto Express from Ajni has come in for sharp criticism from railway users’ body and public representatives.

BJP MLA from Central Nagpur Vikas Kumbhare said the decision is not in the interest of people, especially traders who prefer this train due to few stoppages and convenient timings. “From Nagpur, it benefits four assembly segments from the city. On Monday, I will submit my representation to the divisional railway manager (DRM),” he said.

“Many traders have complained to me demanding to roll back the train from platform number 8 as earlier. It is convenient for them to reach Santra Market side of the station instead of Ajni where there is always logjam while arriving and boarding the train,” Kumbhare said.

“If the railways wants to operate more trains from Ajni, it should start with passenger trains having less occupancy,” he said.

On Wednesday, president of passenger users’ body Rail Yatri Sangh (RYS) Brijbhushan Shukla submitted a memorandum to DRM Somesh Kumar demanding operation of the train from Nagpur. “Diverting such premium trains from Ajni will not only reduce importance of Nagpur station but is also inconvenient to passengers,” he said in a release.

From February 9, Central Railway suddenly started operating the train from Ajni for three months till May. Due to washable apron work on platform number 1 at the main station, Duronto, which used to run from home platform number 8 on Santra Market side, was temporarily shifted to Ajni from January 8. However, even as work on apron has been completed, the train has been shifted to Ajni.

Shukla said separate DRMs promised to give facelift to Ajni by constructing two more platforms, two pitline FOBs, better passenger amenities etc. However, over the years, Ajni was not developed despite increase in the number of trains.

“Now, plans are afoot to develop Ajni as an inter-model station by ministry of road transport and Central Railway. However, this project will take at least 5 years to complete. Till then, we can’t afford to run premium trains from Ajni,” said Shukla.

Railway committee convener of Nag Vidarbha Chamber of Commerce (NVCC) Pratap Motwani too opposed the move. “The railway officials are citing clashing of Duronto timings with Sevagram Express and other trains, but how far trains are punctual?”

“Ajni station is congested and lacks waiting rooms, proper toilets, food stalls, a necessary ramp, lifts, escalators, security, facility to shift differently abled passengers and sufficient parking. Passengers are facing a lot of problems. We will write to the railways and meet highways minister Nitin Gadkari on the issue,” he added.

Title: Justice Haq’s transfer: Lawyers to restart protest from Monday
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

Nagpur: After their request to stop justice Zaka Haq ’s transfer to Bombay High Court ’s Aurangabad bench was rejected, lawyers from the city have decided to restart their protests from Monday. Chief Justice (CJ) Pradeep Nandrajog had rejected request made by the lawyers through High Court Bar Association (HCBA) for cancelling transfer orders of the judge who they termed as the most upright, honest and dedicated. Currently, justice Haq is on a long leave till further notice and hadn’t joined the new posting at Aurangabad, as per the lawyers. TOI has been following the issue since January 21 when HCBA passed a resolution to protest the transfer. Well-known lawyer Shreerang Bhandarkar told media that they will be protesting with white ribbons on the first day that is on Monday. “It will be followed by pink and red ribbons on the next two days. Our protests would be completely peaceful till February 22,” he said. Claiming that he had support of most of the lawyers practicing in HC’s Nagpur bench and District and Sessions Court here, Bhandarkar warned that protests would be intensified after February 22. “Since the incumbent CJ is retiring on that date, we will move another resolution in HCBA for approaching the new CJ in this regard. We are hopeful our prayers would be heard. Otherwise, we will intensify the agitation and take steps like totally boycotting the court work,” Bhandarkar said. Other lawyers said sudden transfer of the sitting judge, who was doing wonders in the judiciary and also streamlining the system, was nothing but a big humiliation of entire legal fraternity of city. Due to him the entire system is working well and bail matters are listed quickly. Earlier, it used to take days for these cases to come up for hearing. His efforts have also led to bringing discipline in the judicial system, which was working at snail’s pace. Just because he had issued a contempt notice to a lawyer from a powerful group and also HC registrar, complaints were lodged against him they told TOI. The HCBA delegation led by senior counsel Shreehari Aney had met CJ Nandrajog in February first week with the resolution requesting cancellation of justice Haq’s transfer. The CJ defended his decision stating that he wanted a dynamic lawyer at the Aurangabad bench who could also effectively look after Public Interest Litigations (PILs), besides regular civil and criminal cases. Box — HCBA differs with lawyers’ stand The HCBA has clarified that they haven’t taken any decision to restart protest against justice Haq’s transfer and wouldn’t be part of the lawyers group which would be doing it from Monday. “It must be an individual decision of some lawyers, who are free to do it. We haven’t taken any such decision as of now,” secretary Prafulla Khubalkar said. On lawyers’ call to move another resolution and send it to new CJ after February 22, he stated that nothing of this sort has been discussed by the HCBA’s executive body.

Title: East-West Metro’s Sector V station inauguration: Engineers, technocrats elated as their ‘baby’ rolls out for first run
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Senior officials, including BEML CMD Deepak Kumar Hota, BEML AGM Arun Prasad and Hiatchi VP Manoj Kumar, after... Read More

KOLKATA: As the first train set off from the East-West Metro’s Sector V station on Thursday evening, a host engineers and technocrats burst into jubilation, ostensibly elated that years of toil finally paid off.

“We have come a long way and today, we are the happiest. We started with an older signalling technology. But after the delay in route realignment, we could introduce the world-class communication-based train control system (CBTC) in the East-West Metro,” said Manoj Kumar, vice-president, Hitachi (sales).

Ushering in a new-era of technology for public transport, East-West Metro is being driven by an integrated CBTC and the automatic train control management system (TCMS), which will facilitate movement of trains with a frequency of 90-100 seconds. The Italy-based Ansaldo, which has designed and installed CBTC in East-West Metro, is owned by Hitachi. A team of officials from Hitachi took East-West Metro’s first post-commissioning ride on Thursday.

The other excited team leader on board the first train was Deepak Kumar Hota, chairman and managing director of BEML. “I have an emotional connect with Kolkata because my wife, Shiela, is from this city. She is thrilled we have provided world-class coaches to Kolkata’s second Metro, which unfortunately has taken three decades to start,” said Hota, who heads the Bengaluru-based PSU, which has manufactured the hi-tech train sets with body shell of cars, made of stainless steel. The lightweight, highly energy-efficient trains are monitored and selectively controlled by a microprocessor-based train control and management system (TCMS). “So, BEML has been responsible for most of the technological support and the nitty-gritty, like training the drivers in CBTC. East-West has become our baby ,” said Arun Prasad, assistant general manager, BEML.

Among the others who was jubilant that their “baby” took its first step in public was Biswanath Deewanji, chief engineer , Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation (KMRC). The man, who supervised the first piling work for the elevated viaduct in front of Shyamali housing complex in Salt Lake, maintains a low profile, even though he has seen the project through all its crises, including the tunnelling disaster at Bowbazar last August. All he said was, “Yes, I am happy that East-Metro has started rolling. Still remember 14 April, 2009, when the first piling work began. It has taken 11 years for the 5km stretch to take shape.”

Title: Calangute: ‘Aguada museum to be opened by December’
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Minister for ports, Michael Lobo.

CALANGUTE: The restored and renovated ‘Fort Aguada Heritage Jail and Museum’ will be thrown open by December this year, said minister for ports, Michael Lobo .

Talking to reporters at the former Central Jail during an inspection visit on Thursday, he said the museum would showcase the lives of freedom fighters, many of whom were jailed there. “The Goa Tourism Development Corporation (GTDC) is working with the Freedom Fighters Association to draw up the list of freedom fighters and to get their statues made,” he said.

Besides statues, there will also be paintings, murals, sound and light shows, a cafeteria and an open- air exhibition and performance area for art shows and music events, with a capacity for 160 people.

“Because this is in Calangute constituency, We want a small section on the life and times of Manohar Parrikar, as his ancestral house is in this constituency(Calangute). When I became MLA in 2012, I came to know that a new Central Jail was being built at Colvale and this would be closed down. There were plans to lease it out to a hotel, but I suggested to Parrikar, when he was CM, that it should be converted into a museum. He agreed,” Lobo said.

The museum will also have a section devoted to the Pinto revolt, said to be the first rebellion against Portuguese rule, as the leaders of the revolt, from the Pinto clan, were from Candolim, Lobo said.

Tourists visiting the museum will have to pay Rs 50 as entry fee. Lobo said after the jail museum work is completed, other parts of Fort Aguada, like the dilapidated gallows and bastions facing the Mandovi river and sea would also be restored.

“I appeal to the government to restore the other forts in Goa. We had made a commitment that we would restore this fort and convert the jail into a museum and we have kept our word,” he said.The work on the museum, at a cost of Rs 25 crore, has been undertaken by GTDC and is being funded by the central government through its Swadesh Darshan scheme. The GTDC has roped in Mumbai-based architects Darashaw and Co and Panjim-based heritage architect Ketak Nachnodkar to oversee the work which is being executed by Bagkiya Construction.

Title: BS Yediyurappa: Farmers meet with CM BS Yediyurappa, demand loan waiver
Content:
CM BS Yediyurappa

BENGALURU: In preparations for the state budget, chief minister BS Yediyurappa met with representatives of the farming community, who placed a series of demands to alleviate their plight.Statewide association of farmer unions presented an 18-point agenda at the three-hour meeting. One demand is to urge the Centre to recall the controversial Seeds Bill of 2019. The bill attracted much debate since it could corporatise seed distribution.Farmers also wanted a commitment from the government to waive loans up to Rs 1 lakh per farmer, a promise Yediyurappa had made. This is in addition to the coalition government’s loan waiver scheme."Whether Yediyurappa will abide by the loan waiver promise he made when he was CM for three days remains to be seen. He did not make any commitment [on Thursday]. We would like clarity on this," said farmers’ representative Kodihalli Chandrashekar.Farmers also demanded the CM allocate "substantial sums" for irrigation, increase the height of Almatti Dam, use excess Godavari river water in Kalyana-Karnataka districts and ensure construction of the Mekedatu balancing reservoir.The CM is said to have urged farmers to have faith in him and promised them priority in his budget. But he also admitted he cannot "fulfil" all their demands due to financial constraints and especially since 80% of the budget goes towards paying salaries and commitments of the government. This leaves only 20% for new schemes, Yediyurappa said.The CM later told reporters: "It was a fruitful meeting and I will try my best to accommodate their demands."Meanwhile, the much-hyped Israel model of farming, mooted by the previous coalition government, appears to have been renewed by the Yediyurappa government. The project suffered a setback after the Kumaraswamy-led coalition government fell in June 2019. Agriculture department officials now say the stage is finally set for the project to take off. The department has already tied up with four agriculture and two horticulture universities and has demanded Rs 300 crore for the project in the budget.

Title: Kerala Police’s CIMS gets CAG thumbsdown
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Inspector general Vijay Sakhare describe the functioning of the Cyberdome

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: While police are already under fire for behaving as if the established norms of selection of private agencies are not applicable to the force, a project that has been launched with much fanfare is in the thick of controversies for choosing a private technological partner in a non-transparent manner.

The Central Intrusion Monitoring System (CIMS), one of the projects of police noted by CAG with adverse comments in its audit report, was embroiled in controversy since the day of initiation. All kinds of electronics security and system integrators association (AKESSIA), which is the statewide association of electronic security and system indicators, had approached chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan against the arbitrary way in which police and Keltron had picked a company as the authorized vendor for surveillance equipment for CIMS project. “The company, Galaxon, has no previous experience or service in the field of CCTV camera or security systems. It is an organisation which cannot provide any service in this segment in a state like Kerala,” the representation given by AKESSIA to the chief minister said.

The CAG report had made clear remarks that there is an unholy nexus between police officials, Keltron and several vendors. “The audit observed that contrary to the reasons adduced by the state police chief to the government of Kerala justifying award of work to Keltron, in at least four instances, there was clear nexus between officers of police department, vendors and total service provider (TSP) Keltron in fixation of prices resulting in pecuniary loss to the scheme,” it said.

The AKESSIA further said that they have almost 5,000 such vendors registered under it and they should also be given opportunity to participate in the project. However, deepening the mystery, an RTI query to police had ruled out that it had not entered into any agreement with any private company for setting up the CIMS project. “The company has its representatives in the CIMS control room functioning at the police headquarters. Police may not have directly entered into any agreement with the company and it may be through Keltron, but it is too technical to cite that police and the company are not related in any manner,” police department sources said.

Launched as a joint initiative of the state police and Keltron, the CIMS was announced last month with a claim of being the country’s first state-of-the-art electronic asset monitoring facility that will not only alert police if an intrusion takes place, but also send accurate location and visuals from the location within seven seconds of an intrusion. Police had announced that the facility can be utilized by PSUs, private business houses, organisations and also individual houses across the state, for a monthly fee. With the CAG report making scathing remarks of having unholy nexus between police, Keltron and vendors, the CIMS also would be soon under scanner, sources added.

Title: Tamil Nadu Budget 2020: Tamil Nadu tops in unemployment rate, may need course correction
Content:
