It is equally unfair that the speaker failed to expunge the comments from the assembly records,” he said.

Anbalagan insisted that the speaker expunge disrespectable remarks on members of opposition parties made by the ruling party members from the records and urged him to initiate action against Johnkumar for acting in an indisciplined manner during the proceedings.

Members of some WhatsApp groups came down heavily on Johnkumar for his action when they were deliberating on important issues like Citizenship Amendment Act, National Register of Citizens and National Population Register and declaring the fag-end of Cauvery delta – Karaikal district – a special protected agricultural zone during the session.

Johnkumar was elected from Nellithope assembly constituency in 2016. He resigned to enable V Narayanasamy, who was elected the Congress legislature party leader, to contest the bypoll and retain the chief minister’s post. Johnkumar was rewarded with a party ticket to contest the bypoll from Kamaraj Nagar in 2019 when V Vaithilingam resigned and successfully contested the 2019 parliamentary polls. Johnkumar won the bypoll defeating All India NR Congress candidate S Bouvanesvarane.

Title: Civic chief orders probe into Chandanwadi revamp delay
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Mumbai: The BMC commissioner has ordered an inquiry into the inordinate delay in reconstruction of the Chandanwadi crematorium .

Sources said the commissioner was shocked to learn the BMC has been dragging its feet for over two years in finalising the type of furnace to be installed at the crematorium. The Colaba advanced locality management has held 60 meetings with various civic officials, including additional municipal commissioners, but to no avail. “There has been an unforgivable delay in restoration,” aid Praveen Pardeshi, the civic chief.

Following the inquiry, those responsible will be suspended, said sources, adding if AMCs are to be blamed, a complaint would be made with the government.

The crematorium, one of the oldest, caters to A, B and C wards. In 2017, the BMC’s structural audit had declared it “dangerous for human movement”. In October 2017, a slab collapsed. Since then, two halls are off limits for last rites that are performed in the lobby; it is in a poor condition. CALM’s Renu Kapoor said BMC’s apathy was shocking.

Title: A teacher’s gift: 5 cents each for four students
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

KC Rajan

KANNUR: A teacher should be able to grasp the untold miseries of his students and act accordingly. His job is not restricted to just teaching lessons but to know and support students in all possible ways. It was this realization that prompted K C Rajan , a high school teacher near Kayaralam in Kannur ’s Mayyil panchayat, to do something meaningful for his students.

Ahead of his retirement next month, he gave five cents of land each to four homeless students. During his 35-year teaching career, Rajan had witnessed many students and their miseries. Some of them were homeless, said Rajan, who works at Puzhathi GHSS in the suburbs of Kannur town.

“I recently traced the background of a Class VIII student, who was frequently absent in class. When I enquired the reason, I came to know that she did not have a house and her family led a miserable life,” he said. He thought of providing land to this student. After a consultation with his family, he decided to give five cents each to four students who were identified with the help of his family, including his wife E K Rethi.

One beneficiary is the girl from Puzhathi, while the others are from Mayyil. The identity of beneficiaries won’t be revealed. Our help should not make them feel they are inferior and so I thought we should not disclose their identities now, he said. However, title deeds would be formally handed over to their families at a function at Orappadi on February 24 by former chief minister Oommen Chandy. MP K Sudhakaran will hand over the first installment of financial assistance.

The five-cent plots, with 3m road were given from the share of his parental property and the registration was completed on Thursday. Rajan is an active leader of Kerala Pradesh School Teachers’ Association, a pro-Congress association of teachers. KPSTA has offered them aid to build houses. The plan is to give Rs 1 lakh each to the students and secure financial assistance under government schemes like Life Mission, Rajan said.

Title: Kerala HC slams attacks on Muthoot staff
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

KOCHI: The high court on Thursday ordered for stopping of talks being held between protesting employees of Muthoot Finance and its management in view of the attacks on employees at several places across the state. The court terms the attacks as ‘goondaism’.

Ordering the halting of talks being held following the court’s directive, Justice A Muhamed Mustaque said the attacks allegedly carried out by supporters of the employees on strike on other employees while the talks are going on amounts to arrogance. The court cannot countenance talks and attacks going on at the same time, the judge said.

The court is considering petitions filed by the management and employees willing to work seeking police protection. On Thursday, counsel representing the management and the willing employees cited attacks that occurred at Kochi , Kottayam, and Kattappana.

Following this, the court said the acts allegedly committed by the union equals to ‘goondaism’. The protesters are crossing all limits and innocent employees, including women, are being attacked on the streets.

Further, the court asked the state government what action was being taken against the protesters following the attacks. The government replied that cases have been registered. The court has scheduled a hearing after 10 days.

Title: Guv talks of Ramrajya in UP amid Oppn’s anti-CAA chant
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Members of Opposition led by Samajwadi Party hold placards on the first day of the state budget session in Luc... Read More

LUCKNOW: Governor Anandiben Patel ’s 50-minute speech at the opening of Uttar Pradesh government’s budget session on Thursday anchored on the commitment to usher in ‘Ramrajya’, amid mild slogan-shouting and waving of placards demanding withdrawal of the new citizenship law and against police high-handedness during the protests in many parts of the state .

In her uninterrupted speech, the governor highlighted the plans, programmes and achievements of the Yogi government, saying that her government was committed to usher in ‘Ramrajya’ in the state for peace, progress and welfare of all. The governor also read out couplets from the Ramayana, stressing that her government was dedicated for the welfare of the poor and weaker sections also.

Unlike past occasions, when the governor’s address was often interrupted by the Opposition, mainly the Samajwadi Party throwing paper balls and missiles towards the chair, on Thursday no such scenes were witnessed. Though the Opposition did jump into the Well of the House carrying placards, but did not try to force its way towards the chair.

The governor used facts and figures to justify how her government had brought law and order under control, assisted farmers financially, introduced the police commissioner system and built new roads and expressways. The speech of the governor, which is prepared by the state government and sent to the Raj Bhawan for the governor to read out before the joint session, sounded a compilation of the plans and programmes of almost all the state government departments.

The governor, while highlighting a network of expressways in the state, said that the process for construction of the 667-km-long Ganga Expressway has also started.

The governor said that the state government has also set up 218 POCSO courts for speedy disposal of criminal cases and to ensure justice to the girl child.

“Keeping in view the target of 5.1% growth in the agriculture sector under the agriculture policy, there is a goal of producing 641.74 lakh metric tonne of foodgrains in the state in FY21,” she said.

The state government had at a recently concluded DefExpo 2020 signed MoUs of Rs50,000crore with various companies, said Anandiben.

Title: Coronavirus: Alappuzha student goes home, 2 still in hospital
Content:
Representational Image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: A medical student from Wuhan, who had tested positive for novel coronavirus COVID-19 ) infection and was undergoing treatment at the medical college hospital in Alappuzha, was discharged on Thursday.“The patient has been discharged as per the instructions from National Institute of Virology, Pune, as successive tests of this patient have been negative. However, the patient has been asked to be under home quarantine till this month-end,” said principal secretary (health) Rajan N Khobragade.However, the other two positive cases are continuing in the isolation wards of the hospitals in Thrissur and Kasaragod. “Their successive test results have to be negative and then only we can decide on discharging them. The results have to come from NIV, Pune,” said Khobragade.Even though the successive tests have proved considerable reduction in the infection in these two cases, we are waiting for confirmatory results from NIV, he added.The last result of Thrissur patient was negative while that of the Kasaragod patient was again positive. According to health department officials, the Kasaragod patient’s samples had been sent twice to Pune virology institute in the last few days, but, the results are yet to arrive. They said his health condition is perfect. The condition of the infected patient in Thrissur is also stable.On Thursday, 122 more persons, who were under home quarantine in the state, were given relaxation. At present, 2,397 people are under observation in the state of which only 22 are in hospitals. On Wednesday, 1,040 people were freed from home quarantine.The health department has made it clear that the people under observation will be given relaxation once their quarantine period of 28 days ends. However, for a few individuals, the quarantine days have been reduced to 14 days since they do not even have the slightest of symptoms.

Title: Pondicherry University student council’s strike against fee hike enters day 8
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

PUDUCHERRY: The fee revision committee of Pondicherry University (PU), which convened under the chairmanship of dean (management) K Chandrasekhara Raoon on Thursday could not resolve the impasse between the students’ council and the administration over the hike in fees of all programmes from academic year 2019-20.

The administration came forward for a partial rollback of the hike in fees for some programmes but the council was firm in its stance for a complete rollback of hike in fees for all the programmes. The committee will convene again on Monday to continue the talks.

Dean (physical, chemical and applied sciences) M S Pandian, dean (law) Mohanan Bhaskaran Pillai, professor and head (management studies) Chitra Sivasubramanian and finance officer (in-charge) Amaresh Samantaraya are the members of the committee, while the council is represented by its president Parichay Yadav and joint secretary Kuriakose.

The council launched an indefinite strike from February 6 demanding that the administration revoke the fee hike and extend free transportation for day scholars. The council said the university announced an exorbitant hike in fees for all programmes arbitrarily.

Yadav said the university hiked the total fees of all courses from the academic year 2019-20 by 88%, when compared to the total fees of all courses in 2018-19. He said the university hiked the fees per annum for MCA programme by 225%, MSc and MTech programmes by 182%, MBA by 124%, PhD programmes by 56% and five-year integrated programmes by 51% from the academic year 2019-20.

Meanwhile, communist leader and Rajya Sabha MP T K Rangarajan and Villupuram MP D Ravikumar wrote to Pondicherry University vice-chancellor Gurmeet Singh urging him to revoke the hike in fees. Rangarajan said at a time when the economy is slowing down and purchasing power of the common man is in a critical stage, the hike in fees will be ‘unbearable’ for the students and parents.

He said revoking the increase will go a long way in helping the students pursue higher education. “I would like to request you to call the students’ council and the stakeholders in this issue for a calm and meaningful discussion with a view to settling the matter,” he said.

Ravikumar termed the hike ‘atrocious’ and said the increase will hamper the dreams of rural and economically backward students. He said the hike has created outrage among students and disturbed tranquility in the campus.

“Nobody can accept the 225% hike in fees for computer science courses. You have increased about Rs 10,000 for MA, MCom and MSW programmes too. This is atrocious and will hamper the dreams of rural and economically backward students,” he said in the letter to Gurmeet Singh.

Title: Rs 12.8 lakh spent to dig up Rs 4.5 crore concretised road
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Costly affair: Road cutting done on the Kankanady Junction Road to Koti Chennayya Circle

MANGALURU: The concretisation of the Kankanady Junction Road (Father Muller Hospital) to Koti Chennayya Circle (Nandigudda) was taken up at a cost of Rs 4.5 crore. Locals are fuming as road cutting works have become the order of the day, even after concretisation. The Mangaluru City Corporation had promised to develop this road into a model one.

An RTI petition by A Rajaram, a senior citizen , revealed that the MCC, after the concretisation of the road, has spent Rs 12.8 lakh for road cutting at 20 places on this stretch. Rajaram told TOI, “After I received the RTI reply in November last year, I have noticed the road cutting has taken place in three more places with six holes. So much money is being wasted due to lack of planning by engineers. This is happening on a road that is just 1.4km in length. Frequent cutting will have an impact on the strength of the road, and the wear and tear on vehicles will be high. Before starting concretisation of any road, it is important to shift the utilities like electricity, water pipelines and underground drainage, which has not happened. So, whenever there is a leak, road cutting is being undertaken. I don’t think this practice of road cutting is followed anywhere else in India,” he said.

Currently road cutting works are in progress at three places. When contacted, an official from the engineering section of the MCC, said, the main water supply line passes through the centre of this road. When the road was concretised, the water pipeline was not shifted due to a lack of funds. Since the pipeline is old, leaks are bound to develop, and the only solution is to repair the same.”

In 2013, environmental activists had opposed cutting down of trees for road widening on this stretch, and had launched an online campaign called, ‘Save the last boulevard of Mangaluru’.

Title: Twitter handle to raise vigil, curb copying in UP Boards
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Week to go for UP Board exam

Lucknow: With less than a week left for the UP Secondary Education Board examinations, the state secondary education department on Thursday launched an exclusive twitter handle dedicated to the exams.

UP Board examinations will begin on February 18. A total of 56.1 lakh candidates have registered for the exams – 30.2 lakh in class X and 25.9 lakh in class XII.

The twitter handle, @upboardexam2020, launched by deputy chief minister and secondary education minister Dinesh Sharma, is an attempt to put an end to the copying menace with the help of technological advancement. “By launching the twitter handle, we have brought all the stakeholders – officials, teachers, students, and parents – under one platform. Using twitter services, real time monitoring of information related to board exams will be done,” Sharma said.

UP government has also set up a ‘live monitoring’ control room from where officials can keep an eye on any exam center across the state. This year, there are 7,784 centres across the state. The UP Secondary Education Board, which conducts the exam, debarred 433 centres following non-compliance of rules. All examination centres will be equipped with CCTV cameras to ensure cheating-free exams. For the smooth conduct of examinations, chief secretary RK Tiwari has directed all DMs to set up a committee with members from the education and police department.

Title: Rely on electoral roll of LS polls: Kerala HC
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

KOCHI: The Kerala high court on Thursday ordered the state election commission to prepare the electoral roll for local body elections this year on the basis of the electoral roll of last year’s Lok Sabha elections.

A division bench, comprising Chief Justice S Manikumar and Justice Shaji P Chaly, issued the order after considering two appeals filed by Sooppy Narikkatteri and N Venugopal.

The division bench directed that the electoral roll of Lok Sabha elections should be the basis as it has been updated on February 7 this year by adding new voters.

Through the judgment, the court has ruled against the state election commission’s decision to use the electoral roll of the local body elections of 2015 for the polls this year.

The appellants had pointed out that elections to the legislative assembly were held a year after the 2015 polls and Lok Sabha polls were held last year. The electoral roll was updated at the time of the Lok Sabha elections last year. If the local body elections this year are held by making the electoral roll of Lok Sabha elections last year as the basis, only new voters need to be added. Asking the new voters of last year’s Lok Sabha polls to register again for voting in the local body elections this year would cause unnecessary trouble to them. Many of the new voters are students and asking them to appear and participate in the verification process during the time of exams would cause undue hardships. It is not proper to put thousands of voters to trouble for the sake of convenience of a few officials of the election commission, the counsels had contended.

However, the election commission had opposed the argument and had informed the court that it is not practical to conduct local body elections on the basis of the electoral roll for Lok Sabha polls. Elections to the local bodies are held at ward-level whereas Lok Sabha elections were conduct at the polling-booth level. If the electoral roll of Lok Sabha elections is considered as the draft for local body elections, it would lead to mismatches, the election commission had submitted.

The court asked how a voter who had voted during the Lok Sabha polls last year be asked to register again for the local body elections this year when there is no dispute regarding his or her addition to the voters list. The appellants had pointed out that while the electoral roll for local body elections in 2015 had 2.52 crore voters, it had increased to 2.62 crore during the Lok Sabha elections last year. The division bench issued the order to consider the electoral roll of Lok Sabha elections last year as the draft for the electoral roll for local body elections this year after considering these submissions.

Title: Bundelkhand package ‘scam’ is another Vyapam, says Madhya Pradesh Congress
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Shobha Oza

BHOPAL: State Congress on Thursday said that the Kamal Nath government will fulfil its manifesto promise and get the Bundelkhand Package ‘scam’ probed by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW).

“In the Congress party’s assembly election manifesto, we promised to probe all scams of the previous government and punish those involved. The decision to probe Bundelkhand Package ‘scam’ by the EOW is the Congress government’s commitment to fulfil that promise,” said state PCC media department chairperson Shobha Oza.

Ruling party leaders on Thursday recalled that the former UPA government and with senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s efforts, the Bundelkhand Package was given in 2009 to develop the backward districts of Bundelkhand region spread over the states of Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh . “The total amount allocated to the Bundelkhand Package was Rs7,226 crore out of which MP received Rs3,860 crore,” state Congress leaders said.

“It was proposed that the massive fund would be used to develop the backward Bundelkhand districts of the state. But the previous BJP government’s faulty policies and corruption swallowed the entire fund. The corruption was exposed during the erstwhile Shivraj Singh Chouhan government’s tenure, but no serious probe was initiated because the whole scam took place under the protection of the regime”, said Oza.

“The scam was such that stones weighing 5 tonnes were shown to have been transported by two-wheelers,” Oza said.

“The registration numbers of vehicles used for transportation of these huge boulders happened to be of scooters and other two-wheelers, not trucks. Obviously, the scam occurred because the former state government had no intention of utilising the Bundelkhand Package. It has become another scam like the Vyapam , e-tender, Simhastha irregularities, illegal mining, sapling plantation and pension scam,” Oza added.

Title: Organisational churning in state BJP soon
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Lucknow: The drubbing in the Delhi assembly polls has stirred the UP BJP unit to go in for organisational reshuffle. The state unit will reconstitute its state executive, regional and district level committees — the three key organisational structures that will frame the party’s strategy for the 2022 UP elections.

BJP sources said the party thinktank will soon get into a huddle to reconstitute the state executive committee which currently comprises 16 vice-presidents, 8 general secretaries and 16 secretaries, besides organisational wings including SC/ST morcha, farmers and minority affairs unit.

The decision on organisational churning comes a month after Swatantra Dev Singh was re-elected unopposed as UP BJP chief.

Party sources said the existing state executive, which has a tenure of three years, is likely to undergo major changes in, keeping in mind caste and regional balances. The party is likely to replace some leaders in the state executive committee, who are serving as ministers or chairpersons of some government boards. This, sources said, will be in sync with party’s principle of one functionary-one post. “The proposed changes will be in accordance with the party’s principles and future strategies. We expect the changes to take place by February end,” said a senior BJP leader. He also confirmed that along with the churning in state executive, the party would reconstitute 91-member district level committees, of which 21 are office bearers and 70 are members.

The district and regional level committees will be reconstituted two months after the party elected its new district presidents along with booth and sector level functionaries, who gather ground level feedback about the prevailing political situation in the state.

Title: Vellore Rape Case: 17-year-old rapes, impregnates younger sister
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

Title: Happy Valentine's Day 2020 Memes, Jokes, Messages, Wishes, Images & Status: The funniest memes about Valentine's Day that will leave you in splits!
Content: The day of love is finally here and if we are being totally honest, it is not for everyone. While love birds are trying their best to find creative ways to pamper their partners, for some people it is a stark reminder that they are still very much single. Since the streets and restaurants are decked up with heart-shaped balloons and roses, Valentine’s day can be as cheesy and corny as it gets. So, whether you are waiting to shower the love of your life with romantic gifts or just want to grab a slice of pizza and chill at home, we can all use a funny meme or two about Valentine’s Day.The essence of Valentine's Day is all about expressing your love and doing beautiful things for the person you want to spend the rest of your life with. Different people have different ways of making their loved one feel special, while some choose to shower their special someone with thoughtful gifts, pamper them with surprises, go for special dinners, others just decide to spend quality time together, irrespective of the venue. Whatever you do or don't do, remember that there is no right or wrong way to celebrate the day of love. Do what comes naturally to you and you don't necessarily have to go overboard with your romantic gestures as even heartfelt feelings will do the job.We have rounded up the most hilarious quotes, messages and memes about Valentine’s Day. You can enjoy them by yourself, share it with fellow single people or send it to your loved ones. Couples, who do not believe in the concept of Valentine’s day can also relax and share a rib-tickling moment without dealing with the holiday pressure! Scroll down and take a look. You can thank us later!What did the flame say to his buddies after he fell in love? “I found the perfect match!”Did Adam and Eve ever have a date? No, they had an apple!What do you call two birds in love? Tweethearts!Knock, knock. Who's there? Peas. Peas who? Peas be my Valentine!On Valentine's Day , a man and his wife got up from bed. The wife told the man that she dreamt of him giving her a diamond ring on Valentine's Day. She asked him what it meant. He said, "You'll see tonight." That night he came home with a small package. Excited, his wife opened the package to find a book named "The Meaning of Dreams"How can you get arrested on Valentine's Day? For stealing someone's heart.What did the calculator say to the pencil? You can count on me.Knock knock. Who's there? Olive. Olive who? Olive you!What did the pencil say to the paper? "I dot my i's on you!"

Title: Police go for precautionary steps to keep lovebirds safe from moral cops
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Visakhapatnam: City’s love birds will be able to celebrate Valentine’s Day without the fear of the moral policing by right-wing organisations as the city police have decided to increase patrolling on Friday.

Speaking to TOI, ACP (east) J Kulasekhar said that precautions are being taken at locations such as parks and beaches in the city and action will be taken if someone tries to moral police or take the law into their own hands. “As part of our precautionary measures, we will deploy police personnel in plain clothes at major parks, beaches, the zoo, Kailasagiri, Kambalakonda eco-tourism park as well as entrances to major hotels,” Kulasekhar added.

Hotels and restaurants in the city are decked up in heart-shaped balloons to welcome in couples on the day of celebrating love.

Police sources said that Vizag has not witnessed violence or attacks of lovers during Valentine’s Day celebrations with the exception of a few incidents in parks and the beaches a couple of years ago. Suspecting that some groups might try to create disturbance and harass those celebrating the day by forcing them to marry or beat them up, the police has appealed to the public to not indulge in public display of affection and inconvenience others.

Meanwhile, leaders and activists of some saffron outfits are making plans to ‘instil fear among the youth for celebrating Valentine’s Day’. Members of the Jana Jagarana Samithi (JJS) led by its state convener, K Vasu have raised voice against V-Day celebrations and asked youngsters to pay homage to jawans who were martyred in a suicide attack in Jammu and Kashmir’s Pulwama district in 2019 instead of celebrating Valentine’s Day.

Title: Beware of fake dating platforms in Visakhapatnam: Police
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: This year’s run up to the Valentine’s Day saw cybercriminals creating fake dating websites in a bid to defraud people. Many youngsters in the city reported having received messages and e-mails asking them to subscribe to online dating platforms. Cybercrime police say that fraudsters have a field week in the run up to the day celebrating love and romance targeting lonely singles.

N Ravi Kumar, sub-inspector of cybercrime police informed, “A few days ago, a software professional from the city was duped of Rs 18 lakh on a fake dating platform.”

V Gopinath, inspector of cybercrime police station said that a Kolkata-based fake online dating platform duped 15 people from Visakhapatnam region.

Title: 37-yr-old arrested for cheating cop
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Srikakulam: A 37-year-old man was arrested on Thursday for posing as a police officer and cheating a sub-inspector on vacancy reserve by promising him a good posting . The accused is alleged to have taken Rs 4 lakh from this sub-inspector from Srikakulam for the posting.

The police have found that the accused has allegedly cheated a number of government servants and duped them of around Rs 70 lakh.

The accused— Rachapalli Srinu (alias) Mangali Srinu has 18 non-bailable warrants against him. A resident of Nallamda mandal in Anantapuram district, the non-bailable warrants pending against him are in Rayalaseema districts as well as Bengaluru in Karnataka.

Srinu is also alleged to be involved in cheating a teacher at Ragolu and two armed reserve constables.

When the police arrested him, he was carrying a handbook containing names and phone numbers of those targeted and Rs 50,000 in cash.

Speaking to the media, SP Ammireddy said that the accused, Srinu, was initially involved in chain-snatchings and robberies. He later changed his modus operandi and began targeting government servants. Ammireddy said that the accused would allegedly negotiate with the officials and get the deposit amounts through a gold finance company on a commission basis. He would allegedly steal SIM cards and use those to communicate with government officials.

The SP said that the accused is alleged to have been involved in 24 cases, of which are related to chain-snatchings and robberies. He is accused to have cheated five police personnel and one civilian.

The SP added that as per the details obtained from his handbook, the accused was planning to cheat 10 police personnel across AP and Telangana as well as a few civilians in Makkuva village and a teacher in East Godavari.

Title: Spit, pay Rs 300 fine at rly station
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The city’s railway authorities are taking measures to stop people from spitting in the railway station premises. In such an effort, caution boards and signs have been put up warning people with heavy penalties. “If any passenger is found violating the rule, a fine of Rs 300 will be imposed on them,” said a senior railway official.

RPF circle inspector TS Swamy said that according to latest instructions issued by the National Green Tribunal, the fine has been increased effective from February 10. RPF sources said that around Rs 30,000 has been imposed as fines on people responsible for littering the station premises included washrooms, drinking water spaces, chairs, stairwells and lifts.

Swamy further informed that 47 closed-circuit television cameras are active at the railway station. “In 2019, Rs 29,000 was collected as fine,” he said while adding that around Rs 15,000 of the total amount was collected from people found dumping debris on the premises of the railway station.

“We will keep a check on passengers in the station through our surveillance system. We appeal to the passengers and the staff to keep the station premises clean,” Swamy told TOI.

Meanwhile, a senior railway official from the commercial department said that vendors at all eight platforms have been asked to use of dustbins properly and alert railway teams if passengers are found disobeying rules.

Title: LRPV asks AP govt to pass resolution against NRC
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Visakhapatnam: While the state government is likely to launch the routine house listing and housing census for the 2021 census, activists of Loukika Rajyanga Parirakshana Vedika (LRPV) demanded on Thursday that the state government pass a resolution against NRC (National Register of Citizens) and CAA (Citizenship Amendment Act).

B Ganga Rao of CPI(M) said that the BJP government at the Centre is trying to introduce NRC in the name of National Population Register. “The state government should pass a resolution against NRC, NPR and CAA,” he said.

Other activists present said that the BJP government, under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi is trying to give citizenship on the basis of religion and divide India by forcibly implementing NRC and CAA.

States like Kerala, Telangana, Punjab and Rajasthan have already spoken against NRC, NPR and CAA, said the activists. “Why is the Andhra Pradesh government yet to oppose NPR and NRC?” they asked.

Title: Mock anti-hijack exercise at airport
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Battle-ready: Mock anti-hijack drill going on at Vizag airport

Visakhapatnam: In an effort to test the efficacy of contingency plans and procedures to deal with hijacking threats, an anti-hijack exercise was conducted by INS Dega at Visakhapatnam airport recently. In course of the exercise, a mock situation was created, which involved actions by various agencies including Marine Commandos (Marcos), Central Industrial Security Force (CISF), Airport Authority of India (AAI) and other state government agencies.

The mock situation was created using a naval Dornier aircraft for initiating coordinated action by all stakeholders from the Navy, the airport and other central and state government agencies. Upon completion of the exercise, a de-briefing was held and standard operating procedures were revalidated.

The anti-hijack mock drill is conducted at every Indian airport annually as mandated by the national civil aviation security programme with an aim to test the efficiency of the airport’s contingency plan and to familiarise all agencies about their respective responsibilities in a hijack situation.

Title: Website launched for Milan 2020
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The website of the multilateral maritime exercise— Milan 2020 was launched in Visakhapatnam by the command IT officer in the presence of Vice Admiral Atul Kumar Jain, flag officer commanding-in-chief of the Eastern Naval Command (ENC) and other flag officers of ENC.

The website— www.milan2020.org.in offers information about the exercise ’s schedule and facilitates the sharing of information with all participating countries.

The multi-lateral naval exercise is a congregation of littoral navies conducted biennially by the Indian Navy under the aegis of the Andaman and Nicobar Command since 1995.

Milan provides an opportunity for participating navies to come together to nurture stronger ties and foster a sense of cooperation.

This year, the Indian Navy is conducting this event at Visakhapatnam from March 18-27. Over 30 countries have already confirmed participation.

Title: Online portal aims to preserve art of weaving
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Weavers find a market: Scientist Dr Khadar Vali launches the Sankalpa website

Visakhapatnam: In an effort to promote handloom fabrics and handicrafts, Sankalpa Kalagramam — arts village located in Pedagadi village in Pendurthi mandal recently launched its e-commerce website. Dr Khadar Vali, an independent scientist launched the website.

The Sankalpa art village is aimed at creating a vision of sustainable living. The village works with more than 15 professional weavers and seeks to keep the art of weaving alive. Weavers across the country have been quitting the profession over the last few decades owing to a steep fall in demand.

The Sankalpa art village’s latest collection showcases ‘Aamram’— a kurta designed in the structure of the mango leaf. There are also clothes for infants made with cotton and natural dyes.

Apart from cotton and khadi fabric, showpieces and utilities made with palm tree wood, jewellery made from Ankudu wood are also made by the people working with Sankalpa. Currently, the products are sold among villagers and those around. With the website, the management believes that these products will reach far and wide. Speaking to TOI, Chalapati Rao, director of Sankalpa Kalagramam said, “We have displayed our finest designs made innovatively with natural-dyed handloom to promote sustainable fashion. With this, we aim to provide best quality products to consumers as well as revive many art forms.”

“We hold exhibitions in Hyderabad and Bengaluru to exchange and share ideas. The online platform will help us connect, reach and cater to needs of people from different areas,” added Rao.

The art village is known for its collection of hand-woven and naturally-dyed apparels. The pure ‘pattu’ for making sarees is procured from Chebrol and Pithapuram. After that, the yarn is dyed and woven into cloth. Herbal dyes such as manjista roots, turmeric rhizomes, pomegranate peels, eucalyptus bark and fenugreek seeds are used as natural colouring agents.

Plans are afoot to connect to open schools as well as other educational institutions which offer courses in textile making so that students can learn the art of weaving, natural dyeing and design.

Title: HC stays UP's recovery notice to Kanpur CAA protester
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: The Allahabad high court has stayed the recovery notice issued to a Kanpur man accused of destroying public properties during the anti-CAA protest in the city that began on December 19.

Providing an ad-interim protection to the petitioner identified as Mohammad Faizan, the bench of Justice Pankaj Naqvi and Justice Saurabh Shyam Shamshery stayed the notice issued by the additional DM saying tha the Supreme Court was already examining the legality of such orders .

Challenging the recovery notice issued to Faizan, his counsel pleaded that the recovery notice was issued by an ADM whereas the Supreme Court had unequivocally provided that such an order can be issued only by a serving or retried high court judge, or retired district judge as 'claims commissioner'. The bench directed the state government to file a counter-affidavit within a month. The court directed to list this case in the week commencing April 20, 2020 before the appropriate bench for the next hearing.

This will also be subject to the outcome of the proceedings before the SC.

On Tuesday, the Lucknow bench of Allahabad HC had dismissed a similar plea, citing its pendency before the SC.

Title: Fatima Sana Shaikh opens up on the expectations she has set for herself; read more
Content: After impressing the audience with his stellar performance in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' as Udaybhan Singh Rathore, Saif Ali Khan is all set to step into the shoes of another negative character. The talented actor will be going face-to-face with Prabhas in Om Raut's upcoming film 'Adipurush'.Saif, who started his career with 'Parampara' in 1993 has gone on to deliver several blockbusters on the silver screen. The versatile actor, who is known for taking up challenging and entertaining roles, has always managed to do justice to his characters. While the news of Saif stepping in as Lankesh in Adipurush' has got fans excited, we take a look at the dark and negative characters which the skilled actor has essayed on the silver screen.

Title: Bookie Chawla back from UK in 1st big extradition under 27-yr-old treaty
Content:
Sanjeev Chawla, who was allegedly involved in a match-fixing racket that was busted by the Delhi Police in the... Read More

NEW DELHI: Sanjeev Chawla , wanted in a match-fixing case dating back to 2000, was extradited to India from the UK on Thursday, the first high-profile repatriation in the last 27 years since an extradition treaty between the two countries came into force. He was remanded in Delhi Police custody for 12 days.Chawla was wanted since a probe revealed his alleged nexus with former South African captain Hansie Cronje and other cricketers in fixing matches. Cronje died in a plane crash in 2002.The move is being considered a diplomatic win and big achievement for Indian intelligence and law enforcement agencies that pursued his extradition for five years.A three-member team led by DCP Ram Gopal Naik brought Chawla from London on an AI aircraft which landed at 11.40am at IGI.Chawla was in seat 27B, between two police officers, on the flight. He ate dinner and had casual conversations with the cops through the flight.Police will interrogate him about the conspiracy he allegedly hatched to lure Indian and foreign cricketers into performing as per the requirements of bookies.Chawla had been living in southeast London's Kennington area after fleeing India in 2000, and had been engaged in business there, he has claimed. Chawla is the third to be arrested in the case. Alleged bookie Rajesh Kalra and actor Krishan Kumar were arrested when the scandal broke in 2000. Chawla is being questioned by a special team of the crime branch that will take him to the venue of the match and to Mumbai to track down his contacts and network. Mumbai Police, Delhi Police's special cell and the CBI also are likely to seek custody of Chawla, sources said."Ever since a chargesheet was filed in 2013, we had been writing to the authorities in London to arrest Chawla and extradite him. The extradition process started in 2013. An application was filed before the Westminster magistrates' court. Chawla had moved court in 2017 and got some relief. The court sought a clarification from the crime branch regarding the nature of the probe, which we provided on January 7, 2019. After this, a fresh extradition request was presented before HC ," DCP Naik said.In Video: Delhi court sends alleged bookie Sanjeev Chawla to 12 days police custody

Title: MMRDA to monetise 25-acre plot in Kurla
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Mother Dairy, shut down few decades back, will be revamped

MUMBAI: Prime 25-acre verdant land in Kurla , which once housed Mother Dairy complex, will be taken over by Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) for commercial exploitation. Officials said MMRDA will monetise the land to fund metro projects. The land is under state government's department of animal husbandry, dairy and fisheries.

About 10,000 sqm of the dairy land (2.5 acres) was recently surrendered to MMRDA for a viaduct and station of the upcoming Metro 2B line.

The dairy, shut down few decades back, will be revived and revamped by MMRDA. A residential building for dairy staff will be built by MMRDA.

The remaining larger portion will be used for real estate development. MMRDA is looking at mixed-used development, comprising residential and commercial areas.

MMRDA commissioner RA Rajeev said it would be premature to say how much the authority will earn from the land, but property experts said it could be worth over Rs 1,000 crore given its location below Santa Cruz-Chembur Link Road and adjoining Kurla terminus.

MMRDA is expecting a floor space index of 4 to develop the land, but the property's proximity to the airport will curb the buildings' height. "The height restrictions will mean we cannot build over 12 floors,'' said the official.

But the challenge will be large tree cover on the land. There are several hundred trees on the property and any proposal to hack them is likely to raise the heckles of environmentalists. But officials said the proposed development will be around the trees. "We will ensure these trees are not touched,'' they said.

MMRDA recently invited bids for architectural services for development of the land.

In 2017, Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation (MMRC), executing Metro 3 (Cuffe Parade-Seepz), had also planned to commercially exploit land within the eco-sensitive Aarey Milk colony.

Around 8.6 acres of 81 acres reserved for the metro car shed within Aarey was to be used for "real estate development''.

MMRC had asked the government for an FSI of 3 for construction inside Aarey. This would have allowed it to build over 15 lakh sq ft worth Rs 2,000 crore.

But when protests started against the metro's encroachment inside Aarey, the plan to commercially exploit the land was dropped.

Title: BEST plans to go cashless for ticketing
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

BEST currently issues tickets through hand-held electronic machines which will now help generate e-tickets on ... Read More

MUMBAI: The BEST wants to make your ride 'cashless'.

On Thursday, the BEST committee cleared a proposal to include three new digital payment systems to book mobile tickets through an app to travel on red buses in future.

The proposals were cleared for Phonepe Pvt Ltd, Pay Point India Network Pvt Ltd. and One97 Communications Limited - all of which were found technically suitable, said BEST general manager Surendrakumar Bagde.

BEST currently issues tickets through hand-held electronic machines which will now help generate e-tickets on cellphones.

"We've decided to have more digital application service providers for ticketing via digital payment," said Bagde.

Title: Trinamool skips inauguration of E-W Metro
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Kolkata: Trinamool Congress “boycotted” East West Metro’s inauguration on Thursday after the Railways issued the invitation card without naming chief minister Mamata Banerjee.

Protyush Ghosh, Metro Railway’s DGM (general), handed over an invite to Nabanna at 10.10am on Thursday ahead of the 5pm inauguration by Union railway minister Piyush Goyal. The CM was in Durgapur on Thursday for an administrative meeting. The railways claimed that its earlier letter to Nabanna seeking to include the CM’s name in the list of invitees didn’t evoke any response.

Kolkata mayor Firhad Hakim said: “The CM, during her tenure as railway minister, had given impetus to this project. E-W Metro was under the state and central urban development departments. Mamata Banerjee brought it under the ambit of railways. It was on her instruction that the state eased the land and other infrastructural bottlenecks to fast-pace the project. Not inviting her is not only discourteous but uncivilised.”

Minister Tapas Ray said: “This is being discourteous.” Tourism minister Gautam Deb added: “We do not expect much courtesies from BJP either.”

Barasat MP Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar, Bidhannagar MLA and state fire services minister Sujit Bose and Bidhanagar Municipal Corporation chairperson Krishna Chakraborty, who had been invited to the inauguration, decided to give the event a miss. “E-W Metro was the brainchild of Mamata Banerjee during her tenure as railway minister from 2009-11. It was Banerjee who had sanctioned money (for the project) in the railway budget. Now, when the project is being inaugurated, she has not been invited. This is an insult to Banerjee and the people of Bengal,” Dastidar said.

Metro GM Manoj Joshi said” “All procedures were followed in issuing invites.”

A Railway officer said: “The CM’s name cannot be included in any official programme without a formal approval. This is not the same for local MPs, MLAs and civic body chiefs. An officer still went there on Thursday morning to learn that the CM is not in Kolkata.”

State BJP chief Dilip Ghosh said TMC is “paying for its past sins”. “During Left rule, Mamata Banerjee, as railway minister, had not invited then chief minister Buddhadeb Bhattacharjee on several occasions. So, they (TMC) should be the last to talk about courtesy,” he said.

Union minister Babul Supriyo said: “I want to thank the state government for all the support to get this project moving. I wish the state representatives were here today.”

Title: Coronavirus in Kolkata: 2.7k km away, coronavirus scare keeps foodies from Chinatown
Content:
A Tangra local walks past a deserted restaurant on Thursday

KOLKATA: India’s biggest Chinatown , in the east Kolkata district of Tangra, has ended up being an unwitting victim of coronavirus that has already claimed more than 1,300 lives in mainland China.Tangra, the origin of “Tangra-type Chinese food” that now has a pan-India presence, has not had a single coronavirus infection so far (like the rest of Kolkata and Bengal). But the district — home to nearly 40 eateries big and small — has seen a significant dip in footfall despite being 2,700km from the disease’s epicentre in China’s Wuhan, with a large section of foodies suddenly having lost their appetite for Chinese food.Tangra has around 2,500 Chinese-Indians and Kolkata’s other (and older) Chinatown, Tiretta Bazar, has around 2,000. But not a single family may have any direct link with the mainland, as most of the younger generation has emigrated to countries like Canada, Australia, the US and Sweden. That, however, does not seem to have stopped foodies from establishing some link between the disease in China and the Chinese cuisine in Kolkata.The result: a nearly deserted Tangra last weekend (February 7-9), with several restaurants reporting a 50%-60% drop in footfall from usual weekends.China imposed a lockdown in Wuhan on January 23, putting curbs on people entering or exiting the city from where the virus spread. A fortnight later, just when China is planning to ease some curbs to get the workforce back on its feet, an irrational phobia seems to have pushed gastronomes away from the Cantonese, Manchurian, Hunan and Schezwan dishes that can draw up to 10,000 visitors on a busy Saturday.Mathew Chen, owner of Shun Li, a small family-run restaurant located opposite the Chinese Kali Mandir deep in Tangra, said customer count had gone down from 81 on the first Saturday of the month (February 1) to 43 this Saturday (February 8), which resulted in a Rs-17,000 loss for a single day. For larger restaurants, like Big Boss and Kim Ling that are situated closer to Chinatown’s entrance and receive over 1,000 customers on Saturday, the loss was in excess of Rs 4 lakh.“Our business is steady round the year with sales spiking during festive seasons and weekends, particularly between October and February when the weather is pleasant. I cannot recall a single weekend-to-weekend dip in recent years like the one between Febraury 1 and 8,” Chen said.Customers who reach Big Boss after 2 p.m. for lunch or after 8 p.m. for dinner on weekends have to usually wait for a table. But, on February 8, the restaurant went almost empty with only a few tables occupied at peak hours. Manager S Chang said he had read the signs when regular customers started calling to inquire whether they would contract the flu if they came over to dine.“Guests have become curious about what sauces and ingredients are used and from where they are sourced. I assured them that everything was locally sourced but many decided to stay away,” Chang said.Owners of Beijing and Golden Joy, two high-capacity restaurants, acknowledged footfall was down but claimed they were not as badly impacted as some others. “It is a little bit up and down. Kolkata has no connection with this flu. Not a single case has been confirmed in the city. So what is this scare about?” wondered Monica Lieu, owner of Beijing and Kim Ling restaurants in Tangra. “In any case, we do not source anything from China,” Robert Liao of Golden Joy said.Chinese Indian Association president Bean Ching Law said several of his friends, all well-educated, had asked about the threat of contracting the virus if they visited Chinatown.“Chinese-Indians in Tangra have no family ties with mainland China for at least a couple of generations. Only a handful has re-established business ties. Chinese-Indians come over to Tangra during the Chinese New Year from Canada, the US, Australia and Sweden. The fear, therefore, is completely irrational,” Lieu said.Medical opinion supports this view. No virus would survive the Tangra Chinese food cooked at high temperatures on a blazing flame, virologist Amitabha Nandy said. “There can be no justification for not going to Chinatown either because there are Chinese-Indians living there or Chinese food is served,” he said.

Title: Mamata Banerjee: Mamata raps private hosps for Swasthya Sathi refusals
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Durgapur: Chief minister Mamata Banerjee has prescribed penal action against private hospitals that refuse admission to people having Swasthya Sathi health cards.

“A couple of private hospitals enlisted as service providers under Swasthya Sathi are known to have dishonoured health cards. They can’t do this. The hospital industry has to take a humane approach. We are paying Rs 1,200 crore to service providers under health insurance package. District magistrates should charge penalty on these hospitals,” Banerjee said at the administrative meeting in Durgapur on Thursday.

The CM also prescribed the procedure for lodging public complaints. “Whenever an enlisted private hospital denies treatment to a Swasthya Sathi card-holder, he should lodge a general diary at a nearby police station. The inspector-in-charge will take up the complaint with the district magistrate and the chief medical officer of health and take penal action. The government may also cancel the hospital’s licence, if necessary,” she said.

The DM of Paschim Burdwan reported that his office had received 3,285 such refusal complaints through the Swasthya Sathi web portal and mobile app. “We have taken up each complaint with the hospitals and made the service provider treat the patient,” said DM Shashank Sethi. The CM also took stock of grievance redress in the district with special focus on Kanksa block, home to Scheduled Castes.

Thursday was the second day after Bankura that the CM told the state bureaucracy she won’t compromise on public delivery mechanism. Banerjee asked the public works department to speed up construction work on the Durgapur university campus and also in colleges. Unlike BJP in Delhi that focussed on CAA and Shaheen Bagh, Banerjee has taken care to ensure better delivery mechanism on which she wants to build her anti-CAA campaign.

Banerjee’s emphasis on improving public relation and delivery became apparent when she asked the Durgapur mayor to blend his administrative acumen with pressing needs of the public. “I know you have a lot of administrative experience. But you should take inputs from the public as well. There are so many trade licence applications pending. Try to sort it out,” she said. State labour minister Moloy Ghatak was also asked to take a flexible stand to resolve industrial disputes.

Title: CAA Protest in Kolkata: 'Khilafat' rises again, this time against CAA
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Kids protest at Park Circus Maidan on Thursday

KOLKATA: The Calcutta Khilafat Committee , which was formed a century ago after the Jallianwala Bagh massacre to unite Hindus and Muslims against the British, is joining Kolkata’s Shaheen Baghs in protesting against the new citizenship law, marking its return to socio-political movement.

In the past few decades, Khilafat — which counts among its members businessmen, doctors, senior police officers and advocates — has kept itself restricted to organising Eid prayers on Red Road and cultural programmes. Its return, thus, marks the willingness of the “Muslim elite”, often accused of staying in an ivory tower, in joining a mass movement.

Those who closely track developments within the community are not attaching much importance to Khilafat joining the anti-CAA protests, as the outfit, now anachronistic, lacks the ability to struggle on the streets. Others, however, see Khilafat as a galvanising force which, by virtue of its legacy, could help bring people from all communities on board.

“Khilafat,” said Sakir Randerian, president of Calcutta Khilafat Committee, “played a crucial role in uniting Hindus and Muslims in the struggle for India’s freedom. It had very close links with Mahatma Gandhi, Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, C R Das, Maulana Abul Kalam Azad. We hope to play the role of a galvanising force once again against the new citizenship law, uniting people from various communities and social strata.”

The first anti-CAA protest by Khilafat includes a silent rally on Saturday from Central Avenue to Park Circus Maidan, where several women have been demonstrating against CAA and NRC for over a month. It then plans to start a dialogue with the intelligentsia of different communities. A legal cell has already been formed.

Khilafat was a pan-Islamist movement, where the Muslims of the then British India allied with the Indian Nationalist Congress against the British. The first-floor office of Khilafat on 8 Zakaria Street, opposite the Nakhoda mosque, was a meeting place of several freedom fighters, including Mahatma Gandhi. The members have preserved a chair and table which Netaji would use whenever he visited.

Calcutta Khilafat Committee also appoints Qari Fazlur Rahman to lead the Eid prayers every year, which is attended by lakhs of people, most of whom come from far-flung areas in the districts. Khilafat plans to use its goodwill in the state’s hinterland to create awareness about CAA and NRC.

“Khilafat has a goodwill in the hinterland and we plan to create awareness about CAA and NRC,” said Mohammad Nurul Haque, a general surgeon associated with several hospitals in the city. “We also plan to engage with society at large to involve people from other communities too, because CAA and NRC impact everybody.” Haque is also the chairman of the committee on the anti-CAA movement. Calcutta Khilafat Committee has only 22 permanent members, many of whom are in the police force, administration and lawyers and doctors.

“We have called in experts to provide legal help,” said Mullick Mohammad Ishaque, an executive member.

Those who track political and social turns within the community in the state closely say Khilafat does not have any significant record of socio-political movement in the recent past. “They have reacted very late to the movement, so it remains to be seen how much trust they can inspire and impact they can make. It is an anachronistic organisation with a lot of nostalgia, but it remains to be seen if they can struggle on the streets,” said political scientist Hasnain Imam.

Title: Miffed at convocation ‘rebuff’, Bengal guv serves notice on VC
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Kolkata: Bengal governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday served a show-cause notice on the vice chancellor of Cooch Behar Panchanan Barma University in north Bengal for “seriously compromising the dignity and position of the chancellor”. The notice came just 24 hours ahead of the university’s third convocation on Friday.

Dhankhar, in his show-cause notice, mentioned that the chancellor being head of the university has not received any notice/intimation for holding of the convocation till date.

The governor invoked his disciplinary powers a day after tweeting dismay over VC holding the convocation keeping chancellor in the dark. “Ministers Partha Chatterjee, Goutam Deb, Rabindranath Ghosh and Binay Krishna Barman are invited to the convocation. Chancellor, who has right to preside, has just no information. Where are we heading,” Dhankhar tweeted.

VC Debkumar Mukhopadhyay said the varsity has done everything according to rules. “I can only say that we intimated all concerned, following government rules,” he said.

The new rules framed by the state government under the West Bengal College & University (Administration & Regulation) Act leave no scope for VCs to communicate directly with the university head, the chancellor. State universities have to propose the convocation date to the higher education department, which takes the final call. Rules provide that the government may intimate the convocation date to the chancellor, marking a shift in the procedure of communication from chancellor to the government.

“The university intimated us about the convocation,” a higher education official said. But he didn’t clarify if the government had kept Raj Bhavan posted on the date.

The notice comes as first step for removal of the VC under Section 9 of the Act. However, it is easy done than said because the governor has to act on the advice of the state government, particularly the higher education minister.

Mukhopadhyay has been told to respond within a fortnight.

Title: Balurghat district hosp starts separate ward for transgenders
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Malda: Balurghat District Hospital has come up with a four-bedded ward for transgenders. Transgender activist Jayita Mandal said she sees this as a great victory for people belonging to the third gender. It was opened in the hospital’s ground floor on Tuesday. The health department is planning a similar initiative at Gangarampore sub-divisional hospital as well.

South Dinajpur district alone has more than 500 transgender people, who have been facing acute problems from getting hospitalized.

In many cases, it could not be decided in which ward the trans people would be kept. They also faced resistance from other patients while using the toilet or bed. Many times, to avoid embarrassment, ailing transgenders were released from hospital just by giving medicines.

Mandal, president of Dinajpur Notun Alo Society, said: “We have been fighting for long for our basic rights like treatment, toilet and reservation. Last week, we had a meeting with district legal service authority chief Kusumika De Mitra, who assured to take up our issue with the health department.”

Chief medical officer of health Sukumar Dey said: “In this ward, patients from other gender will not be admitted. Here, the patients would get exactly the same attention of doctors and nurses as in other wards.” He hoped that the number of beds could be increased in the future keeping in mind the demand.

Title: VB student arrested for assaulting girl
Content:
This story is from February 14, 2020

Santiniketan: A second-year student of design department at Visva-Bharati’s Kala Bhavana was arrested on Thursday for allegedly assaulting a girl of the same department.

In the complaint, the girl alleged that the accused and his associates had chased and assaulted her around 2km away from the university campus on Wednesday night. However, it is not clear why the girl had gone there at night as she was not available for comment.

Anirban Sarkar, PRO of Visva-Bharati, said: “We have not been informed about the incident. Something may have happened outside the university campus but we have not received any complaint.” Birbhum SP Shyam Singh confirmed the arrest.

Title: shalini kandukuri: The best day of my life was when Shalini said ‘yes’: Nithiin
Content: Nithiin, known for his lover boy roles in Telugu romcoms, now has a love story of his own. The A..Aa star is all set to tie the knot with long-time girlfriend Shalini Kandukuri , and the actor can’t stop smiling whenever he talks about her. His eyes light up at the very mention of his bride-to-be and he says he can’t wait to spend the rest of his life with her. “There’s nothing filmy about our love story. There was no love at first sight or parents dramatically opposing our union. Nor were there any grand romantic gestures or wooing from either of us,” says Nithiin , adding,“But there is a lot of love and understanding between us. And at the end of the day, that’s all that matters.”A Hyderabad girl, Shalini has a Master’s in Business Management from a UK university and has recently returned to the city. “We’ve known each other for eight years now. We met through common friends and clicked instantly. We started out as friends and it was only much later, around five years ago, that love bloomed between us,” Nithiin reveals. The actor feels that the best part about his relationship with Shalini is the fact that everything happened so organically. “I did not try to woo her. In fact, neither of us tried too hard. Our relationship evolved so naturally that we knew we loved each other and we didn’t really have to say it out aloud to prove a point. We just knew that we wanted to spend the rest of our lives together. It’s a mature relationship built on understanding and trust,” Nithiin shares.Although Nithiin didn’t bring out the filmy, romantic hero in him during the five year-long courtship with Shalini, when it was time to pop the question, he decided to unleash his romantic side. “When it was time to propose to her, I wanted it to be zara hatke. I didn’t want to do the usual drill of going down on one knee and popping the question or shower her with roses. Instead, I decided to stand on one leg and propose to her,” he laughs, adding, “I just wanted to do something different, funny and memorable. I guess it really paid off. not only did it make her laugh, she immediately said, ‘yes’.”Nithiin was admittedly, in a “serious relationship” for five long years as he was always certain that Shalini was ‘the one’ for him. “I don’t believe in casual dating. I think that’s nonsense. From day one, I knew that I want to spend the rest of my life with Shalini. It was never frivolous between us. The only reason it took this long for us to get married is because we were both busy with our respective careers,” says the 36-year-old.Early last year, Nithiin and Shalini decided to tell their parents about their relationship. “We wanted to get married and we decided it was time to tell our families. They were surprised but were happy that we found love. Both families were open-minded and accepted our relationship. Cinema ibbandulu em levu (there were no filmy style oppositions from either party),” the actor shares.what is it about Shalini that makes him smile from ear-to-ear whenever he speaks of her, we ask. “It’s a very long list. Of course, she’s gorgeous. but other than that, I really love her simplicity. She has brought out the best in me in the last few years. She understands me and my profession both, and she treats everyone with equal love and care. She’s also gotten along really well with my family, it’s hard not to fall in love with someone like that,” he says, blushing . The actor proudly shares that Shalini has watched all of his films and even has her own list of favourites. “She loves Ishq, Gunde Jaari Gallanthayyinde and A...Aa. But of course, she likes them all because they’re my films. She has no choice really,” he says, laughing.Nithiin and Shalini will have a pre-wedding function at his Hyderabad residence on February 15, followed by an engagement set for April 15 and a destination wedding in Dubai on April 16. “The wedding will take place in Dubai and the preparations are on. We’re still trying to decide on the theme for the wedding because I’m busy with the shoot of Rang De. But of course, it’ll be special. After the wedding there will be a reception in Hyderabad for all my friends and the film industry. But the wedding will be a close-knit family affair. The best day of my life so far has been the day I proposed and she said yes, but that’s going to change pretty soon,” says a beaming Nithiin, signing off.
